-----------------------------
Śrī Śrī Nitāi-Chaitanya-Ārati
jaya guru mahārāja karuṇā-sāgara
śrī bhakti rakṣaka deva-gosvāmī śrīdhara

(1) All glories to Śrīla Guru Mahārāj, Śrīla Bhakti Rakṣak Śrīdhar Dev-Goswāmī Mahārāj who is like an ocean of mercy.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Nitāi-Chaitanya-Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
entities: Śrīla Bhakti Rakṣak Śrīdhar Dev-Goswāmī Mahārāj
metadata.summary: A devotional song offering praise to Śrīla Guru Mahārāj and Śrīla Bhakti Rakṣak Śrīdhar Dev-Goswāmī Mahārāj.

text:
prakāśile nīlāchale bhuvana-maṅgala
nitāi-chaitanya-deva-sevā samujjvala

(2) By his mercy, Śrī Śrī Nitāi-Chaitanyadeva have manifested in Puri Dhām bestowing auspiciousness upon the whole world and revealing their effulgent devotional service.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Nitāi-Chaitanya-Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Śrī Nitāi-Chaitanyadeva have manifested in Puri Dhām bestowing auspiciousness upon the whole world.

text:
gorāpreme mātoyārā nityānanda-rūpa
rasarāja mahābhāva chaitanya-svarūpa

(3) Śrī Nityānanda Prabhu’s form is dancing ecstatically intoxicated with divine love for Śrī Gaura, whose manifestation is Rasarāj Śrī Krishna taking the heart and halo of Mahābhāva, Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Nitāi-Chaitanya-Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Nityānanda Prabhu is described as dancing ecstatically in love for Śrī Gaura, who is a manifestation of Rasarāj Śrī Krishna.

text:
kasita-kāñchana jini śrī-aṅga labaṇi
du̐hu̐gale vanamālā bhāvera dolanī

(4) Both Lords are standing fully effulgent, glowing just like freshly cut gold, as garlands of various beautiful forest flowers play on their necks.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Nitāi-Chaitanya-Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Both Kṛṣṇa and Rādhā are standing fully effulgent, glowing like freshly cut gold, with garlands of forest flowers on their necks.

text:
murachita koṭikāma rūparāsaraṅge
madhura nartana-bhāva varābhaya bhaṅge

(5) Millions and millions of Cupids fall unconscious before the divine feet of Their Lordships, seeing their beauty as their divine forms playfully sway to and fro. They are dancing, touching the hearts of everyone and freely bestowing mercy upon the conditioned souls.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Nitāi-Chaitanya-Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Millions of Cupids fall unconscious before the divine feet of Kṛṣṇa and His associates, seeing their beauty as they dance and bestow mercy.

text:
koṭi-chandra-bhānuśobhā ratna-siṁhāsane
prema netre dekhe mahā-bhāgyavāna jane

(6) Brilliant like millions of moons They stand effulgent upon Their jewelled throne. The fortunate souls, their devotional eyes full of love and affection can see Their divine forms.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Nitāi-Chaitanya-Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Kṛṣṇa is described as standing effulgent upon a jewelled throne, visible to fortunate souls with devotional eyes.

text:
mṛdaṅga mandirā bāje suśaṅkha-dhvanita
śruti-mauli-ratnamālā-dīpa nirājita

(7) In the temple during the ārati, the mṛdaṅgas resound sweetly as conchshells are blown and the ghee lamp is offered. The different parts of the Vedas within bhakti yoga have taken form in each light as a bhakti yoga light and through this form they are worshipping Their Lordships in the ārati.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Nitāi-Chaitanya-Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The different parts of the Vedas within bhakti yoga have taken form in each light as a bhakti yoga light and through this form they are worshipping Their Lordships in the ārati.

text:
bhuvana-mohana du̐hu̐ rūpera ārati
gupta-vṛndāraṇya-vāsī dekhe niravadhi

(8) This type of ārati is only seen by the residents of Nabadwīp Dhām and the dear associates of Śrī Chaitanya. Anyone who sees it will be extremely charmed by it.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Nitāi-Chaitanya-Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A special type of ārati is only seen by the residents of Nabadwīp Dhām and the associates of Śrī Chaitanya.

text:
śrī svarūpa rāmānanda rūpa-sanātana
raghunātha haridāsa gadādhara dhana

(9) Śrī Chaitanya’s dear associates, Śrī Swarūp Dāmodar, Rāmānanda Rāya, Rūpa Goswāmī, Sanātan Goswāmī, Raghunāth Dās Goswāmī, Haridās Ṭhākur and Gadādhara Paṇḍit are seeing and performing this ārati.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Nitāi-Chaitanya-Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Chaitanya's associates perform ārati.

text:
sārvabhauma gopīnātha jīvānuga-jana
dekhena ārati-śobha durllabha-darśana

(10) Sārvabhauma Bhaṭṭāchārya, Gopīnāth Āchārya and the followers in the sampradāya of Jīva Goswāmī are all seeing that ārati which is unable to be seen by others.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Nitāi-Chaitanya-Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Sārvabhauma Bhaṭṭāchārya, Gopīnāth Āchārya, and Jīva Goswāmī's followers are seeing a special ārati that is difficult to see.

text:
nadīyā prakāśe nityānanda-gauranidhi
patita-pāvana-kṣetre milāila vidhi

(11) Śrī Nityānanda and Śrī Gaura Mahāprabhu have manifested eternally in Nabadwīp Dhām, Nadia. But now Their divine forms have manifested in Puri Dhām, mercifully given by our fortune-maker, Śrī Gurudeva.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Nitāi-Chaitanya-Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Nityānanda and Śrī Gaura Mahāprabhu have manifested in Puri Dhām.

text:
avichintya nityānanda-chaitanya-prakāśa
śrī guru-prasāde dekhe ei adhama dāsa
(śrī guru-prasāde dekhe śrī govinda dāsa)

(12) Inconceivably Śrī Śrī Nitāi-Chaitanya have manifested and through the mercy of Śrī Gurudeva this fallen soul sees Their ārati and joins within the saṅkīrtan.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Nitāi-Chaitanya-Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee sees the ārati of Śrī Śrī Nitāi-Chaitanya through the mercy of Śrī Gurudeva and joins in the saṅkīrtan.

text:
------------------------
Śrī Śachīnandana-vandanā
jaya śachīnandana sura-muni-vandana,
bhava-bhaya-khaṇḍana jayo he
jaya hari-kīrtana nartanā vartana,
kalimala-kartana jayo he

(1) All glories to Śrī Krishna Chaitanya Mahāprabhu, the son of Śachī Devī. Great sages and demigods always sing His praise, for by doing so, the fear of repeated birth and death is cut to pieces. All glories to the kīrtan of the Holy Name of Krishna, for when one chants the Holy Name of Krishna and dances in ecstasy, the filth of this age of Kali disappears.

metadata.title: Śrī Śachīnandana-vandanā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The song praises Śrī Krishna Chaitanya Mahāprabhu and the benefits of chanting His Holy Name.

text:
nayana-purandara viśvarūpa snehadhara,
viśvambhara viśvera kalyāṇa
jaya lakṣmī-viṣṇupriyā viśvambhara priyahiyā,
jaya priya kiṅkara īśāna

(2) Śrī Chaitanya delights all eyes with His charming beauty. He is the most dearly beloved Lord of all and the intimate brother of Viśvarūp. He brings the highest auspiciousness to everyone, for He floods the entire universe with the nectar of love of Godhead and thus saves all living beings. All glories to Lakṣmī Priyā and Viṣṇu Priyā Devī, who are very dear to Śrī Nimāi Paṇḍit. All glories to Their family servant, Īśāna.

metadata.title: Śrī Śachīnandana-vandanā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Chaitanya delights all eyes with His charming beauty and brings the highest auspiciousness to everyone.

text:
śrī sītā-advaita-rāy mālinī-śrīvāsa jay,
jay chandraśekhara āchārya
jay nityānanda rāy gadādhara jay jay,
jaya haridās nāmāchārya

(3) All glories to Sītā Ṭhākurāṇī and Śrī Advaita Āchārya, all glories to Mālinī-devī and Śrīvās Ṭhākur, and all glories to Āchārya Chandraśekhara. All glories to Śrīla Nityānanda Prabhu, Śrīla Gadādhara Paṇḍit and Śrīla Haridās Ṭhākur, the Nāmāchārya.

metadata.title: Śrī Śachīnandana-vandanā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song glorifying various Vaishnava personalities.

text:
murāri mukunda jay premanidhi mahāśaya,
jaya jata prabhu pāriṣad
vandi savākāra pāya adhamere kṛpā hoy,
bhakti sapārṣada-prabhupād

(4) All glories to Murāri Gupta, and all glories to Mukunda Datta. All glories to all the other eternal associates of Śrī Chaitanya Mahāprabhu. By singing the glories of Śrīla Prabhupād and all those great souls who are eternal associates of Śrī Chaitanya Mahāprabhu, even the lowest of men can obtain the highest treasure of love.

metadata.title: Śrī Śachīnandana-vandanā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Singing the glories of Śrīla Prabhupād and other eternal associates of Śrī Chaitanya Mahāprabhu can bring love even to the lowest of men.

text:
------------------
Śrī Śrī Gurvāṣṭaka
saṁsāra-dāvānala-līḍha-loka-
trāṇāya kāruṇya-ghanāghanatvam
prāptasya kalyāṇa-guṇārṇavasya
vande guroḥ śrī-charaṇāravindam

(1) I worship the lotus feet of the Divine Master, who is the ocean of auspicious qualities. Just to deliver all planes of life that are suffering in the forest fire of the material world, he, as the rain-cloud of mercy, melts to shower down the waters of compassion.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Gurvāṣṭaka
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song worshiping the guru as the ocean of auspicious qualities.

text:
mahāprabhoḥ kīrtana-nṛtya-gīta-
vāditra-mādyan-manaso rasena
romāñcha-kampāśru-taraṅga-bhājo
vande guroḥ śrī-charaṇāravindam

(2) I worship the lotus feet of the Divine Master, whose heart is maddened in nectarean love for Śrīman Mahāprabhu by the grand congregational chanting of the Holy Name. Dancing, singing, and playing the khol and karatāls,etc.; his body thrills with joy, trembles, and waves of tears flow from his eyes.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Gurvāṣṭaka
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee worships the Divine Master, whose heart is filled with love for Śrīman Mahāprabhu due to the congregational chanting of the Holy Name.

text:
śrī-vigrahārādhana-nitya-nānā-
śṛṅgāra-tan-mandira-mārjanādau
yuktasya bhaktāṁś cha niyuñjato ’pi
vande guroḥ śrī-charaṇāravindam

(3) I worship the lotus feet of the Divine Master, who personally engages in many types of worshipful services such as dressing the deity and cleansing the Lord’s holy temple, and similarly engages the devotees (in his retinue).

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Gurvāṣṭaka
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotees are engaged in various services by the Divine Master.

text:
chatur-vidha-śrī-bhagavat-prasāda
svādv-anna-tṛptān hari-bhakta-saṅghān
kṛtvaiva tṛptiṁ bhajataḥ sadaiva
vande guroḥ śrī-charaṇāravindam

(4) I worship the lotus feet of the Divine Master, who fully satisfies the devotees of Śrī Krishna with four types of nectarean prasādam foodstuffs that are chewed, sucked, licked, and drunk (that is, he brings about the dispellation of mundanity and the awakening of the joy of love that develops from respecting prasādam), and he is thereby himself satisfied.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Gurvāṣṭaka
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotees of Śrī Krishna are fully satisfied with four types of nectarean prasādam foodstuffs.

text:
śrī-rādhikā-mādhavayor apara
mādhurya-līlā-guṇa-rūpa-nāmnām
prati-kṣaṇāsvādana-lolupasya
vande guroḥ śrī-charaṇaravindam

(5) I worship the lotus feet of the Divine Master, whose heart is insatiably desirous of tasting the infinite Holy Names, Forms, Qualities and Pastimes of Śrī Rādhā-Mādhava that are full of the sweetness of love divine.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Gurvāṣṭaka
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee worships the Divine Master for his love of the Holy Names and pastimes of Śrī Rādhā-Mādhava.

text:
nikuñja-yūno rati-keli-siddhyair
yā yālibhir yuktir apekṣaṇīyā
tatrāti-dākṣyād ati-vallabhasya
vande guroḥ śrī-charaṇāravindam

(6) I worship the lotus feet of the Divine Master, who is extremely dear to the Supreme Divine Couple who sport in the groves of Vraja, because he is greatly expert in those appropriate engagements that are performed by the sakhīs in order to serve the amorous Pastimes of the Divine Couple.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Gurvāṣṭaka
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The text describes the Divine Master's expertise in facilitating the amorous pastimes of the Supreme Divine Couple in Vraja.

text:
sākṣād-dharitvena samasta-śāstrair
uktas tathā bhāvyata eva sadbhiḥ
kintu prabhor yaḥ priya eva tasya
vande guroḥ śrī-charaṇāravindam

(7) I worship the lotus feet of the Divine Master (who is the simultaneously inconceivably distinct and nondistinct manifest embodiment of the Supreme Personality of Godhead): all the Scriptures sing the glories of his being the direct non-different form of the Supreme Lord Śrī Hari, and the pure saints also concede this; yet, he is the most beloved of the Lord.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Gurvāṣṭaka
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee worships the Divine Master, who is the embodiment of the Supreme Personality of Godhead.

text:
yasya prasādād bhagavat-prasādo
yasyāprasādāt na gatiḥ kuto ’pi
dhyayaṁ stuvaṁs tasya yaśas tri-sandhyaṁ
vande guroḥ śrī-charaṇaravindam

(8) I worship the lotus feet of the Divine Master, ever singing his glories and meditating upon him at the three junctions of the day. By his grace alone one gains the grace of the Lord, and if he is displeased the soul has no shelter anywhere.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Gurvāṣṭaka
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee worships the Divine Master, praising his glories and meditating on him throughout the day.

text:
śrīmad guroraṣṭakam etad uchair
brāhme muhūrte paṭhati prayātnāt
yas tena vṛndāvana-nātha-sākṣāt-
sevaiva labhyā januṣo ’nta eva

(9) One who, during the Brāhma-muhūrta (nintysix minutes before sunrise) with meticulous regularity wholeheartedly sings these eight prayers to the Divine Master, attains, upon leaving the body in his spiritual perfection, the qualification to engage in the direct service of the Lord of Vṛndāvan.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Gurvāṣṭaka
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Singing Śrīmad Guroraṣṭakam during Brāhma-muhūrta leads to direct service of Vṛndāvana-nātha after spiritual perfection.

text:
-----------
Bhajan-gīti
bhaja re bhaja re āmār mana ati manda
(bhajan vinā gati nāi re)
(vraja-bane rādhā-kṛṣṇa bhajan vinā gati nāi re)
(bhaja) vraja-bane rādhā-kṛṣṇa-charaṇāravinda
(jñāna-karma parihari’ re)
(śuddha rāga patha dhari jñāna-karma parihari)

(1) O my mind, how foolish you are. Just worship the lotus feet of Rādhā and Krishna in the forest of Vraja. Without such worship there is no means of spiritual advancement. Give up all speculative knowledge and materialistic activities and just worship Rādhā and Krishna in the forests of Vraja.

metadata.title: Bhajan-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The song Bhajan-gīti encourages the worship of Rādhā and Krishna in the forest of Vraja for spiritual advancement.

text:
(bhaja) gaura-gadādharādvaita-guru-nityānanda
(gaura-kṛṣṇe abhede jene)
(guru kṛṣṇa-priya jene gaura-kṛṣne abheda jene re)
śrīnivāsa, haridāsa, murāri, mukunda
(gaura-preme smara smara re)
(śrīnivāsa, haridāse, gaura-preme smara re)

(2) You  should  worship  and  serve  Lord  Gaura, Gadādhara, Advaita, and the original Spiritual Master, Lord Nityānanda. Knowing Lord Gaura and Lord Krishna to be the same, and knowing the Spiritual Master to be very dear to Krishna, you should remember the dear associates of Lord Chaitanya, such as Śrīvās Ṭhākur, Haridās Ṭhākur, Murāri Gupta, and Mukunda Datta. In deep love for Lord Gaura, you should remember the two great personalities Śrīvās Ṭhākur and Haridās Ṭhākur.

metadata.title: Bhajan-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song encouraging the worship and service of Lord Gaura and his associates.

text:
rūpa-sanātana-jīva-raghunātha-dvandva
(jadi bhajan korbe re)
(rūpa-sanātane smaran jadi bhajan korbe re)
rāghava-gopāla-bhaṭṭa-svarūpa-rāmānanda
(kṛṣṇa prema jadi chāo re)
(svarūpa-rāmānande smara
kṛṣṇa-prema jadi chāo re)

(3) You should remember the Goswāmīs of Vṛndāvan: Śrī Rūpa Goswāmī, Sanātan Goswāmī, Jīva Goswāmī, Raghunāth  Bhaṭṭa  Goswāmī,  and  Raghunāth  Dās Goswāmī. If you worship Lord Krishna, then you should remember the two great souls Śrī Rūpa Goswāmī and Sanātan Goswāmī. You should also remember Rāghava Paṇḍit, Gopāl Bhaṭṭa Goswāmī, Swarūp Dāmodar Goswāmī, and Rāmānanda Rāya. If you really seek love of Krishna, then you must remember Swarūp Dāmodar Goswāmī and Rāmānanda Rāya.

metadata.title: Bhajan-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The text is a song that mentions the names of several Goswāmīs of Vṛndāvan and advises remembering them in order to worship Lord Krishna.

text:
goṣṭhī-saha karṇapura-sen-śivānanda
(ajasra smara smara re)
(goṣṭhī-saha-sen śivānande ajasra smara re)
rūpānuga sādhu-jana bhajana-ānanda
(vraje bās jadi chāo re)
(rūpānuga sādhu-jane smara vraje bās jadi chāo re)
rūpānuga sādhu-jana bhajana-ānanda
bhaja re bhaja re āmār mana ati manda

(4) You should remember Śrīla Kavi Karṇapura and all his family members, who are all sincere servants of Lord Śrī Chaitanya Mahāprabhu. You should also remember the father of Kavi Karṇapura, Śivānanda Sena. Always remember, always remember Śrī Karṇapura and his family. You should remember all those Vaiṣṇavas who strictly follow the path of Śrī Rūpa Goswāmī and who are absorbed in the ecstasy of bhajan. If you actually want residence in the land of Vraja, then you must remember all of the Vaiṣṇavas, who are followers of Śrīla Rūpa Goswāmī.

metadata.title: Bhajan-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotees are reminded to remember the family of Śrīla Kavi Karṇapura and other Vaiṣṇavas who follow the path of Śrī Rūpa Goswāmī.

text:
--------
Gurudeva
gurudeva!
kṛpā-bindu diyā,    kara’ ei dāse,
tṛṇāpekṣā ati dīna
sakala-sahane,    bala diyā kara,
nija-māne spṛhā-hīna

(1) Gurudeva, give to this servant just one drop of mercy. I am lower than a blade of grass. Give me all help. Give me strength. Let me be as you are, without desires or aspirations.

metadata.title: Gurudeva
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee humbly requests Gurudeva for mercy and strength.

text:
sakale sammān,    korite śakati,
deho nātha! yathā yatha
tobe to’ gāibo,    harināma-sukhe,
aparādha hobe hoto

(2) Give me energy so that I can properly give respect and honour to all. Then I shall be able to happily chant the Holy Name, and my offences will go away.

metadata.title: Gurudeva
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee prays to Lord Krishna for the energy to give respect and honour to all and to chant His Holy Name.

text:
kobe heno kṛpā,    lobhiyā e jana,
kṛtārtha hoibe, nātha!
śakti-buddhi-hīn,    āmi ati dīn,
kara more ātma-sātha

(3) Oh my Lord! When will such mercy fall to this person. I am weak, bereft, and devoid of intelligence. Please allow me to be with you.

metadata.title: Gurudeva
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker expresses their longing for Kṛṣṇa's mercy and asks to be with Him.

text:
jogyatā-vichāre,    kichu nāhi pāi,
tomāra karuṇā-sāra
karuṇā nā hoile,    kā̐diyā kā̐diyā,
prāṇa nā rākhibo āra

(4) If you examine me, you will find no qualities. Your mercy is everything to me. If you are not merciful unto me, I can only weep, and I will not be able to maintain my life.

metadata.title: Gurudeva
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee expresses their dependence on Kṛṣṇa's mercy for survival.

text:
---------------------
Ṭhākura-vaiṣṇava-gaṇa
ṭhākura vaiṣṇava-gaṇa    kori ei nivedana
mo boḍo adhama durāchāra
dāruṇa-saṁsāra-nidhi    tāhe ḍhūbailo vidhi
keśe dhori more kara para

(1) O saintly Vaiṣṇavas, although I am very fallen and misbehaved, I nevertheless place this appeal before you. My destiny has immersed me in this fearsome ocean of repeated birth and death. Please grab me by the hair, and pull me to the opposite shore.

metadata.title: Ṭhākura-vaiṣṇava-gaṇa
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee humbly requests the saintly Vaiṣṇavas to rescue him from the cycle of birth and death.

text:
vidhi boḍo valavān    na śune dharama-jñāna
sadāi karama-pāśe bāndhe
nā dekhi tāraṇa leśa    jata dekhi saba kleśa
anātha kātare te̐i kānde

(2) My destiny is very powerful. I am not able to hear the knowledge of spiritual life, and I am always bound by the ropes of karma. I cannot see any way to escape my condition. I see only suffering. Helpless and stricken with grief, I cry.

metadata.title: Ṭhākura-vaiṣṇava-gaṇa
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker feels trapped by their karma and unable to escape their suffering.

text:
kāma krodha lobha moha    mada abhimāna saha
āpana āpana sthāne ṭāne
aichāna āmāra mana    phire jena andha jana
supatha vipatha nāhi jāne

(3) I am just like a blind man unable to see what path is auspicious or inauspicious. I am helplessly dragged from here to there by lust, anger, greed, bewilderment, madness, and pride.

metadata.title: Ṭhākura-vaiṣṇava-gaṇa
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker feels helpless and lost, unable to distinguish between auspicious and inauspicious paths in life, and is dragged by negative emotions.

text:
na loinu sat mata    asate majilo chita
tuyā pāye na korinu āśa
narottama dāse koy    dekhi śuni lage bhay
tarāiyā loho nija pāśa

(4) My mind became immersed in the impermanent satisfaction of the senses, and I could not understand the real goal of life. For this reason I did not aspire to attain Your lotus feet. Narottam Dās says, “Now that I am able to see and hear the Vaiṣṇavas, I have become free from all fear.

metadata.title: Ṭhākura-vaiṣṇava-gaṇa
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker's mind is distracted by worldly pleasures and they do not aspire to attain Kṛṣṇa's lotus feet.

text:
--------------
Śrī Guru Ārati
jaya jaya gurudever ārati ujjvala
govardhana-pāda-pīthe bhuvana-maṅgala

(1) All glories to the effulgent arati of Śrī Gurudeva, which is going on at the foot of Govardhan, benefitting the whole world.

metadata.title: Śrī Guru Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Guru Ārati is sung at the foot of Govardhan, benefiting the world.

text:
śrī bhakti sundara deva prabhu śiromaṇi
gosvāmī govinda jaya ānandera khani

(2) All glories to Śrī Bhakti Sundar Govinda Goswāmī, who is our supreme master and is like a reservoir of joy.

metadata.title: Śrī Guru Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A tribute to Śrī Bhakti Sundar Govinda Goswāmī, a revered spiritual master.

text:
ājānu lambita bhuja divya kalevara
ananta pratibhā bharā divya guṇadhara

(3) His graceful long hands touch his knees and his body is beautiful and transcendental. He is an ocean of infinite genius and transcendental qualities.

metadata.title: Śrī Guru Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Kṛṣṇa's body is described as beautiful and transcendental, with long hands that touch his knees.

text:
gaura-kṛṣṇe jāni tava abhinna svarūpa
saṁsāra tarite ebe śuddha-bhakta-rūpa

(4) We consider your real identity to be non-different from Krishna and Gaurāṅga. But now, to deliver this material world, you have assumed the form of a pure devotee.

metadata.title: Śrī Guru Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee considers Gaurāṅga and Krishna to be the same and believes that Gaurāṅga has taken the form of a pure devotee to deliver the material world.

text:
rūpānuga-dhārā tumi kara ālokita
prabhākara sama prabhā bhuvana-vidita

(5) You are brightening the line of the followers of Śrīla Rūpa Goswāmī. Your effulgence, which is comparable to that of the sun, is known throughout the whole world.

metadata.title: Śrī Guru Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee is brightening the line of the followers of Śrīla Rūpa Goswāmī with their effulgence.

text:
śuddha bhakti prachārite tomā sama nāi
akalaṅka indu jena dayāla nitāi

(6) There is no one like you to preach pure devotion. You are the spotless moon, and you are merciful like Lord Nityānanda.

metadata.title: Śrī Guru Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee praises Nityānanda Prabhu for his unique ability to preach pure devotion and his merciful nature.

text:
ullasita viśvavāsī labhe prema-dhana
ānande nāchiyā gāhe tava guṇagaṇa

(7) As ecstatic people all over the world are attaining the treasure of love of Krishna, they are dancing and singing your glories.

metadata.title: Śrī Guru Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Ecstatic people all over the world are attaining the treasure of love of Krishna and dancing and singing his glories.

text:
sthāpilā āśrama bahu jagata mājhāre
pāramahaṁsa-dharma-jñāna śikṣāra prachāre

(8) To teach the essence of the highest knowledge and to preach it to all, you have established many ashrams all over the world.

metadata.title: Śrī Guru Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu established many ashrams to teach the highest knowledge.

text:
chintyāchintya veda-jñāne tumi ādhikārī
sakala saṁśaya chettvā susiddhāntadhārī

(9) You have mastery over the knowledge of the Vedas, both conceivable and inconceivable. You are the treasurer of bona fide conclusions, which can destroy all doubt.

metadata.title: Śrī Guru Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Chaitanya Mahaprabhu is described as having mastery over the knowledge of the Vedas.

text:
tomāra mahimā gāhe goloka maṇḍale
nitya-siddha parikare tava līlāsthale

(10) Your glories are being sung in the spiritual world of Goloka, the realm of your Pastimes, by your servants who are eternally liberated.

metadata.title: Śrī Guru Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The glories of Kṛṣṇa are being sung in the spiritual world of Goloka.

text:
patita pāvana tumi dayāra samīra
sarva-kārye sunipuṇa satya-sugambhīra

(11) To deliver the fallen souls, you are like a breeze of mercy. You are expert in all service, and you are established in truth and gravity.

metadata.title: Śrī Guru Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee describes Kṛṣṇa as a breeze of mercy who delivers fallen souls.

text:
apurva lekhanī dhārā pragāḍha pāṇḍitya
sadā hāsya miṣṭa bhāśī suśila kavitva

(12) Your beautiful and unprecedented writing reflects your deep scholarship. You are always smiling and speaking sweet words, which remind one of your soothing poetry.

metadata.title: Śrī Guru Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker praises the addressee's writing and poetry.

text:
sādhu-saṅge sadānandī sarala vinayī
sabhā-madhye vaktā śreṣṭha sarvatra vijayī

(13) You are always straightforward and humble, and you are always joyful in the association of pure devotees. In a spiritual gathering, you are always the best speaker. In every field of life, you always come out victorious.

metadata.title: Śrī Guru Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A description of a devotee's qualities and behavior.

text:
gauḍīya gagane tumi āchārya-bhāskara
nirantara sevāpriya miṣṭa kaṇṭhasvara

(14) In the sky of the Gauḍīya Vaiṣṇava world, you are a preceptor who is prominent like the sun. You are always fond of service, and your sweet voice inspires others to do service also.

metadata.title: Śrī Guru Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee praises a preceptor for their love of service and inspiring others to do the same.

text:
tomāra karuṇā māge trikāla vilāse
gāndharvikā-giridhārī sevā-mātra āśe

(15) Past, present, and future—for all eternity, we beg your mercy. Only by your mercy will one receive devotional service to Śrī Śrī Gāndharvikā-Giridhārī.

metadata.title: Śrī Guru Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee begs for the mercy of Śrī Śrī Gāndharvikā-Giridhārī to receive devotional service.

text:
kṛpā kara ohe prabhu śri-gaura-prakāśa
ārati karaye sadā e adhama dāsa

(16) O my lord, who is the manifestation of the mercy of Śrī Gaurāṅga, please be merciful to me. This insignificant servant of yours is always praying this way while worshipping you.

metadata.title: Śrī Guru Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee prays to Śrī Gaurāṅga for mercy while worshipping him.

text:
--------------
Vibhāvarī Śeṣa
vibhāvarī śeṣa,    āloka-praveśa,
nidrā chāḍi’ uṭho jīva
bolo hari hari,    mukunda murāri,
rāma kṛṣṇa hayagrīva

(1) The night has come to an end and the light of dawn is entering. O jīva-soul, arise and give up your sleep. Chant the Holy Names of Lord Hari, who is the giver of liberation; the enemy of the Mura demon; the Supreme Enjoyer; the all-attractive one; and the horse-headed incarnation, Hayagrīva.

metadata.title: Vibhāvarī Śeṣa
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song urging the soul to arise and chant the Holy Names of Lord Hari.

text:
nṛsiṁha vāmana,    śrī-madhusūdana,
vrajendra-nandana śyāma
pūtanā-ghātana,    kaiṭabha-śātana,
jaya dāśarathi-rāma

(2) Lord Hari incarnated as the half-man, half-lion, Nṛṣiṁha. He appeared as a  dwarf-brāhmaṇ named Upendra and is the killer of the Madhu demon. He is the beloved son of the King of Vraja, Nanda Mahārāj, and is blackish in complexion. He is the slayer of the Pūtanā witch and the destroyer of the demon Kaiṭabha. All glories to Lord Hari, who appeared as Lord Rāma, the son of King Dāśarath.

metadata.title: Vibhāvarī Śeṣa
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Lord Hari incarnated in various forms to defeat demons and protect devotees.

text:
yaśodā dulāla,    govinda-gopāla,
vṛndāvana purandara
gopī-priya-jana,    rādhikā-ramaṇa,
bhuvana-sundara-vara

(3) He is the darling of Mother Yaśodā; the giver of pleasure to the cows, land, and spiritual senses; and the protector of the cows. He is the Lord of the Vṛndāvan forest; the gopīs’ beloved; the lover of Rādhikā; and the most beautiful personality in all the worlds.

metadata.title: Vibhāvarī Śeṣa
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Description of Kṛṣṇa's qualities and relationships in Vṛndāvana.

text:
rāvāṇāntakara,    mākhona-taskara,
gopī-jana-vastra-hārī
vrajera rākhāla,    gopa-vṛnda-pāla,
chitta-hārī baṁśī-dhārī

(4) As Rāmachandra He brought about the end of the demoniac King Rāvaṇa; as Krishna He stole the older gopīs’ butter; He stole the younger gopīs’ clothes while they were bathing in the Yamunā. He is a cowherd boy of Vraja and the protector of the cowherd boys. He steals the hearts of all and always holds a flute.

metadata.title: Vibhāvarī Śeṣa
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The text describes Krishna's pastimes as stealing the clothes of the gopīs while they were bathing in the Yamunā.

text:
jogīndra-bandana,    śrī-nanda-nandana,
vraja-jana-bhaya-hārī
navīna nīrada,    rūpa manohara,
mohana-vaṁśī-bihārī

(5) Lord Krishna is worshiped by the best of yogis and is the son of Nanda. He removes all the fears of the inhabitants of Vraja. He is the colour of a fresh rain cloud, and His form is enchanting. When He wanders about, playing His flute, He looks very charming.

metadata.title: Vibhāvarī Śeṣa
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Lord Krishna is worshiped by yogis and is the son of Nanda, removing fears of Vraja's inhabitants.

text:
yaśodā-nandana,    kaṁsa-nisūdana,
nikuñja-rāsa-vilāsī
kadamba-kānana,    rāsa-parāyaṇa,
vṛndā-vipina-nivāsī

(6) He is the son of Yaśodā and the killer of King Kaṁsa, and He sports in the Rāsa dance among the groves of Vraja. Krishna engages in this Rāsa dance underneath the kadamba trees, and He resides in the forest of Vṛndāvan.

metadata.title: Vibhāvarī Śeṣa
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Krishna sports in the Rāsa dance among the groves of Vraja.

text:
ānanda-vardhana,    prema-niketana,
phula-śara-jojaka kāma
gopāṅgaṇāgaṇa,    chitta-vinodana,
samasta-guṇa-gaṇa-dhāma

(7) He increases the ecstasy of His devotees. He is the reservoir of all love and is the transcendental Cupid who uses His flowered arrows to increase the loving desires of the gopīs. He is the pleasure of the gopīs’ hearts and the abode of all wonderful qualities.

metadata.title: Vibhāvarī Śeṣa
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Kṛṣṇa increases the ecstasy of His devotees and is the reservoir of all love.

text:
jāmuna-jīvana,    keli-parāyaṇa,
mānasa-chandra-chakora
nāma-sudhā-rasa,    gāo kṛṣṇa-jaśa,
rākho vachana mana mora

(8) Lord Krishna is the life of the River Yamunā. He is always absorbed in amorous Pastimes, and He is the moon of the gopīs’ minds, which are like the chakora birds that subsist only upon moonlight. O mind, obey these words of mine and sing the glories of Śrī Krishna in the form of these Holy Names, which are full of nectarean mellows.

metadata.title: Vibhāvarī Śeṣa
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song describing Lord Krishna's pastimes and the sweetness of His Holy Names.

text:
-------------
Prabhāti Gīti
kali-kukkura-kadana jadi chāo he
kaliyuga-pāvana    kali-bhaya-nāśana,
śrī śachī-nandana gāo he

(1) Oh mind, you are like a miserable dog of Kali-yuga! If you want deliverance, then sing the Holy Name of the son of Śachī, for He is the saviour and destroyer of fear in this dark age of Kali.

metadata.title: Prabhāti Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song urging the mind to sing the Holy Name of Kṛṣṇa for deliverance from Kali-yuga.

text:
gadādhara-mādana    nitāi-era prāṇadhana,
advaitera prapūjita gorā
nimai viśvambhara    śrīnivāsa-īśvara,
bhakata samūha-chitachorā

(2) He is the transcendental cupid of Gadādhara, the life and soul of Nityānanda Prabhu, and the worshipable Lord of Śrī Advaita Āchārya. He is known as Nimai as He was born under a Neem tree; Viśvambhara as He is the sustainer of the universe; He is the master of Śrīvās Ṭhākur, and He steals the hearts of all of the devotees.

metadata.title: Prabhāti Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Kṛṣṇa is described as the transcendental cupid of Gadādhara and the life and soul of Nityānanda Prabhu.

text:
nadīyā-śaśadhara    māyāpura-īśvara,
nāma-prabartana-śūra
gṛhījana-śikṣaka    nyāsikula-nāyaka,
mādhava-rādhābhāva pūra

(3) He is the moon of Nadia, the Lord of Māyāpur, and heroic saviour who inaugurated the chanting of the Holy Name of Krishna. He is the teacher of all householders and the commander-in-chief of all sannyāsīs. Śrī Chaitanya Mahāprabhu is Krishna, filled with the ecstatic heart’s sentiment of Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī.

metadata.title: Prabhāti Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Chaitanya Mahāprabhu is described as the Lord of Māyāpur and the heroic saviour who inaugurated the chanting of the Holy Name of Krishna.

text:
sārvabhauma-śodhana    gajapati-tāraṇa,
rāmānanda-poṣaṇa-vīra
rūpānanda-vardhana    sanātana pālana,
haridāsa-modana-dhīra

(4) He purified Sārvabhauma Bhaṭṭāchārya and rescued Pratāparudra Maharaj, the great king of Orissa. He is the hero and protector of Rāmānanda Rāy. He increases the ecstasy of Śrīla Rūpa Goswāmī and He is the guardian of Śrīla Sanātan Goswāmī. He delights the sober Haridās Ṭhākur.

metadata.title: Prabhāti Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The text describes the pastimes of Lord Caitanya and His associates.

text:
vraja rasa-bhāvana duṣṭamata-śātana,
kapaṭī-vighātana-kāma
śuddha bhakta-pālana śuṣka jñāna-tāḍana,
cholo bhakti-dūṣaṇa-rāma

(5) Śrī Krishna Chaitanya is absorbed in the mellows of Vṛndāvan. He removes the filthy thoughts of the mind, destroying lust and deceit. He drives away dry empiric knowledge which obscures the beauty of pure devotion. He is the protector, maintainer and constant guardian of His pure devotees.

metadata.title: Prabhāti Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Krishna Chaitanya removes the obstacles to devotion and protects His pure devotees.

text:
--------------
Śrī Nām-kīrtan
jaśomatī-nandana    vraja-vara nāgara,
gokula-rañjana kāna
gopī-parāṇa-dhana    madana manohara,
kālīya-damana-vidhāna

(1) Śrī Krishna is the beloved son of Mother Yaśodā, the transcendental lover of the land of Vraja and the delight of Gokula. One of His nicknames is Kāna. He is the life and soul of the gopīs. He is the enchanter of Cupid and the conqueror of the Kālīya serpent.

metadata.title: Śrī Nām-kīrtan
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Krishna is described as the beloved son of Mother Yaśodā and the enchanter of Cupid.

text:
amala harinām amiya-vilāsā
vipina-purandara    navīna nāgara-bora,
vaṁśī-badana suvāsā

(2) The Holy Names of Krishna are spotless and full of sweetness and beauty. Krishna is the king of the forest of Vṛndāvan. He is the ever-fresh youth, an excellent dresser, and the best of lovers. He always plays sweet melodies upon His flute.

metadata.title: Śrī Nām-kīrtan
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The text describes Krishna's beauty and qualities as the king of Vṛndāvan.

text:
vraja-jana-pālana    asura-kula-nāśana,
nanda-godhana rākhoyālā
govinda mādhava    navanīta-taṣkara,
sundara nanda-gopālā

(3) Krishna is the guardian of all who live in Vṛndāvan, and the destroyer of demons. He tends the cows and is known as Govinda, for He delights the cows and the senses. He is Mādhava, the husband of the goddess of fortune, He loves to steal butter and He is the beautiful cowherd boy of Nanda Mahārāj.

metadata.title: Śrī Nām-kīrtan
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Krishna is the guardian of Vṛndāvan and the destroyer of demons.

text:
yamunā-taṭa-chara    gopī-basana-hara,
rāsa-rasika kṛpāmoya
śrī-rādhā-vallabha    vṛndāvana-naṭabara,
bhakativinod-āśraya

(4) Wandering on the banks of the Yamunā River, Krishna stole the garments of the gopīs while they were bathing. He enjoys the mellows of the rāsa dance. He is the most merciful, beloved lover of Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī. He is the great dancer of Vṛndāvan, and the supreme shelter of Śrīla Bhakti Vinod Ṭhākur.

metadata.title: Śrī Nām-kīrtan
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Krishna's pastime of stealing the gopīs' garments while they bathed.

text:
---------------------------------------
Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa
jaya jaya girirājer ārati viśāla
śrī gaura-maṇḍala-mājhe bhuvana-maṅgala

(1) All glories, all glories, to the grand ārati of Śrī Girirāj! In the midst of Śrī Gaura Maṇḍal, it is benefitting the entire universe.

metadata.title: Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa Gupta-Govardhan Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song praising Śrī Girirāj and Śrī Gaura Maṇḍal.

text:
koladvīpe śobhe gupta-govardhanarūpa
vyakta hoilā śrī govinda kuṇḍe aparūpa

(2) The hidden Govardhan graces Koladwīp with its beauty. Now it has manifested its exquisite beauty in Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa.

metadata.title: Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa Gupta-Govardhan Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The hidden Govardhan graces Koladwīp with its beauty.

text:
mālatī-mādhavī-kuñja kandare kandare
nigūḍha-nikuñja-līlā hari-manohare

(3) There are groves of mālatī and mādhavī flowers in its various caves. In these groves, Lord Hari plays His hidden, mysterious, and enchanting Pastimes.

metadata.title: Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa Gupta-Govardhan Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Lord Hari plays His hidden, mysterious, and enchanting Pastimes in the groves of mālatī and mādhavī flowers.

text:
apūrva kuṇḍera śobhā jena sudhābhāṇḍa
surendra-surabhī-sevā-saubhāgya-mārtaṇḍa

(4) The incomparable beauty of the Kuṇḍa is like a reservoir of honey. Even Lord Indra and the divine Surabhī cow are rendering their service under the shining sun of good fortune.

metadata.title: Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa Gupta-Govardhan Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The beauty of the Kuṇḍa is compared to a reservoir of honey, with Lord Indra and the Surabhī cow serving under its good fortune.

text:
śrī bhakti-rakṣaka deva-gosvāmī śrīdhara
prakāśilā tava sevā dīpta manohara

(5) Śrīla Bhakti Rakṣak Śrīdhar Dev-Goswāmī Mahārāj has manifested the effulgent and enchanting devotional service to You.

metadata.title: Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa Gupta-Govardhan Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
entities: Śrīla Bhakti Rakṣak Śrīdhar Dev-Goswāmī Mahārāj
metadata.summary: Śrīla Bhakti Rakṣak Śrīdhar Dev-Goswāmī Mahārāj has described devotional service to Kṛṣṇa.

text:
śrī chaitanya-sārasvata maṭha suśobhana
yathā nitya sevā kore sārasvata-gaṇa

(6) Śrī Chaitanya Sāraswat Maṭh is a beautiful place where devotees of the Maṭh are always rendering their devotional service.

metadata.title: Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa Gupta-Govardhan Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Chaitanya Sāraswat Maṭh is a beautiful place where devotees render their devotional service.

text:
gosvāmī śrī-raghunātha dāsere smariyā
nirantara sevā kore antarmaṇā hoiyā

(7) Remembering Śrī Raghunāth Dās Goswāmī, they are continuously serving in an introspective mood.

metadata.title: Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa Gupta-Govardhan Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Remembering Śrī Raghunātha dās Goswāmī inspires introspection and service.

text:
jaya gupta-govardhana divya-rasāloy
rūpa-raghunāthānuga-bhaktera āśroy

(8) All glories to the hidden Govardhan, which is a reservoir of transcendental rasa. It is the refuge of the devotees who are following in the footsteps of Śrī Rūpa and Śrī Raghunāth.

metadata.title: Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa Gupta-Govardhan Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The text praises Govardhan as a reservoir of transcendental rasa and a refuge for devotees following in the footsteps of Śrī Rūpa and Śrī Raghunāth.

text:
kuliyā-prakāśa tava achintya-mahimā
divāniśi bhakta-vṛnda kore parikramā

(9) By Your inconceivable glories and magnanimity, You have manifested Kuliyā (where all offences are forgiven). Day and night, the multitudes of devotees are circumambulating this place.

metadata.title: Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa Gupta-Govardhan Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Kṛṣṇa has manifested Kuliyā, a place where all offences are forgiven, and devotees circumambulate it day and night.

text:
sevya o sevaka-rūpe nitya parakāśa
sānande ārati dekhe e adhama dāsa

(10) You are eternally manifested both as the worshipable Lord and as the servitor Lord. This fallen servant sees Your ārati with great joy.

metadata.title: Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa Gupta-Govardhan Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee sees Kṛṣṇa's ārati with great joy.

text:
------------------
Aruṇodoya-kīrtan
udilo aruṇa pūraba-bhāge,
dvija-maṇi gorā amani jāge,
bhakata-samūha loiyā sāthe,
gelā nagara-brāje

(1) Just before sunrise, as the eastern sky turned crimson, the jewel of the twice-born, Śrī Gaurahari, awoke. Taking His devotees with Him He began the kīrtan, wandering through the countryside towns and villages.

metadata.title: Aruṇodoya-kīrtan 1
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Gaurahari awakens and begins kīrtan with His devotees.

text:
‘tāthai tāthai’ bājalo khol,
ghana ghana tāhe jhāṅjera rol,
preme ḍhala ḍhala sonāra aṅga,
charaṇe nūpura bāje

(2) The mṛdaṅgas went “tāthai tāthai” to the rhyming chiming of the cymbals, as Mahāprabhu’s golden form shivered in ecstasy and His footbells jingled.

metadata.title: Aruṇodoya-kīrtan 1
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A description of Mahāprabhu's ecstatic dance in the divine pastimes.

text:
mukunda mādhava jādava hari,
bolore bolore vadana bhori’,
miche nida-vaśe gelo re rāti,
divasa śorīra sāje

(3) Mahāprabhu would call out to the still sleeping people, “Don’t waste your nights uselessly sleeping and your days decorating your bodies! Cry out the Names Mukunda, Mādhava, Jādava and Hari!”

metadata.title: Aruṇodoya-kīrtan 1
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Mahāprabhu encourages people to chant the Names of God instead of wasting their time sleeping and decorating their bodies.

text:
emona durllabha mānava-deho,
pāiyā ki kara bhāva nā keho,
ebe nā bhajile yaśodā-suta,
charame poḍibe lāje

(4) “You have attained this rare human form of life. What are you doing? Don’t you care for this gift? If you don’t worship the darling of Mother Yaśodā now, then great sorrow awaits you at the time of death.”

metadata.title: Aruṇodoya-kīrtan 1
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee warns that not worshiping Kṛṣṇa in this life will lead to great sorrow at death.

text:
udita tapana hoile asta,
dina gelo-boli’ hoibe vyasta,
tobe keno ebe alasa hoy,
nā bhaja hṛdoya-rāje

(5) “With every rising and setting of the sun, a day passes and is lost. Why then do you remain idle, refusing to serve the Lord of the heart?”

metadata.title: Aruṇodoya-kīrtan 1
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song urging devotion to the Lord of the heart.

text:
jīvana anitya jānaha sār,
tāhe nānā-vidha vipada-bhār,
nāmāśroya kori’ jatane tumi,
thākaha āpana kāje

(6) “Know for certain that this life is full of various miseries. Take shelter of the Holy Name as your only business.”

metadata.title: Aruṇodoya-kīrtan 1
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The song advises taking shelter of the Holy Name as one's only business to overcome life's miseries.

text:
kṛṣṇa-nāma-sudhā koriyā pān
juḍāo bhakativinoda-prāṇ,
nāma vinā kichu nāhiko āro,
chaudda-bhuvana-mājhe

(7) Drink the pure nectar of the Holy Name of Krishna, and thus satisfy the soul of Ṭhākur Bhakti Vinod. There is nothing but the Name to be had in all the fourteen worlds.

metadata.title: Aruṇodoya-kīrtan 1
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The text encourages the reader to drink the nectar of the Holy Name of Krishna and satisfy the soul of Bhakti Vinod.

text:
jīvera kalyāṇa-sādhana-kām,
jagate āsi’ e madhura nām,
avidyā-timira-tapana-rūpe,
hṛd-gagane birāje

(8) To penetrate the darkness of ignorance and bless all souls within this universe, the beautiful Name of Krishna has arisen like the shining sun.

metadata.title: Aruṇodoya-kīrtan 1
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The beautiful Name of Krishna has arisen to bless all souls within the universe.

text:
-------------------------------
Śrī Śrī Girirāj-
jaya jaya girirājer ārotiko śobhā
śrī-vraja-maṇḍala mājhe jaga mana lobhā

(1) All glories to the beautiful ārati of Śrī Girirāj which is going on in Śrī Vraja Maṇḍal, attracting the minds of all living entities of the universe.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Girirāj-Govardhan Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song praising the beauty of Śrī Girirāj's ārati in Śrī Vraja Maṇḍal.

text:
pramoda-madana-līla śrī-rādhā-ramaṇa
yathā nitya-līlā kore loye sakhī-gaṇa

(2) Lord Śrī Rādha-Ramaṇa [Krishna who gives pleasure to his beloved Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī] is eternally playing His joyful Loving Pastimes there in the association of the Sakhīs of Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Girirāj-Govardhan Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Rādha-Ramaṇa is eternally playing joyful pastimes with the Sakhīs of Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī.

text:
mālatī-mādhavī-kuñja kandare kandare
nigūḍha nikuñja-līla hari manohare

(3) Here deep within the groves of mālatī flowers and mādhavī creepers, the confidential Pastimes of the charming Lord Hari are going on.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Girirāj-Govardhan Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The confidential pastimes of Lord Hari are taking place in the groves of mālatī flowers and mādhavī creepers.

text:
śyāma-kuṇḍa rādhā-kuṇḍa kusum sarovara
mānasa gaṅgā dāna-ghāṭī jāra abhyantara

(4) Within this holy place are Śyāma Kuṇḍa, Rādhā Kuṇḍa, Kusum Sarovar, Mānasa Gaṅgā and Dāna-ghāṭī.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Girirāj-Govardhan Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The holy place of Vrindavan contains several sacred lakes and ghats.

text:
śrī-govinda-kuṇḍa līlāsthalī nāhi sīmā
divāniśi-bhakta-vṛnda kore parikramā

(5) With Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa, these holy places of divine Pastimes are without limit. Day and night the devotees are performing circumambulation in worship.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Girirāj-Govardhan Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Devotees perform circumambulation at Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa, a holy place of divine Pastimes.

text:
‘śrīdhar-svāmī-sevāśram’ parama śobhana
yathā nitya-sevā kore sārasvata-gaṇa

(6) Here there is the supremely beautiful Śrīdhar Swāmī Sevāśram where devotees of Śrī Chaitanya Sāraswat Maṭh are performing their eternal service.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Girirāj-Govardhan Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The Śrīdhar Swāmī Sevāśram is a place where devotees of Śrī Chaitanya Sāraswat Maṭh perform their eternal service.

text:
abhinna śrī kṛṣṇa jñāne bhajibāra tore
mahāprabhu samarpilā raghunātha kore

(7) Śrīman Mahāprabhu gave Śrī Śrī Girirāj Jīu to Śrī Raghunāth Goswāmī so that Śrī Dās Goswāmī could worship His Lordship knowing Him to be non-different from Krishna.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Girirāj-Govardhan Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrīman Mahāprabhu gave Śrī Śrī Girirāj Jīu to Śrī Raghunāth Goswāmī for worship.

text:
gosvāmī śrī-raghunātha dāsere smariyā
nirantara sevā kore antarmanā hoiyā

(8) The devotees of Śrī Chaitanya Sāraswat Maṭh worship Śrī Śrī Girirāj Jīu in a deep mood of devotion in remembrance of Śrī Raghunāth Dās Goswāmī.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Girirāj-Govardhan Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotees of Śrī Chaitanya Sāraswat Maṭh worship Śrī Śrī Girirāj Jīu in remembrance of Śrī Raghunāth Dās Goswāmī.

text:
jaya giri-govardhana divya-rasāloy
rūpa-sanātana-jīva-raghunāthāśroy

(9) All glories to Śrī Giri Govardhan which is the abode of divine rasa and the shelter of Śrī Rūpa, Sanātan, Jīva and Raghunāth Goswāmīs.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Girirāj-Govardhan Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A verse glorifying Śrī Giri Govardhan as the abode of divine rasa and the shelter of several Goswāmīs.

text:
surendra-munīndra-śiva-śuka-mahājana
dekhena ārati-śobhā durllabha-darśana

(10) The beauty of the ārati of Śrī Girirāj Jīu which is rare and precious is being seen by Lord Indra, Nārada Muni, Lord Shiva, Śukadeva Goswāmī and all the great personalities.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Girirāj-Govardhan Ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The beauty of the ārati of Śrī Girirāj Jīu is being seen by various personalities, including Lord Indra and Lord Shiva.

text:
--------------------------------
Śrī Kṛṣṇera
nagare nagare gorā gāy

(1) From village to village Lord Gaura sings these names of Śrī Krishna.

metadata.title: Śrī Kṛṣṇera Viṁsottara-śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Lord Gaura sings the names of Śrī Krishna in various villages.

text:
jaśomatī-stanya-pāyī śrī-nanda-nandana
indra-nīla-maṇi vraja-janera jīvana

(2) Krishna is the baby who feeds on the breast of Mother Yaśodā. He is the son of Mahārāj Nanda, dark blue like an indra-nīla gem, and the life of the residents of Vraja.

metadata.title: Śrī Kṛṣṇera Viṁsottara-śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
