text:
śrī gokula niśācharī-pūtanā ghātana
duṣṭa-tṛṇāvarta-hantā śakaṭa-bhañjana

(3) Krishna destroyed the witch of Gokul, Pūtanā; He broke the cart in which the demon Śakaṭāsura was hiding; and He destroyed the wicked demon, Tṛṇāvarta.

metadata.title: Śrī Kṛṣṇera Viṁsottara-śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Krishna destroyed the witch Pūtanā and two other demons in Gokul.

text:
navanīta-chora dadhi-haraṇa-kuśala
jamala-arjuna-bhañjī govinda gopāla

(4) He is an expert thief of butter and yoghurt, He broke the two Jamala Arjuna trees, and He is a cowherd boy who is always giving pleasure to the cows, land and senses.

metadata.title: Śrī Kṛṣṇera Viṁsottara-śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Nityānanda Prabhu is described as an expert thief of butter and yoghurt, and a cowherd boy who gives pleasure to the cows and senses.

text:
dāmodara vṛndāvana-go-vatsa-rākhāla
vatsāsurāntaka hari nija-jana-pāla

(5) He is so naughty that His mother bound Him around the waist with ropes. Thus He is known as Dāmodar. He is the keeper of Vṛndāvan’s cows and calves, the destroyer of the demon Vatsāsura, He is the remover of all evils and is the protector of His devotees.

metadata.title: Śrī Kṛṣṇera Viṁsottara-śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Dāmodara is known as the keeper of Vṛndāvan’s cows and calves and the destroyer of the demon Vatsāsura.

text:
baka-śatru agha-hantā brahma-vimohana
dhenuka-nāśana kṛṣṇa kālīya-damana

(6) Krishna is the enemy of the demon Bakāsura, the slayer of Aghāsura, the bewilderer of Lord Brahmā, the destroyer of Dhenukāsura and the subduer of the Kālīya serpent. He is all-attractive and is the colour of a fresh rain cloud.

metadata.title: Śrī Kṛṣṇera Viṁsottara-śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Krishna is described as the enemy of various demons and the subduer of the Kālīya serpent.

text:
pītāmbara śikhi-picha-dhārī veṇu-dhara
bhāṇḍīra-kānana-līla dāvānala-hara

(7) Lord Krishna dresses in yellow silk cloth and wears peacock feathers on His head. He holds a flute, performs Pastimes in the Bhāṇḍīra forest, and He once swallowed a forest fire to save the inhabitants of Vraja.

metadata.title: Śrī Kṛṣṇera Viṁsottara-śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Lord Krishna performs pastimes in the Bhāṇḍīra forest and saves the inhabitants of Vraja from a forest fire.

text:
naṭavara-guhāchara śarata-bihārī
ballabhī-ballabha deva gopī-vastra-hārī

(8) Krishna, best of dancers, sometimes wanders in the caves of Govardhān Hill. He enjoys various amorous Pastimes in the autumn season, He is the lover of the young cowherd maidens, the stealer of their garments, and the Supreme Lord of all.

metadata.title: Śrī Kṛṣṇera Viṁsottara-śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Krishna's pastimes in the caves of Govardhān Hill and his amorous relationships with the gopīs.

text:
yajña-patnī-goṇ-prati karuṇāra sindhu
govardhana-dhṛk mādhava vraja-vāsi-bandhu

(9) Krishna is the ocean of mercy of the wives of the sacrificial brāhmaṇs, He is the holder of Govardhān Hill, the husband of the goddess of fortune, Lakṣmī, and the dearmost friend of the inhabitants of Vraja.

metadata.title: Śrī Kṛṣṇera Viṁsottara-śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Krishna is described as the ocean of mercy and the holder of Govardhān Hill.

text:
indra-darpa-hārī nanda-rakṣitā mukunda
śrī-gopī-ballabha rāsa-krīḍa pūrṇānanda

(10) He broke Indra’s pride and protected His father, Nanda Mahārāj. He is the giver of liberation, the lover of the cowherd maidens of Vraja, the enjoyer of the Rāsa Dance and the reservoir of pleasure.

metadata.title: Śrī Kṛṣṇera Viṁsottara-śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Kṛṣṇa broke Indra’s pride and protected His father, Nanda Mahārāj.

text:
śrī-rādhā-vallabha rādhā-mādhava sundara
lalitā-viśākhā-ādi sakhī-prāṇeśvara

(11) He is the lover of Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī and the very springtime of Her life. He is the Lord of the lives of all the gopīkās of Vṛndāvan, headed by Lalitā and Viśākhā.

metadata.title: Śrī Kṛṣṇera Viṁsottara-śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Kṛṣṇa is the lover of Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī and the Lord of the gopīkās of Vṛndāvan.

text:
nava-jaladhara-kānti madana-mohana
vana-mālī smera-mukha gopī-prāṇadhana

(12) Krishna possesses the loveliness of a fresh rain cloud in the Autumn sky. He is the bewilderer of Cupid, always garlanded with fresh forest flowers. His face is like a full-blown lotus flower of sweet smiles and laughter. He is the wealth of the lives of all the young maidens in Vraja.

metadata.title: Śrī Kṛṣṇera Viṁsottara-śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Krishna is described as the loveliness of a fresh rain cloud, the bewilderer of Cupid, and the wealth of the young maidens in Vraja.

text:
tri-bhaṅgī muralī-dhara jāmuna-nāgara
rādhā-kuṇḍa-raṅga-netā rasera sāgara

(13) He possesses a beautiful three-fold bending form and holds a flute known as Muralī. He is the lover of the Yamunā River, the director of all the amorous love sports at Rādhā Kuṇḍa, and He is the ocean of devotional mellows.

metadata.title: Śrī Kṛṣṇera Viṁsottara-śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Kṛṣṇa is described as the lover of the Yamunā River and the director of amorous love sports at Rādhā Kuṇḍa.

text:
chandrāvalī-prāṇanātha kautukābhilāṣī
rādhā-māna-sulampaṭa milana-prayāsī

(14) Krishna is the Lord of the life of Chandrāvalī, and He is always desirous of joking and sporting. He is very anxious to taste the rasa of his beloved Rādhikā’s feigned sulking and always endeavours for Their meeting.

metadata.title: Śrī Kṛṣṇera Viṁsottara-śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Krishna is eager to meet Rādhikā and taste the rasa of her feigned sulking.

text:
mānasa-gaṅgāra dānī prasūna-taskara
gopī-saha haṭha-kārī vraja-vaneśvara

(15) He is the giver of the Mānasa Gaṅgā Lake to the inhabitants of Vṛndāvan. This thief of flower blossoms acts very outrageously with the maidens of Vṛndāvan. not caring for social restrictions, for He is the Lord of the Vraja Maṇḍal forests.

metadata.title: Śrī Kṛṣṇera Viṁsottara-śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Kṛṣṇa acts outrageously with the gopīs in Vṛndāvan, disregarding social restrictions.

text:
gokula-sampada gopa-duḥkha-nibāraṇa
durmada-damana bhakta-santāpa-haraṇa

(16) He is the wealth of Gokul and protects the cowherd men and boys from all miseries. He curbs all foolish pride and removes all distress from His devotees.

metadata.title: Śrī Kṛṣṇera Viṁsottara-śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Kṛṣṇa protects the cowherd men and boys from all miseries and removes all distress from His devotees.

text:
sudarśana-mochana śrī-saṅkhachūḍāntaka
rāmānuja śyāma-chā̐da muralī-bādaka

(17) Krishna gives the gopīs side-long glances and is the destroyer of Śaṅkhachūḍa. He is the younger brother of Lord Baladeva, He is the beautiful dark moon of Vṛndāvan and the player of the flute.

metadata.title: Śrī Kṛṣṇera Viṁsottara-śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Krishna is described as the destroyer of Śaṅkhachūḍa and the player of the flute in a poetic description.

text:
gopī-gīta-śrotā madhusūdana murāri
ariṣṭa-ghātaka rādhā-kuṇḍādi-bihārī

(18) He hears the songs of the gopīs and is the slayer of the Madhu demon. This enemy of the demon Mura and killer of Ariṣṭāsura enjoys amorous sports and Pastimes at Rādhā Kuṇḍa and other places in Vraja.

metadata.title: Śrī Kṛṣṇera Viṁsottara-śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Kṛṣṇa is described as enjoying amorous sports and pastimes at Rādhā Kuṇḍa and other places in Vraja.

text:
vyomāntaka padma-netra keśī-nisūdana
raṅga-krīḍa kaṁsa-hantā mallu-praharaṇa

(19) Krishna is the destroyer of the demon Vyomāsura. He is lotus-eyed, the killer of the Keśī demon, frolicsome, the slayer of King Kaṁsa and the conquerer of Kaṁsa’s wrestlers, Chāṇūra and Muṣṭika.

metadata.title: Śrī Kṛṣṇera Viṁsottara-śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Krishna's pastime of killing the demon Vyomāsura and other evil beings.

text:
vasudeva-suta vṛṣṇi-baṁśa-kīrti-dhvaja
dīnanātha mathureśa devakī-garbha-ja

(20) He is the beloved son of Vasudeva and the emblem of fame for the Vṛṣṇi dynasty. The Lord of the fallen souls, Śrī Krishna, is the Lord of Mathurā and He appears to have taken birth from the womb of Devakī.

metadata.title: Śrī Kṛṣṇera Viṁsottara-śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Krishna is the beloved son of Vasudeva and the Lord of Mathurā.

text:
kubjā-kṛpāmoya viṣṇu śauri nārāyaṇa
dvārakeśa narakaghna śrī-jadunandana

(21) Krishna is full of mercy for the hunchbacked Kubjā. He is the maintainer of the entire creation, the son of Vasudeva, the refuge of all souls, the Lord of Dvārakā, the slayer of Narakāsura and the beloved descendent of the Jadu dynasty.

metadata.title: Śrī Kṛṣṇera Viṁsottara-śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Krishna shows mercy to Kubjā, a hunchbacked woman.

text:
śrī-rukmiṇī-kānta satyā-pati sura-pāla
pāṇḍava-bāndhava śiśupālādira kāla

(22) He is the lover of Rukmiṇī, the husband of Satyā, the protector of the godly, the beloved friend and relative of the five Pāṇḍava brothers and the cause of death for Śiśupāla and other demoniac kings.

metadata.title: Śrī Kṛṣṇera Viṁsottara-śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Kṛṣṇa is described as the lover of Rukmiṇī and the cause of death for Śiśupāla and other demoniac kings.

text:
jagadīśa janārdana keśavārta-trāṇa
sarva-avatāra-bīja viśvera nidāna

(23) Krishna is the Lord of the universe, the maintainer of all living beings and He possesses beautiful hair. He is the deliverer from all misery and the origin of the universe and all incarnations.

metadata.title: Śrī Kṛṣṇera Viṁsottara-śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Krishna is described as the Lord of the universe and the deliverer from all misery.

text:
māyeśvara yogeśvara brāhma-tejā-dhāra
sarvātmāra ātmā prabhu prakṛtira pāra

(24) He is the Lord of Māyā; the master of mysticism; the proprietor of the spiritual powers of the brāhmanas; the Lord, master and soul of all souls, and He is the opposite shore of the ocean of material nature.

metadata.title: Śrī Kṛṣṇera Viṁsottara-śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Description of Kṛṣṇa's opulence and supremacy.

text:
patita-pāvana jagannātha sarveśvara
vṛndāvana-chandra sarva-rasera ākara

(25) Lord Krishna is the purifier of the fallen souls, the Lord of the universe, the Lord of all beings, the moon of Vṛndāvan and the origin of all rasas.

metadata.title: Śrī Kṛṣṇera Viṁsottara-śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Lord Krishna is described as the purifier of fallen souls and the origin of all rasas.

text:
nagare nagare gorā gāy
bhakativinoda tachu pāy

(26) Lord Chaitanya sings these names of Krishna from village to village, and Ṭhākur Bhakti Vinod falls at His lotus feet.

metadata.title: Śrī Kṛṣṇera Viṁsottara-śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Lord Chaitanya travels from village to village singing the names of Krishna.

text:
-----------
Prabhu kohe
hare kṛṣṇa hare kṛṣṇa kṛṣṇa kṛṣṇa hare hare
hare rāma hare rāma rāma rāma hare hare
“prabhu kohe—kohilaṅ ei mahāmantra
ihā japa giyā sabe koriyā nirbandha
ihā hoite sarva-siddhi hoibe sabāra
sarva-kṣaṇa bolo, ithe vidhi nāhi āra”
“ki śayane ki bhojane, ki vā jāgaraṇe
aharniśa chinta kṛṣṇa, boloho vadane”
“āma-prati sneha jadi thāke sabākāra
kṛṣṇa vinā keha kichu nā bolibe āra”

(1) “The Lord said, ‘I have told you this Mahāmantra, so everyone now chant it in proper measure. By doing this, you will attain success in all respects. There is no other rule but to chant it at every moment.’ Whether resting, eating, or waking—day and night think of Krishna and call His Name aloud.”
(Śrī Chaitanya-bhāgavat Madhya 23.77-78, 28.28)

metadata.title: Prabhu kohe
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Chaitanya teaches his followers to chant the Mahāmantra at all times.

text:
------------------
Śrī Nṛsiṁha Praṇām
namas te narasiṁhāya
prahlādāhlāda-dāyine
hiraṇyakaśipor vakṣaḥ-
śilā-ṭaṅka-nakhālaye

(1) I offer my obeisances to Lord Narasiṁha, who gives joy to Prahlād Mahārāj and whose nails are like chisels on the stonelike chest of the demon Hiraṇyakaśipu.

metadata.title: Śrī Nṛsiṁha Praṇām
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A prayer to Lord Narasiṁha, offering obeisances and describing his glories.

text:
ito nṛsiṁhaḥ parato nṛsiṁho
yato yato yāmi tato nṛsiṁhaḥ
bahir nṛsiṁho hṛdaye nṛsiṁho
nṛsiṁham ādiṁ śaraṇaṁ prapadye

(2) Lord Nṛsiṁha is here and also there. Wherever I go Lord Nṛsiṁha is there. He is in the heart and is outside as well. I surrender to Lord Nṛsiṁha, the origin of all things and the supreme refuge.

metadata.title: Śrī Nṛsiṁha Praṇām
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee surrenders to Lord Nṛsiṁha, the supreme refuge and origin of all things.

text:
tava kara-kamala-vare nakham adbhuta-śṛṅgaṁ
dalita-hiraṇyakaśipu-tanu-bhṛṅgam
keśava dhṛta-narahari-rūpa jaya jagadīśa hare

(4) Oh Keśava! Oh Lord of the universe! Oh Lord Hari, who have assumed the form of half-man, half-lion! All glories to You! Just as one can easily crush a wasp between one’s fingernails, so in the same way the body of the wasplike demon Hiraṇyakaśipu has been ripped apart by the wonderful pointed nails on Your beautiful lotus hands.

metadata.title: Śrī Nṛsiṁha Praṇām
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee praises Lord Keśava for His victory over the demon Hiraṇyakaśipu.

text:
---------------
Āchārya vandana
jayare jayare jaya    paramahaṁsa mahāśaya
śrī bhaktisiddhānta sarasvatī
gosvāmī ṭhākura jaya    parama karuṇāmoya
dīnahīna agatira gati

(1) All glories, all glories to the topmost personality, Śrīla Bhakti Siddhānta Saraswatī Goswāmī Ṭhākur, who is an ocean of mercy and the only resort for the fallen souls.

metadata.title: Āchārya vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
entities: Śrīla Bhakti Siddhānta Saraswatī Goswāmī Ṭhākur
metadata.summary: A prayer of praise to Śrīla Bhakti Siddhānta Saraswatī Goswāmī Ṭhākur.

text:
nilāchole hoiyā udaya
śrī gauḍamaṇḍale āsi’    prema bhakti parakāśi’
jivera nāśilā bhava-bhaya

(2) He made his advent in Śrī Nilāchala, Śrī Puri Dhām. He came to the holy dhām of Mahāprabhu, manifesting the line of pure devotion and destroying the fear of material life of the conditioned souls.

metadata.title: Āchārya vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The advent of the Lord in Śrī Nilāchala destroyed the fear of material life of the conditioned souls.

text:
tomāra mahimā gāi    heno sādhya mora nāi
tobe pāri jodi deho śakti
viśvahite avirata    āchāra-prachāre rata
viśuddha śrī rūpānuga bhakti

(3) I have no capacity to sing your glories. Only if you empower me can I do so. You are travelling unceasingly all over India, practising and preaching in a dedicated way, the pure and genuine line of devotion in the current of Śrīla Rūpa Goswāmī.

metadata.title: Āchārya vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker expresses their inability to sing the glories of the Lord without empowerment, and describes the Lord's unceasing travels and preaching throughout India.

text:
śrīpāṭ khetari dhāma    ṭhākura śrī narottama
tomāte tā̐hāra guṇa dekhi
śāstrera siddhānta-sāra    śuni lāge chamatkāra
kutārkika dite nāre phā̐ki

(4) We see your qualities are like Śrīla Narottam Dās Ṭhākur who in the festival at Khetari Dhām delivered all the wonderful conclusions of the Scriptures which defeated the unfair argument and deception of the scholars there.

metadata.title: Āchārya vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrīla Narottam Dās Ṭhākur delivered the wonderful conclusions of the Scriptures at Khetari Dhām.

text:
śuddha bhakti-mata jata    upadharma-kavalita
heriyā lokera mone trāsa
hāni’ susiddhānta-vāṇa    upadharma khāna khāna
sajjanera vāḍāle ullāsa

(5) By presenting the line of pure devotion he devoured the path of unscriptural practice, and seeing this everybody was afraid. He struck this unscriptural path leaving it in pieces, giving increasing joy to all honest and noble men.

metadata.title: Āchārya vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Chaitanya Mahaprabhu rejected unscriptural practices and promoted pure devotion.

text:
smārtamata jaladhara    śuddha bhakti robi-kara
āchādila bhāviyā antare
śāstra sindhu manthanete    susiddhānta jhañjhāvāte
uḍāilā dig digantare

(6) Pure devotion is like the sun risen in the heart, while the path of logic is like clouds covering that sun. By churning the ocean of the Scriptures, you spread perfect conclusions in all directions like a hurricane to disperse the clouds.

metadata.title: Āchārya vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Pure devotion is compared to the sun, while logic is compared to clouds that cover the sun.

text:
sthāne sthāne koto moṭh    sthāpiyācha niṣkapoṭ
prema sevā śikhāite jīve
moṭhera vaiṣṇava goṇ    kore sadā vitaroṇ
hari guṇa-kathāmṛta bhave

(7) You founded many temples in many places without reservation, teaching the fallen souls service in divine love. In these temples the Vaiṣṇavas constantly distribute talks on the nectarean qualities of the Supreme Lord Hari.

metadata.title: Āchārya vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The founder established many temples where Vaiṣṇavas preach about the qualities of the Supreme Lord Hari.

text:
śuddha-bhakti-mandākinī    vimala pravāha āni
śitala korilā taptaprāṇa
deśe deśe niṣkiñchan    prerilā vaiṣṇava goṇ
vistārite hariguṇa gāna

(8) The current of pure devotion descends like the flow of the Ganges, cooling the fire of suffering of material life. Similarly, you sent the Vaiṣṇavas from place to place, widely distributing and chanting the qualities of Lord Hari.

metadata.title: Āchārya vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu sent Vaiṣṇavas to spread the qualities of Lord Hari.

text:
pūrve yathā gaurahari    māyāvāda cheda kori
vaiṣṇava korilā kāśivāsī
vaiṣṇava darśana-sukṣma    vichāre tumi he dakṣa
temati toṣilā vārāṇasī

(9) Just as in the past, Lord Gaurahari severed the māyāvāda conception,  converting  the  residents  of Vārāṇasī into Vaiṣṇavas, similarly by expert analysis of the Vaiṣṇava philosophy you have enraptured all in Vārāṇasī.

metadata.title: Āchārya vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Lord Gaurahari converted the residents of Vārāṇasī into Vaiṣṇavas by severing the māyāvāda conception.

text:
daiva-varṇāśrama-dharma    hari bhakti jāra marma
śāstra jukte korilā-niśchoy
jñana-joga-karma choy    mūlya tāra kichu noy
bhaktira virodhī jodi hoy

(10) You showed that certainly devotion to Lord Hari at the core of daiva-varṇāśrama-dharma, is the directive of the revealed Scriptures, while knowledge, yoga and material activities, if averse to such devotion are of absolutely no value.

metadata.title: Āchārya vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Devotion to Lord Hari is the core of daiva-varṇāśrama-dharma and is directed by revealed Scriptures.

text:
śrī gauḍamaṇḍala bhūmi    bhakta saṅge parikrami
sukīrti sthāpilā mahāśoy
abhinna vraja maṇḍala    gauḍabhūmi premojvala
prachāra hoilo viśvamoy

(11) You founded parikramā of Śrī Gauḍa Maṇḍal, Śrī Nabadwīp Dhām in the association of the devotees, showing your glories as a great devotee. You showed the whole world the nectarean blissful nature of Śrī Gauḍa Maṇḍal and how it is non-different from Śrī Vraja Maṇḍal, Śrī Vṛndāvan.

metadata.title: Āchārya vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu founded the parikramā of Śrī Gauḍa Maṇḍal, showcasing its connection to Śrī Vraja Maṇḍal.

text:
kuliyāte pāṣaṇḍīrā    atyāchāra koilo jā’rā
tā sabāra doṣa kṣomā kori
jagate koile ghoṣaṇā    ‘taroriva sahiṣṇunā’
hon ‘kīrtanīyaḥ sadā hariḥ’

(12) You forgave all the atheists of Kuliyā village, despite their blasphemous behaviour. Loudly you proclaimed to one and all, one who is more tolerant than a tree can chant the glories of Lord Hari endlessly.

metadata.title: Āchārya vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Chaitanya Mahaprabhu forgave the atheists of Kuliyā village and preached the importance of chanting Lord Hari's glories.

text:
śrī viśva-vaiṣṇava-rāja    sabhā-madhye ‘pātrarāja’
upādhi-bhūṣaṇe vibhūṣita
viśvera maṅgala lāgi’    hoiyācho sarva’ tyāgī
viśvavāsī jon-hite rata

(13) In the grand assembly of Vaiṣṇava kings you are adorned with the title ‘Pātrarāj’, as the head of the assembly. For the benefit of the whole world, you have renounced everything and devoted yourself to the good of all.

metadata.title: Āchārya vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker addresses Viśva-vaiṣṇava-rāja as the head of the assembly and praises his renunciation and devotion to the good of all.

text:
koritecho upakāra    jāte para upakāra
lobhe jīva śrī kṛṣṇa-sevāya
dūre jāya bhava-roga    khaṇḍe jāhe karma bhoga
hari pāda padma jā’te pāya

(14) You untiringly perform benevolent works just to help the souls of this world to attain the service of Lord Śrī Krishna. Then the disease of material suffering would leave them, their bondage to fruitive works would break and they would attain the lotus feet of the Lord.

metadata.title: Āchārya vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Performing benevolent works helps souls attain Lord Śrī Krishna's service, leading to the end of material suffering and attainment of the Lord's lotus feet.

text:
jīva moha-nidrā gata    jāgā’te vaikuṇṭha dūta
‘gauḍīya’ pāṭhāo ghore ghore
uṭhore uṭhore bhāi    āro to samoya nāi
‘kṛṣṇa bhaja’ bole uchaiḥsvare

(15) Seeing the souls of this world sleeping in illusion, you are sending the ‘Gauḍīya’ magazine from door to door just like a messenger from the transcendental plane. It calls aloud, “Awake, arise, O brother, there is no more time to waste, Serve and worship your Lord, Śrī Krishna.”

metadata.title: Āchārya vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The Gauḍīya magazine is compared to a messenger from the transcendental plane, calling people to serve and worship Śrī Krishna.

text:
tomāra mukhāravinda-    vigalita makaranda
siñchita achyuta-guṇa-gāthā
śunile juḍāya prāṇa    tamo moha antardhāna
dūre jāya hṛdoyera vyathā

(16) Hearing the nectarean verses of the glorious qualities of the infallible Lord Krishna, issuing from your lotus mouth soothes our souls, dissipates our ignorance and illusion, and the pain in our hearts goes far away.

metadata.title: Āchārya vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The nectarean verses of the glorious qualities of Lord Krishna soothe the soul and dissipate ignorance and illusion.

text:
jāni āmi mahāśoy    jaśovāñchā nāhi hoy
bindu mātra tomāra antare
tava guṇa vīṇādhārī,    mora kaṇṭha-vīṇā dhori’
avaśete bolāya āmāre

(17) O great soul! I know that there is no trace of desire for fame in your heart. Your qualities, like an expert musician, take hold of the vīṇā of my voice and make me speak, devoid of any power over myself.

metadata.title: Āchārya vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee describes being inspired by the qualities of a great soul to speak without any personal desire.

text:
vaiṣṇavera guṇa-gāna    korile jīvera trāṇa
śuniyāchi sādhu guru mukhe
kṛṣṇa bhakti-samudoy    janama saphala hoy
e bhava-sāgara tore sukhe

(18) I have heard from the great saints and gurus mouths that upon hearing the qualities of the Vaiṣṇava saints, the conditioned souls attain liberation. And beyond this, devotion to Krishna develops, makes the soul’s birth perfect and the soul crosses this material ocean happily with ease.

metadata.title: Āchārya vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Devotion to Krishna develops upon hearing the qualities of the Vaiṣṇava saints, making the soul's birth perfect and allowing it to cross the material ocean happily.

text:
te-kāraṇe prayāsa    yathā vāmanera āśa
gaganera chā̐da dhori bāre
adoṣa-daraśī tumi    adhama patita āmi
nija guṇe kṣomivā āmāre

(19) For this reason I endeavour thus, just like a dwarf aspiring to reach the moon. I am lowly and fallen, but your nature is not to consider any offence, so I beg you to pardon my flaws.

metadata.title: Āchārya vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker, feeling lowly and fallen, humbly requests Kṛṣṇa to pardon their flaws.

text:
śrī gaurāṅga-pāriṣada    ṭhākura bhaktivinoda
dīnahīna patitera bandhu
kali-tamaḥ vināśite    ānilena avanīte
toma’ akalaṅka pūrṇa indu

(20) Śrīla Bhakti Vinod Ṭhākur, the associate of Śrī Gaurāṅga Mahāprabhu and friend of the lowly fallen souls brought you here, and you came like a spotless full moon to dispel the ignorance of this age of Kali.

metadata.title: Āchārya vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrīla Bhakti Vinod Ṭhākur brought Śrī Gaurāṅga Mahāprabhu to dispel the ignorance of this age of Kali.

text:
kara kṛpā vitaraṇa    premasudhā anukṣaṇa
mātiyā uṭhuka jīva goṇ
harināma-saṅkīrtane    nāchuka jagata-jane
vaiṣṇava-dāsera nivedan

(21) So please keep incessantly showering your mercy, the nectar of ecstatic love of Godhead, and let all the souls of this world be uplifted by that. May all the people of the world dance in the congregational chanting of the Lord’s Holy Name—this is the prayer of this servant of the Vaiṣṇavas.

metadata.title: Āchārya vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A prayer for the mercy of Kṛṣṇa and the congregational chanting of His Holy Name.

text:
--------------
Śuddha-bhakata
śuddha-bhakata-    charaṇa-reṇu,
bhajana-anukūla
bhakata-sevā,    parama-siddhi,
prema-latikāra mūla

(1) Dust from the lotus feet of pure devotees is conducive to devotional service, while service to the Vaiṣṇavas is itself the supreme perfection and the root of the tender creeper of divine love.

metadata.title: Śuddha-bhakata
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Dust from the lotus feet of pure devotees is conducive to devotional service.

text:
mādhava-tithi,    bhakti-jananī,
jatane pālana kori
kṛṣṇa-basati,    basati boli’,
parama ādare bori

(2) I observe with great care the holy days like Ekādaśī and Janmāṣṭamī, for they are the mother of devotion. As my dwelling place I choose with the greatest reverence and love the transcendental abode of Śrī Krishna.

metadata.title: Śuddha-bhakata
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker expresses reverence for the transcendental abode of Śrī Krishna and observes holy days like Ekādaśī and Janmāṣṭamī.

text:
gaura āmāra,    je-saba sthāne,
koralo bhramaṇa raṅge
se-saba sthāna,    heribo āmi,
praṇayi-bhakata-saṅge

(3) All those places where my Lord Gaurasundar travelled for Pastimes I will visit in the company of loving devotees.

metadata.title: Śuddha-bhakata
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker intends to visit all the places where Gaurasundar travelled for his pastimes, accompanied by loving devotees.

text:
mṛdaṅga-bādya,    śunite mon,
abasara sadā jāche
gaura-bihita,    kīrtana śuni’,
ānande hṛdoya nāche

(4) My mind always begs for the opportunity to hear the music of the mṛdaṅga. Upon hearing the kind of kīrtan ordained by Lord Gaurachandra, my heart dances in ecstasy.

metadata.title: Śuddha-bhakata
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker's heart dances in ecstasy upon hearing kīrtan ordained by Lord Gaurachandra.

text:
jugala-mūrti,    dekhiyā mora,
parama-ānanda hoy
prasāda-sevā    korite hoya,
sakala prapañcha jay

(5) By beholding the Deity forms of the divine couple, Śrī Śrī Rādhā-Krishna, I feel the greatest joy. By honouring the Lord’s prasādam I conquer over all worldly illusions.

metadata.title: Śuddha-bhakata
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee feels great joy by beholding the Deity forms of Śrī Śrī Rādhā-Krishna and conquers worldly illusions by honouring the Lord’s prasādam.

text:
je-dina gṛhe,    bhajana dekhi,
gṛhete goloka bhāya
charaṇa-sīdhu,    dekhiyā gaṅgā,
sukha nā sīmā pāya

(6) Goloka Vṛndāvan appears in my home whenever I see the worship and service of Lord Hari going on there. Upon seeing the Ganges, which is a river of nectar emanating from the lotus feet of the Lord, my happiness knows no bounds.

metadata.title: Śuddha-bhakata
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Goloka Vṛndāvan appears in one's home when they see the worship and service of Lord Hari.

text:
tulasī dekhi’,    juḍāya prāṇa,
mādhava-toṣaṇī jāni’
gaura-priya,    śāka-sevane,
jīvana sārthaka māni

(7) The sight of the holy Tulasī tree soothes my soul, for I know she gives pleasure to Lord Krishna. By honouring śāk [a green leafy vegetable preparation], a dear favourite of Lord Chaitanya, I consider life worthwhile.

metadata.title: Śuddha-bhakata
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee finds life worthwhile by honouring Lord Chaitanya's favourite śāk and Lord Krishna's favourite Tulasī tree.

text:
bhakativinoda,    kṛṣṇa-bhajane,
anukūla pāya jāhā
prati-divase,    parama-sukhe,
svīkāra karaye tāhā

(8) Whatever Bhakti Vinod obtains that is conducive for the service of Śrī Krishna, he accepts every day with the greatest of joy.

metadata.title: Śuddha-bhakata
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Bhakti Vinod accepts every day what is conducive for the service of Śrī Krishna with great joy.

text:
---------------------
Śrī Daśāvatār-stotram
pralaya-payodhi-jale dhṛtavān asi vedaṁ
vihita-vahitra-charitram akhedam
keśava dhṛta-mīna-śarīra jaya jagadīśa hare

(1) Oh Keśava! Oh Lord of the universe! Oh Lord Hari, who have assumed the form of a fish! All glories to You! You easily acted as a boat in the form of a giant fish just to give protection to the Vedas, which had become immersed in the turbulent sea of devastation.

metadata.title: Śrī Daśāvatār-stotram
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Daśāvatār-stotram praises Lord Keśava's form as a fish to protect the Vedas.

text:
kṣitir iha vipulatare tiṣṭhati tava pṛṣṭhe
dharaṇi-dharaṇa-kina-chakra-gariṣṭhe
keśava dhṛta-kūrma-śarīra jaya jagadīśa hare

(2) Oh Keśava! Oh Lord of the universe! Oh Lord Hari, who have assumed the form of a tortoise! All glories to You! In this incarnation as a divine tortoise the great Mandara Mountain rests upon Your gigantic back as a pivot for churning the ocean of milk. From holding up the huge mountain a large scarlike depression is put in Your back, which has become most glorious.

metadata.title: Śrī Daśāvatār-stotram
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The text describes the divine pastime of Lord Keśava as a tortoise, holding up the Mandara Mountain for the churning of the ocean of milk.

text:
vasati daśana-śikhare dharaṇī tava lagnā
śaśini kalaṅka-kaleva nimagnā
keśava dhṛta-śūkara-rūpa jaya jagadīśa hare

(3) Oh Keśava! Oh Lord of the universe! Oh Lord Hari, who have assumed the form of a boar! All glories to You! The earth, which had become immersed in the Garbhodaka Ocean at the bottom of the universe, sits fixed upon the tip of Your tusk like a spot upon the moon.

metadata.title: Śrī Daśāvatār-stotram
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The text describes Lord Keśava's form as a boar and his ability to lift the earth from the Garbhodaka Ocean.

text:
tava kara-kamala-vare nakham adbhuta-śṛṅgaṁ
dalita-hiraṇyakaśipu-tanu-bhṛṅgam
keśava dhṛta-narahari-rūpa jaya jagadīśa hare

(4) Oh Keśava! Oh Lord of the universe! Oh Lord Hari, who have assumed the form of half-man, half-lion! All glories to You! Just as one can easily crush a wasp between one’s fingernails, so in the same way the body of the wasplike demon Hiraṇyakaśipu has been ripped apart by the wonderful pointed nails on Your beautiful lotus hands.

metadata.title: Śrī Daśāvatār-stotram
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee praises Lord Keśava for His victory over the demon Hiraṇyakaśipu.

text:
chalayasi vikramaṇe balim adbhuta-vāmana
pada-nakha-nīra-janita-jana-pāvana
keśava dhṛta-vāmana-rūpa jaya jagadīśa hare

(5) Oh Keśava! Oh Lord of the universe! Oh Lord Hari, who have assumed the form of a dwarf-brāhmaṇ! All glories to You! Oh wonderful dwarf, by Your massive steps You deceive King Bali, and by the Ganges water that has emanated from the nails of Your lotus feet, You deliver all living beings within this world.

metadata.title: Śrī Daśāvatār-stotram
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The text describes the divine pastime of Lord Keśava assuming the form of a dwarf-brāhmaṇ to deceive King Bali and deliver all living beings.

text:
kṣatriya-rudhira-maye jagad-apagata-pāpaṁ
snapayasi payasi śamita-bhava-tāpam
keśava dhṛta-bhṛgupati-rūpa jaya jagadīśa hare

(6) Oh Keśava! Oh Lord of the universe! Oh Lord Hari, who have assumed the form of Bhṛgupati [Paraśurāma]! All glories to You! At Kurukṣetra You bathe the earth in the rivers of blood from the bodies of the demoniac kṣatriyas that You have slain. The sins of the world are washed away by You, and because of You people are relieved from the blazing fire of material existence.

metadata.title: Śrī Daśāvatār-stotram
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker praises Keśava for washing away the world's sins and relieving people from material existence.

text:
vitarasi dikṣu raṇe dik-pati-kamanīyaṁ
daśa-mukha-mauli-baliṁ ramaṇīyam
keśava dhṛta-rāma-śarīra jaya jagadīśa hare

(7) Oh Keśava! Oh Lord of the universe! Oh Lord Hari, who have assumed the form of Rāmachandra! All glories to You! In the battle of Laṅkā You destroy the ten-headed demon Rāvaṇa and distribute his heads as a delightful offering to the presiding deities of the ten directions, headed by Indra. This action was long desired by all of them, who were much harassed by this monster.

metadata.title: Śrī Daśāvatār-stotram
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Keśava defeats Rāvaṇa in the battle of Laṅkā and distributes his heads as an offering to the presiding deities of the ten directions.

text:
vahasi vapuṣi viśade vasanaṁ jaladābhaṁ
hala-hati-bhīti-milita yamunābham
keśava dhṛta-haladhara-rūpa jaya jagadīśa hare

(8) Oh Keśava! Oh Lord of the universe! Oh Lord Hari, who have assumed the form of Balarām, the wielder of the plow! All glories to You! On Your brilliant white body You wear garments the colour of a fresh blue rain cloud. These garments are coloured like the beautiful dark hue of the River Yamunā, who feels great fear due to the striking of Your plowshare.

metadata.title: Śrī Daśāvatār-stotram
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee praises Keśava, describing his beautiful form and the fear of Yamunā at his plowshare.

text:
nindasi yajña-vidher ahaha śruti-jātaṁ
sadaya-hṛdoya darśita-paśu-ghātam
keśava dhṛta-buddha-śarīra jaya jagadīśa hare

(9) Oh Keśava! Oh Lord of the universe! Oh Lord Hari, who have assumed the form of Buddha! All glories to You! Oh Buddha of compassionate heart, you decry the slaughtering of poor animals performed according to the rules of Vedic sacrifice.

metadata.title: Śrī Daśāvatār-stotram
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song praising Lord Keśava for his compassion towards animals.

text:
mlecha nivaha-nidhane kalayasi karavālaṁ
dhūmaketum iva kim api karālam
keśava dhṛta-kalki-śarīra jaya jagadīśa hare

(10) Oh Keśava! Oh Lord of the universe! Oh Lord Hari, who have assumed the form of Kalki! All glories to You! You appear like a comet and carry a terrifying sword for bringing about the annihilation of the wicked barbarian men at the end of the Kali-yuga.

metadata.title: Śrī Daśāvatār-stotram
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee praises Lord Keśava, who has assumed the form of Kalki, for bringing about the end of the Kali-yuga.

text:
śrī-jayadeva-kaver idam uditam udāraṁ
śṛṇu sukha-daṁ śubha-daṁ bhava-sāram
keśava dhṛta-daśa-vidha-rūpa jaya jagadīśa hare

(11) Oh Keśava! Oh Lord of the universe! Oh Lord Hari, who have assumed these ten different forms of incarnation! All glories to You! Oh readers, please hear this hymn of the poet Jayadeva, which is most excellent, an awarder of happiness, a bestower of auspiciousness, and is the best thing in this dark world.

metadata.title: Śrī Daśāvatār-stotram
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song from Gītā Govinda, praising Keśava's incarnations and asking readers to hear the poem.

text:
vedān udharate jaganti vahate bhū-golam udbibhrate
daityaṁ dārayate baliṁ chalayate
kṣatra-kṣayaṁ kurvate
paulastyaṁ jayate halaṁ kalayate kāruṇyam ātanvate
mlechān mūrchayate daśākṛti-kṛte
kṛṣṇāya tubhyaṁ namaḥ

(12) Oh Lord Krishna, I offer my obeisances unto You, who appear in the forms of these ten incarnations. In the form of Matsya You rescue the Vedas, and as Kūrma You bear the Mandara Mountain on Your back. As Varāha You lift the earth with Your tusk, and in the form of Narasiṁha You tear open the chest of the demon Hiraṇyakaśipu. In the form of Vāmana You trick the demoniac king Bali by asking him for only three steps of land, and then You take away the whole universe from him by expanding Your steps. As Paraśurāma You slay all of the wicked kṣatriyas, and as Rāmachandra You conquer the rākṣasa king Rāvaṇa. In the form of Balarām You carry a plough with which You subdue the wicked and draw toward You the River Yamunā. As Lord Buddha You show compassion toward all the living beings suffering in this world, and at the end of the Kali-yuga You appear as Kalki to bewilder the mlechas [degraded low-class men].

metadata.title: Śrī Daśāvatār-stotram
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The text describes the various incarnations of Lord Krishna and their activities.

text:
--------------------
Śrī Nagara Kīrtana 8
‘hari’ bole’ modera gaura elo

(1) (Refrain:) Our Lord Gaura came chanting “Hari! Hari!”

metadata.title: Śrī Nagara Kīrtana 8
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Nagara Kīrtana 8 describes the arrival of Lord Gaura chanting Hari.

text:
elo re gaurāṅga-chānd preme
elothelo nitāi-advaita-saṅge godrume paśilo

(2) Lord Gaurāṅga-chānd came looking very disheveled, as if mad, due to ecstatic love of God, and along with Lord Nityānanda and Advaita Āchārya, He entered the land of Godruma.

metadata.title: Śrī Nagara Kīrtana 8
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Lord Gaurāṅga-chānd enters the land of Godruma with Nityānanda and Advaita Āchārya.

text:
saṅkīrtana-rase mete nam bilāilo
nāmera hāṭe ese preme jagat bhāsāilo

(3) Deeply absorbed in the intoxicating mellows of sankirtan, He distributed the holy name. Having come to the Marketplace of the Holy Name, He caused the whole universe to swim in ecstatic love of God.

metadata.title: Śrī Nagara Kīrtana 8
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Kṛṣṇa distributed the holy name and caused the universe to swim in ecstatic love of God.

text:
godruma-vāsīr āj duḥkha dūre gelo
bhakta-vṛnda-saṅge āsi’ hāṭa jāgāilo

(4) Today all the miseries of the residents of Godruma-dvīpa have gone far away, for Lord Gaurāṅga, having come here along with all His devotees, caused the Marketplace of the Holy Name to appear here in Godruma.

metadata.title: Śrī Nagara Kīrtana 8
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Lord Gaurāṅga and His devotees brought the Holy Name to Godruma-dvīpa, alleviating its miseries.

text:
nādīya bhramite gorā elo nāmer hāṭe
gaura elo hāṭe, saṅge nitāi elo hāṭe

(5) Wandering all over the land of Nadia, Lord Gaura came to the Marketplace of the Holy Name. Lord Gaura came to the Marketplace along with Nitāi.

metadata.title: Śrī Nagara Kīrtana 8
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Lord Gaura and Nitāi visit the Marketplace of the Holy Name in Nadia.

text:
nāche mātoyārā nitāi godrumera māṭhe
jagat mātāy nitāi premera mālasāṭe

(6) Maddened with ecstasy, Lord Nityānanda dances in the fields of Godruma. Due to ecstatic love of God, He moves His powerful arms like a challenging wrestler and thus overwhelms the universe in ecstasy.

metadata.title: Śrī Nagara Kīrtana 8
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Lord Nityānanda dances in ecstasy in the fields of Godruma, overwhelming the universe with love.

text:
(torā dekhe’ jā’ re)
advaitādi bhakta-vṛnda nāche ghāṭe ghāṭe
palāya duranta kali poḍiyā bibhrāṭe

(7) (Oh, all of you please go and see!) The Vaiṣṇavas headed by Advaita Āchārya are dancing along the banks of the Gaṅga from one bathing ghat to the next! At such a sight as this, the wicked personality Kali falls into great danger and thus runs for his life.

metadata.title: Śrī Nagara Kīrtana 8
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The Vaiṣṇavas, led by Advaita Āchārya, dance along the Gaṅga, causing Kali to flee in fear.

text:
ki sukhe bhāsilo jīva gorāchānder nāṭe
dekhiyā śuniyā pāṣanḍīr buka phāṭe

(8) In what indescribable happiness did all living beings swim while Lord Gaurachandra was dancing? By seeing and hearing of such Pastimes, the hearts of the atheists break.

metadata.title: Śrī Nagara Kīrtana 8
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The pastimes of Lord Gaurachandra bring indescribable happiness to living beings and break the hearts of atheists.

text:
-----------------------
Āchārya-charaṇa-vandana
jaya śrīla mahārāja charaṇāravinda
śrī bhakti sundara deva-gosvāmī govinda

(1) Glory to the lotus feet of our Śrī Gurudeva,
Śrī Bhakti Sundara Deva-Goswāmī Govinda

metadata.title: Āchārya-charaṇa-vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song offering praise to the guru, Śrī Bhakti Sundara Deva-Goswāmī Govinda.

text:
jagatera sumaṅgala koribāra āśe
tumi avatīrṇa hoilā snigdha guru-veśe

(2) Wishing Grace Divine upon the whole of the creation,
From Goloka came thee down, most Gracious Incarnation.

metadata.title: Āchārya-charaṇa-vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee wishes divine grace upon the creation and acknowledges Kṛṣṇa's gracious incarnation.

text:
praphulla nalina jena hāsimākhā mukha
dekhi vṛddha-bāla-juvā pāya mahā-sukha

(3) Hundred-petalled lotus flower—Lotus Face ablooming,
Young and old behold thee, all their hearts’ joy overflowing.

metadata.title: Āchārya-charaṇa-vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The description of Kṛṣṇa's beautiful face brings joy to all, regardless of age.

text:
svadeśe-videśe harināmera prachāre
abhinava gaura-preme bhāsāle sabāre

(4) Both home and abroad Lord’s Hallowed Name thou art apreaching,
Flood of Love for Gaura entire planet inundating.

metadata.title: Āchārya-charaṇa-vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee is preaching the Lord's Name and spreading love for Gaura throughout the world.

text:
śrī-kore lekhanī jena ananta phoyārā
sumadhura divyavāṇī-vigalita-dhārā

(5) Benedictine fountain from thy pen in hand awriting,
Sweetest songs of Love Divine a flow is never ending.

metadata.title: Āchārya-charaṇa-vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A poetic description of the sweetness of divine love.

text:
su-siddhānta-dhārādhara satya sugambhīra
śrī-guru-vaiṣṇava-sevā-niṣṭha mahādhīra

(6) Agent of the Waves of Perfect Truth—fathomless ocean,
Serve Śrī Guru and Vaiṣṇava! thy heart’s dedication.

metadata.title: Āchārya-charaṇa-vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song encouraging service to Śrī Guru and Vaiṣṇava.

text:
sādhu-priya saralatā tomāra bhūṣaṇa
amānī mānada sadā miṣṭha-sambhāṣaṇa

(7) Truthful heart adored by saints—thy natural compassion,
Always humble, giving honour, in sweet conversation.

metadata.title: Āchārya-charaṇa-vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The verse describes the qualities of a devotee, specifically their natural compassion and humility.

text:
guru-mahārāja jatirāja-rājeśvara
śrī-bhakti-rakṣaka deva-gosvāmī śrīdhara

(8) Guru Mahārāj of Nyāsī Kings the Great Grandfather,
Śrī-Bhakti-Rakṣaka Deva-Goswāmī Śrīdhara

metadata.title: Āchārya-charaṇa-vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A reference to Guru Mahārāj and Śrī-Bhakti-Rakṣaka Deva-Goswāmī Śrīdhara.

text:
parama sontuṣṭa tava viśrambha-sevāya
nija-hāte vyāsāsane vasā’la tomāya

(9) Satisfied supremely with thy Service dedicated,
By his own hand did he place thee on his chair exalted.

metadata.title: Āchārya-charaṇa-vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Kṛṣṇa is satisfied with the devotee's service and places them on an exalted seat.

text:
sukhe manonīta koilā uttarādhikārī
ehena apūrva sneha kothāo nā heri

(10) Joyfully as his successor he hath thee achosen,
Such benign affection ne’er we find in all creation.

metadata.title: Āchārya-charaṇa-vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee expresses joy and affection for Kṛṣṇa, comparing it to the greatest love in creation.

text:
rūpa-sarasvatī-śrīdhar-dhārā-srotasvinī
tava hṛde vahe sadā bhuvana pāvanī

(11) Rūpa-Saraswatī-Śrīdhar River flowing freely,
From thy heart throughout the world makes everything so holy.

metadata.title: Āchārya-charaṇa-vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song describing the River flowing from the heart of the divine.

text:
śīva-guru-saṅkarṣaṇa karuṇā-nilaya
nityānanda-rūpe tava hṛde vilasaya

(12) Supreme God of Good our Guide, compassion’s Divine Treasure,
Ever plays within thy heart as Nityānanda’s Pleasure.

metadata.title: Āchārya-charaṇa-vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song describing Nityānanda's divine pleasure within the heart of the Supreme God of Good.

text:
sujana sudhīra-gaṇa tava guṇa-gāya
durbhāgā vañchita aparādhe more hāya

(13) Faithfully the true devotees sing thy Supreme Glories,
Lost, deluded souls dishonour thee, alas! and perish.

metadata.title: Āchārya-charaṇa-vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: True devotees praise Kṛṣṇa's glories, while deluded souls dishonor and perish.

text:
guru-gaura-kṛṣṇa-sevā-saubhāgya-prakāśe
sānande adhama bhāse saṅkīrtana rāse

(14) By thy Grace shall we now serve our Lord and Golden Master,
This fallen soul exults in thy Sweet Chanting Dance forever

metadata.title: Āchārya-charaṇa-vandana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee expresses their joy and commitment to serving Lord Gaura and Kṛṣṇa through chanting.

text:
----------------------
Śrī Śrī Dāmodarāṣṭakam
namāmīśvaraṁ sachchidānanda rūpaṁ
lasat-kuṇḍalaṁ gokule bhrājamānam
yaśodā-bhiyolūkhalād dhāvamānaṁ
parāmṛṣṭam atyaṁ tato drutya gopyā

(1) To the Supreme Lord, whose form is the embodiment of eternal existence, knowledge, and bliss, whose shark-shaped earrings are swinging to and fro, who is beautifully shining in the divine realm of Gokul, who [due to the offence of breaking the pot of yoghurt that his mother was churning into butter and then stealing the butter that was kept hanging from a swing] is quickly running from the wooden grinding mortar in fear of Mother Yaśodā, but who has been caught from behind by her who ran after Him with greater speed—to that Supreme Lord, Śrī Dāmodar, I offer my humble obeisances.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Dāmodarāṣṭakam
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Dāmodarāṣṭakam is a devotional song describing Kṛṣṇa's divine pastimes in Gokul.

text:
rudantaṁ muhur netra-yugmaṁ mṛjantaṁ
karāmbhoja-yugmena sātaṅka-netram
muhuḥ śvāsa-kampa-trirekhāṅka-kaṇṭha-
sthita-graiva dāmodaraṁ bhakti-baddham

(2) [Seeing the whipping stick in His mother’s hand,] He is crying and rubbing His eyes again and again with His two lotus hands. His eyes are filled with fear, and the necklace of pearls around His neck, which is marked with three lines like a conchshell, is shaking because of His quick breathing due to crying. To this Supreme Lord, Śrī Dāmodar, whose belly is bound not with ropes but with His mother’s pure love, I offer my humble obeisances.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Dāmodarāṣṭakam
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Krishna is crying and rubbing His eyes after seeing a whipping stick in His mother's hand.

text:
itīdṛk sva-līlābhir ānanda-kuṇḍe
sva-ghoṣaṁ nimajjantam ākhyāpayantaṁ
tadīyeṣita-jñeṣu bhaktair jitatvaṁ
punaḥ prematas taṁ śatāvṛtti vande

(3) By such childhood Pastimes as this He is drowning the inhabitants of Gokul in pools of ecstasy, and is revealing to those devotees who are absorbed in knowledge of His supreme majesty and opulence that He is only conquered by devotees whose pure love is imbued with intimacy and is free from all conceptions of awe and reverence. With great love I again offer my obeisances to Lord Dāmodar hundreds and hundreds of times.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Dāmodarāṣṭakam
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Kṛṣṇa's childhood pastimes bring ecstasy to the inhabitants of Gokul, and He is only conquered by devotees with pure love.

text:
varaṁ deva mokṣaṁ na mokṣāvadhiṁ vā
na chānyaṁ vṛṇe ’haṁ vareśād apīha
idan te vapur nātha gopāla-bālaṁ
sadā me manasy āvirāstāṁ kim anyaiḥ

(4) Oh Lord, although You are able to give all kinds of benedictions, I do not pray to You for the boon of impersonal liberation, nor the highest liberation of eternal life in Vaikuṇṭha, nor any other boon [which may be obtained by executing the nine processes of bhakti]. Oh Lord, I simply wish that this form of Yours as Bāla Gopāl in Vṛndāvan may ever be manifest in my heart, for what is the use to me of any other boon besides this?

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Dāmodarāṣṭakam
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee prays for the form of Bāla Gopāl to always be manifest in their heart.

text:
idan te mukhāmbhojam avyakta-nīlair
vṛtaṁ kuntalaiḥ snigdha-raktaiś cha gopyā
muhuś chumbitaṁ bimba-raktādharaṁ me
manasy āvirāstām alaṁ lakṣa-lābhaiḥ

(5) Oh Lord, Your lotus face, which is encircled by locks of soft black hair tinged with red, is kissed again and again by Mother Yaśoda, and Your lips are reddish like the bimba fruit. May this beautiful vision of Your lotus face be ever manifest in my heart. Thousands and thousands of other benedictions are of no use to me.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Dāmodarāṣṭakam
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee prays for the vision of Kṛṣṇa's lotus face to be ever manifest in their heart.

text:
namo deva dāmodarānanta viṣṇo
prasīda prabho duḥkha-jālābdhi-magnaṁ
kṛpā-dṛṣṭi-vṛṣṭyāti-dīnaṁ batānu-
gṛhāṇeśa mām ajñam edhy akṣi-dṛśyaḥ

(6) O Supreme Godhead, I offer my obeisances unto You. O Dāmodar! O Ananta! O Viṣṇu! O Master! O my Lord, be pleased upon me. By showering Your glance of mercy upon me, deliver this poor ignorant fool who is immersed in an ocean of worldly sorrows, and become visible to my eyes.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Dāmodarāṣṭakam
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee prays to Lord Viṣṇu for deliverance from worldly sorrows.

text:
kuverātmajau baddha-mūrtyaiva yadvat
tvayā mochitau bhakti-bhājau kṛtau cha
tathā prema-bhaktiṁ svakāṁ me prayacha
na mokṣe graho me ’sti dāmodareha

(7) O Lord Dāmodar, just as the two sons of Kuvera — Maṇigrīva and Nalakīśvara — were delivered from the curse of Nārada and made into great devotees by You in Your form as a baby tied with rope to a wooden grinding mortar, in the same way, please give to me Your own prema-bhakti. I only long for this and have no desire for any kind of liberation.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Dāmodarāṣṭakam
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee requests Lord Dāmodara to grant him prema-bhakti, just as He did for the two sons of Kuvera.

text:
namas te ’stu dāmne sphurad-dīpti-dhāmne
tvadīyodarāyātha viśvasya dhāmne
namo rādhikāyai tvadīya-priyāyai
namo ’nanta-līlāya devāya tubhyam

(8) O Lord Dāmodar, I first of all offer my obeisances to the brilliantly effulgent rope which binds Your belly. I then offer my obeisances to Your belly, which is the abode of the entire universe. I humbly bow down to Your most beloved Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī, and I offer all obeisances to You, the Supreme Lord, who displays unlimited Pastimes.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Dāmodarāṣṭakam
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee offers obeisances to Lord Dāmodara and his beloved Rādhārāṇī, praising their divine pastimes.

text:
--------------------
Śrī Hari-vāsara-gīti
śrī hari-vāsare hari-kīrtana-vidhāna
nṛtya ārambhilā prabhu jagatera prāṇa

(1) Once, on the auspicious day on Ekādaśī, in the house of Śrīvās Paṇḍit, Śrīman Mahāprabhu inaugurated congregational nāma saṅkīrtan with great enthusiasm, accompanied by his devotees and associates.

metadata.title: Śrī Hari-vāsara-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrīman Mahāprabhu inaugurated congregational nāma saṅkīrtan on Ekādaśī in the house of Śrīvās Paṇḍit.

text:
puṇyavanta śrīvāsa-aṅgane śubhārambha
uṭhilo kīrtana-dhvani gopāla govinda

(2) Surging in divine ecstasy, Śrīman Mahāprabhu, the life and soul of the universe, began to dance beautifully. The devotees surrounded Him being deeply touched and inspired by such an ecstatic moment and they also began to dance and sing the Holy Names like Gopāl, Govinda.

metadata.title: Śrī Hari-vāsara-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrīman Mahāprabhu began to dance in divine ecstasy, inspiring His devotees to join in and sing the Holy Names.

text:
mṛdaṅga mandirā bāje śaṅkha karatāla
saṅkīrtana soṅge sob hoilo miśāla

(3) The combined sound vibrations of mṛdaṅga, temple bells, karatāla and śaṅkha in harmony with the congregational singing and dancing took everyone to the plane of transcendental delight.

metadata.title: Śrī Hari-vāsara-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The combined sound vibrations of mṛdaṅga, temple bells, karatāla and śaṅkha in harmony with the congregational singing and dancing took everyone to the plane of transcendental delight.

text:
brahmāṇḍe uṭhilo dhvani pūriyā ākāśa
chaudikera amaṅgala jāya sob nāśa

(4) The holy vibration of saṅkīrtan filled the sky and spread through the ether all over the cosmic universal existence. Thus the atmosphere in all directions became purified and filled with auspiciousness by that divine sound.

metadata.title: Śrī Hari-vāsara-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The holy vibration of saṅkīrtan filled the sky and spread through the ether all over the cosmic universal existence.

text:
chaturdike śrī hari-maṅgala saṅkīrtana
modhye nāche jagannātha miśrera nandana

(5) In all four directions the auspicious chanting of the Lord’s name spread and in the centre of that sound vibration the son of Jagannāth Miśra, Śrīman Mahāprabhu danced.

metadata.title: Śrī Hari-vāsara-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrīman Mahāprabhu danced in the centre of the sound vibration of the Lord’s name.

text:
sabāra aṅgete śobhe śrī chandana mālā
ānande nāchoye sobe hoiye vibholā

ni jānande nāche mahāprabhu viśvambhara
charaṇera tāli śuni ati manohara

bhāvāveśe mālā nāhi rohoye galāya
chiṇḍiyā poḍoye giyā bhakatera gāya

(6) Everyone was decorated with fragrant sandalwood paste and beautiful garlands. The most wonderful rhythmic sound arose from the dancing footsteps of Śrīman Mahāprabhu which captivated the minds of the devotees. As He continued dancing in His own self-born ecstasy, the swinging flower garlands around His neck began to fall, decorating the earth. The devotees beheld before their eyes, this rare and precious heart captivating, ecstatic dance of the supreme tattva, Śrī Gaurāṅga who is the most worshipable object of even the great personalities such as Lord Shiva, Śuka, Nārada and others.

metadata.title: Śrī Hari-vāsara-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrīman Mahāprabhu dances with devotees, captivating their minds with His rhythmic footsteps and swinging flower garlands.

text:
jā̐ra nāmānande śiva vasana nā jāne
jā̐ra rase nāche śiva se nāche āpane

(7) Being totally overwhelmed and lost in the transcendental bliss of taking Mahāprabhu’s Holy Name, Lord Shiva sometimes does not care for his formal appearance or obligation to retain his clothing, which sometimes falls down while he dances in the ecstasy of loving devotion.

metadata.title: Śrī Hari-vāsara-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Lord Shiva is so overwhelmed by the bliss of taking Mahāprabhu’s Holy Name that he forgets his formal appearance and dances in ecstasy.

text:
jā̐ra nāme vālmīki hoilo tapodhana
jā̐ra nāme ajāmila pāilo mochana

(8) By chanting and meditating upon His Holy Name Śrī Valmīki became a great powerful rishi and Ajāmila attained pure liberation.

metadata.title: Śrī Hari-vāsara-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Chanting and meditating upon the Holy Name can lead to spiritual growth and liberation.

text:
jā̐ra nāme śravane saṁsāra-bandha ghuche
heno prabhu avatari kali-juge nāche

(9) As one hears and takes His Holy Name with devotion, embracing its holy potency within the core of their heart, their existence becomes totally purified and they attain deliverance. Such is the Lord, the source of all incarnations, in His dancing form in this age of Kali.

metadata.title: Śrī Hari-vāsara-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The holy name of the Lord has the power to purify one's existence and bring deliverance.

text:
jā̐ra nāma loi śuka nārada beḍāya
sahasra-vadana-prabhu jāra guṇa gāya

(10) The pure devotees Śrī Śukadeva and Devarṣi Nārada are always blissfully engaged in relishing the nectar of His Holy Name and distributing it to suitable jīva souls, wherever they travel. Even Anantadeva describes His unlimited glories with thousands of mouths.

metadata.title: Śrī Hari-vāsara-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Pure devotees Śrī Śukadeva and Devarṣi Nārada engage in relishing and distributing the nectar of Kṛṣṇa's Holy Name.

text:
sarva-mahā-prāyaśchitta je prabhura nāma
se prabhu nāchaye dekhe jata bhāgyavān

(11) Of all penances, the chanting of the Lord’s name is supreme and whoever sees the dancing of the Lord in his form as Śrī Chaitanya is a supremely fortunate soul.

metadata.title: Śrī Hari-vāsara-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Chanting the Lord's name is the supreme penance, and seeing the Lord's dancing form is a sign of great fortune.

text:
śrī kṛṣṇa-chaitanya nityānanda-chā̐da jāna
vṛndāvana dāsa tuchu pada-juge gāna

(12) The two brothers, Śrī Krishna Chaitanya Mahāprabhu and Nityānanda Prabhu are my beloved masters and my life and soul. Thus Vṛndāvan dās sings this song of Their glorification and devotionally offers it at Their lotus feet.

metadata.title: Śrī Hari-vāsara-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Vṛndāvan dās sings a song in glorification of Śrī Krishna Chaitanya Mahāprabhu and Nityānanda Prabhu.

text:
----------------------------
Śrīman Mahāprabhur śata-nāma
nadīyā-nagare nitāi neche neche gāy re

(1) (Refrain:) In the towns and villages of Nadia, Lord Nityānanda ecstatically dances and sings these Names of Śrī Chaitanya Mahāprabhu.

metadata.title: Śrīman Mahāprabhur śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A song describing Lord Nityānanda's ecstatic dancing and singing in the towns and villages of Nadia.

text:
jagannātha-suta mahāprabhu viśvambhara
māyāpura-śaśi navadvīpa-sudhākara

(2) Lord Chaitanya is the beloved son of Jagannāth Miśra; He is Mahāprabhu, the great master, protector, and maintainer of the whole world. He is the shining moon of Māyāpur, dissipating the dark ignorance of the world, and the source of all nectar for the Land of Nabadwīp.

metadata.title: Śrīman Mahāprabhur śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Lord Chaitanya is described as the great master and protector of the world.

text:
śachī-suta gaurahari nimāi-sundara
rādhā-bhāva-kānti-āchādito naṭavara

(3) He is the beloved son of Śachī Mātā and is Lord Hari with a golden complexion. As He was born under a neem tree He was called Nimāi-sundar (beautiful Nimāi). He is covered by the sentiment and lustre of Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī, and He is the best of all dancers.

metadata.title: Śrīman Mahāprabhur śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Gaurahari is the beloved son of Śachī Mātā and is known for his dancing skills.

text:
nāmānanda chapala bālaka mātṛ-bhakta
brahmāṇḍa-badana tarkī kautukānurakta

(4) Lord Chaitanya becomes ecstatic upon hearing the Holy Name of Hari. As a boy He was swift and agile, devoted to His mother, a great logician, and fond of joking. Millions of worlds are contained in His mouth.

metadata.title: Śrīman Mahāprabhur śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Lord Chaitanya becomes ecstatic upon hearing the Holy Name of Hari.

text:
vidyārthi-uḍupa chaura-dvayera mohana
tairthika-sarvasva grāmya-bālikā-krīḍana

(5) He bewildered two thieves who tried to steal His jewels when He was a small child, and He teased and joked with the village girls of Nadia. He is the moon among scholars and pre-eminent among all philosophers.

metadata.title: Śrīman Mahāprabhur śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Kṛṣṇa, as a child, thwarted the attempts of two thieves and playfully interacted with village girls in Nadia.

text:
lakṣmī-prati boro-dātā udhata bālaka
śrī-śachīra pati-putra-śoka-nibāraka

(6) Lord Chaitanya is the giver of blessings to Lakṣmī Prīya (His first wife). He was a mischievous child and is the Lord, son and preventer of all kinds of grief of Śachī Mātā.

metadata.title: Śrīman Mahāprabhur śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Lord Chaitanya is described as a mischievous child and a bringer of blessings to his wife Lakṣmī Prīya.

text:
lakṣmī-pati pūrva-deśa-sarva-kleśa-hara
digvijayi-darpa-hārī viṣṇu-priyeśvara

(7) He is the Lord and husband of Lakṣmī Priyā. By His saṅkīrtan movement, He removed the distresses of East Bengal. He removed the pride of the conquering paṇḍit Keśava Kasmiri. He is the Lord of Viṣṇu Priyā (His second wife).

metadata.title: Śrīman Mahāprabhur śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The text describes the pastimes of Caitanya Mahāprabhu, specifically his removal of distresses in East Bengal and his interactions with a conquering paṇḍit.

text:
ārya-dharma-pāla pitṛ-gayā piṇḍa-dātā
purī-śiṣya madhvāchārya-sampradāya-pātā

(8) He was the protector and preserver of sanātana-dharma and the giver of piṇḍa at Gayā after the disappearance of His father, Jagannāth Miśra. He became the disciple of Īśvara Purī and is the protector of the Madhva Āchārya Sampradāya.

metadata.title: Śrīman Mahāprabhur śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Chaitanya Mahaprabhu became the disciple of Īśvara Purī and protected the Madhva Āchārya Sampradāya.

text:
kṛṣṇa-nāmonmatta kṛṣṇa-tattva-adhyāpaka
nāma-saṅkīrtana-juga-dharma-pravartaka

(9) Lord Chaitanya became intoxicated by and mad for the Holy Name of Krishna, and began to profess the science of Krishna. Thus He inaugurated the religion of the age, Harinām Saṅkīrtan.

metadata.title: Śrīman Mahāprabhur śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Lord Chaitanya became intoxicated by and mad for the Holy Name of Krishna and began to profess the science of Krishna.

text:
advaita-bāndhava śrīnivāsa-gṛha-dhon
nityānanda-prāṇa gadādharera jīvan

(10) He was the friend of Advaita Āchārya, the treasure of Śrīvās Ṭhākur’s home, the life and soul of Nityānanda Prabhu, and the very source of life to Gadādhara Paṇḍit.

metadata.title: Śrīman Mahāprabhur śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A description of the close relationships between Advaita Āchārya, Nityānanda Prabhu, and Gadādhara Paṇḍit.

text:
antadvīpa-śaśadhara sīmanta-bijoy
godruma-bihārī madhyadvīpa-līlāśroy

(11) Śrī Gaurāṅga Mahāprabhu is the moon of Antardwīp and the triumph of Sīmantadwīp. He is wandering on the island of Godruma and is the shelter of Pastimes in Madhyadwīp.

metadata.title: Śrīman Mahāprabhur śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Gaurāṅga Mahāprabhu is described as the moon of Antardwīp and the triumph of Sīmantadwīp, and is associated with the island of Godruma and Madhyadwīp.

text:
koladvīpa-pati ṛtudvīpa-maheśvara
jahnu-modadruma-rudradvīpera īsvara

(12) Śrī Chaitanya is the Lord of Koladwīp, Ṛtudwīp, Jahnudwīp, Modadrumadwīp, and Rudradwīp.

metadata.title: Śrīman Mahāprabhur śata-nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Chaitanya is described as the Lord of various dvīpas in the Chaitanya Charitamrita.

text:

Śrī Guru-paramparā
kṛṣṇa hoite chatur-mukha,    hon kṛṣṇa-sevonmukha,
brahmā hoite nāradera mati
nārada hoite vyāsa,    madhva kohe vyāsa-dāsa,
pūrṇaprajña padmanābha gati

(1) In the beginning of creation the science of devotional service was received by the four-headed Brahmā from the Supreme Lord Śrī Krishna. Devarṣi Nārada’s understanding of this divine science was obtained from Brahmā. The great sage Krishna Dvaipāyana Vyāsa, who was empowered to compile the Vedic literatures, became a disciple of Devarṣi Nārada. Śrīpād Madhva Āchārya, the founder of the Śuddha-dvaita school of Vedānta philosophy, who visited Vyāsadeva at Badarīkāśram in the thirteenth century to learn from him Vedānta philosophy, calls himself a servant of Krishna Dvaipāyana Vyāsa. Pūrṇaprajña Tīrtha [Madhva] is the guru and sole refuge of Padmanābha Tīrtha.

metadata.title: Śrī Guru-paramparā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The Śrī Guru-paramparā describes the lineage of spiritual masters from Śrī Krishna to Padmanābha Tīrtha.

text:
nṛhari mādhava-baṁśe,    akṣobhya paramahaṁse,
śiṣya boli aṅgīkāra kore
akśobhyera śiṣya jaya-    tīrtha nāme parichaya,
tā̐ra dāsye jñānasindhu tore

(2) The two other principal disciples of Madhva are Nṛhari Tīrtha and Mādhava Tīrtha. Mādhava Tīrtha accepted the great paramahaṁsa Akṣobhya Tīrtha as a disciple. The principal disciple of Akṣobhya Tīrtha was known as Jayatīrtha. Jayatīrtha’s service was for his disciple Jñānasindhu.

metadata.title: Śrī Guru-paramparā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Mādhava Tīrtha accepted Akṣobhya Tīrtha as a disciple, and Jayatīrtha was Akṣobhya's principal disciple.

text:

rājendra hoilo tā̐hā hoite
tā̐hāra kiṅkora jaya-    dharma nāme parichoya,
paramparā jāno bhālo mate

(3) Dayānidhi received the science of devotional service from Jñānasindhu, and the servant of Dayānidhi was Vidyānidhi [Vidyādhirāja Tīrtha]. Rājendra Tīrtha became a disciple of Vidyādhirāja Tīrtha. Rājendra Tīrtha’s servant was known as Jayadharma or Vijayadhvaja Tīrtha. In this way you should properly understand this disciplic succession.

metadata.title: Śrī Guru-paramparā
metadata.author: Unknown

tā̐ha hoite mādhavendra purī

(4) The great sannyāsī Śrī Puruṣottama Tīrtha received his knowledge in the service of his guru, Vijayadhvaja Tīrtha [Jayadharma]. The principal disciple of Puruṣottama Tīrtha was Subrahmaṇya Tīrtha. His servant was the great Vyāsatīrtha [Vyāsa Rāya]. Vyāsatīrtha’s servant was Lakṣmīpati Tīrtha, whose disciple was Mādhavendra Purī Goswāmī.

metadata.title: Śrī Guru-paramparā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The disciples and servants of Śrī Puruṣottama Tīrtha, including Subrahmaṇya Tīrtha, Vyāsatīrtha, and Lakṣmīpati Tīrtha, are mentioned in this text.

jagad-guru gaura mahāprabhu

(5) The chief disciple of Mādhavendra Purī was Īśvara Purī, and two of his other disciples were the renowned incarnations of Godhead Śrī Nityānanda and Śrī Advaita Āchārya. Śrī Chaitanya Mahāprabhu, the spiritual preceptor of all the worlds, made Īśvara Purī greatly fortunate by accepting him as His spiritual master.

srī gosvāmī rūpa-sanātana

(6) Mahāprabhu Śrī Chaitanya is nondifferent from Śrī Śrī Rādhā and Krishna and is the very life of those Vaiṣṇavas who follow Śrī Rūpa Goswāmī. Śrī Swarūp Dāmodar Goswāmī, Rūpa Goswāmī and Sanātan Goswāmī were the givers of great happiness to Viśvambhara [Śrī Chaitanya].

metadata.title: Śrī Guru-paramparā

metadata.summary: Mahāprabhu Śrī Chaitanya is nondifferent from Śrī Śrī Rādhā and Krishna and is the very life of those Vaiṣṇavas who follow Śrī Rūpa Goswāmī.

rūpapriya mahājana,    jīva-raghunātha hon,
tā̐ra priya kavi kṛṣṇadāsa
kṛṣṇadāsa-priyavara,    narottama sevāpara,
jā̐ra pada viśvanātha-āśa

(7) The great souls Jīva Goswāmī and Raghunāth Dās Goswāmī became very dear to Rūpa Goswāmī. Jīva Goswāmī was a disciple of Rūpa Goswāmī. Raghunāth Dās Goswāmī, a disciple of Advaita Āchārya’s disciple Jadunandan Āchārya, was accepted by Rūpa and Sanātan as their third brother. Raghunāth Dās Goswāmī’s beloved student was Krishnadās Kavirāj Goswāmī. Kṛṣṇādās Kavirāj was an intimate friend of Lokanāth Goswāmī. They lived together in Vṛndāvan and always discussed the topics of Krishna with one another. Lokanāth Goswāmī, a disciple of Gadādhara Paṇḍit, had only one disciple, whose name was Narottam Dās. Narottam Dās was always engaged in the service of his guru, and he also engaged himself in the service of his guru’s intimate friends. Thus he became very dear to Krishnadās Kavirāj Goswāmī. To serve the feet of Narottam Dās Ṭhākur was the only desire of Viśvanāth Chakravartī Ṭhākur, who was the fourth āchārya in disciplic succession from Narottam Dās.

metadata.title: Śrī Guru-paramparā
metadata.author: Unknown

text:

hari-bhajanete jā̐ra moda

(8) Viśvanātha Chakravartī Ṭhākura was the śikṣā-guru [instructing spiritual master] of Baladeva Vidyābhūṣaṇa, to whom he taught the precepts of Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam. Jagannāth Dās Bābājī was a very prominent Āchārya after Śrī Baladeva Vidyābhūṣaṇa and was the beloved śikṣā-guru of Śrī Bhakti Vinod Ṭhākur. Bhakti Vinod Ṭhākur’s intimate friend and associate was the eminent mahābhāgavat Śrī Gaura Kiśor Dās Bābājī, whose sole joy was found in hari-bhajana.

metadata.author: Unknown

susiddhānta mūrti-dhara    śrī śrīdhara guruvara

(1) Thus in the year 1407 of the Śaka Era (A.D. 1486), in the month of Phālguna [March-April], on the evening of the full moon, the desired auspicious moment appeared.

metadata.title: Śrī Gaura Purṇīmā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The text questions the need for a moon with black marks when Śrī Chaitanya Mahāprabhu, the spotless moon, is visible.

metadata.title: Śrī Gaura Purṇīmā

metadata.summary: All directions and rivers became jubilant, and all beings were overwhelmed with transcendental bliss in Kṛṣṇa's presence.

metadata.title: Śrī Gaura Purṇīmā

metadata.summary: The full moon, Gaurahari, rose in Nadia, bringing joy and the chanting of the Holy Name to the three worlds.
