bindu-chandra-ratna-soma-śāka-lochanāntaram
śrīdharaṁ namāmi bhakti-rakṣakaṁ jagad-gurum

(1) I offer my humble obeisances unto the Guru of the entire world, Oṁ Viṣṇupād Śrī Śrīla Bhakti Rakṣak Śrīdhar Dev-Goswāmī Mahārāj, who carries the conception of Śrī Swarūp Damodār, Śrī Rāmānanda Rāya, Śrī Rūpa Goswāmī and Śrī Jīva Goswāmī; who delivers everyone irrespective of caste or creed; who is the most beloved of Śrīla Bhakti Siddhānta Saraswatī Goswāmī Prabhupād; and who is the abode of Transcendental Loving Service [the only shelter of Śrī Bhakti Sundar Govinda].
I offer my humble obeisances unto the Guru of the entire world, Oṁ Viṣṇupād Śrī Śrīla Bhakti Rakṣak Śrīdhar Dev-Goswāmī Mahārāj, who revealed the Pastimes of his Holy Advent in the world in the year 1817 Saka era [1895 A.D.]; who constantly practices the wealth of Pure Loving Devotion in Divine Consorthood; and who disappeared from our eyes in the year 1910 Saka era [1988 A.D.].

metadata.title: Praṇām Mantra to Śrīla Guru Mahārāj
metadata.author: Srila B.S. Govinda Maharaj
entities: Śrīla Bhakti Rakṣak Śrīdhar Dev-Goswāmī Mahārāj
Śrīla Bhakti Siddhānta Saraswatī Goswāmī Prabhupād
metadata.summary: A prayer to Śrīla Bhakti Rakṣak Śrīdhar Dev-Goswāmī Mahārāj, a Gaudiya Vaishnava guru.

text:
kanaka suruchi rāngaṁ sundaraṁ saumya-mūrtiṁ
vibudha-kula-vareṇyaṁ śrī-guruṁ siddhi-pūrtim
taruṇa-tapana-vāsaṁ bhaktidañ chid-vilāsaṁ
bhaja bhaja tu mano re śrīdharaṁ śambidhānam

(2) Oh my dear mind! Please engage yourself eternally in the worship of Śrīla Bhakti Rakṣak Śrīdhar Dev-Goswāmī Mahārāj, who has manifested his form as Śrī Gurudeva; who is the giver of all perfection; whose charming golden form is beautifully reposed with sweetness and tranquility, dressed in radiant saffron robes, he is rich with perfect devotional conceptions, highly learned and pre-eminent among the followers of Śrīla Saraswatī Ṭhākur.

metadata.title: Praṇām Mantra to Śrīla Guru Mahārāj
metadata.author: Srila B.S. Govinda Maharaj
entities: Śrīla Bhakti Rakṣak Śrīdhar Dev-Goswāmī Mahārāj
metadata.summary: A devotional song requesting the worship of Śrīla Bhakti Rakṣak Śrīdhar Dev-Goswāmī Mahārāj.

text:
-----------------
Praṇati-Pañchakam
nava-nalina-gañjitaṁ    kusuma-dala-maṇḍitaṁ
pāda-yugam-abhaya-varadānam
kanaka-ghana-ninditaṁ vapura-mara-vanditaṁ
naṭana-gati-gaurava-nidānam
bhaje śrīdhara-svāminam-aniśam
śarada-vidhu-nindi-mukha- padma-mati-śobhanaṁ
gopī-tilaka-charchita-subhālam
gamana-jita-vāraṇaṁ    śamana-bhaya-tāraṇaṁ
prakṛti-ruchi-nindi-kṛta-veśam
prakṛti-ruchi-nambhrama-suveśam
phulla-kara-pallavaṁ    bhakta-jana-vallabhaṁ
tuṅga-pṛthulaṁ hṛdaya-deśam
gaura-puraṭa-saurabhaṁ kṛṣṇa-puraṭa-gauravaṁ
vibudha-kula-padma-naliśam
bhakta-kula-daṇḍanaṁ bhaṇḍa-mata-khaṇḍanaṁ
bhakta-kula-nandana-yatīśam
tribhuvana-nivāsine    kṛṣṇam-upadeśinaṁ
asura-kula-dāmbhika-kṛtāntam
naumi budha-nāyakaṁ parama-gati-dāyakaṁ
mama śaraṇa-maraṇa-gaṇa-chintyam

(2) His two feet resemble fresh petals of a lotus flower and distribute fearless blessings; his divine glowing form puts to shame the glow of gold, and is glorified for its beautiful dancing by all the demigods; his lotus face is so charming it puts to shame the charm of the autumnal moon; his broad forehead is decorated with gopī-chandan tilak; I adore that Śrīdhara-deva Swāmī always.

metadata.title: Praṇati-Pañchakam
metadata.author: Srila B.S. Govinda Maharaj
metadata.summary: A devotional song praising Śrīdhara-deva Swāmī and his divine form.

text: (3) He can put to an end our wandering in this material world; he can protect us from fear and death; his beautiful form dressed in saffron robes puts to shame the attraction and taste for mundane beauty; his hands like fresh blossoms distribute bliss; he is mutually beloved of the devotees; his heart is broad and strong; he preaches the glories of Śrī Govardhan; he spreads the sweet aroma of the abode of Śrī Krishna; he punishes the deceivers and refutes their faulty conceptions thereby giving pleasure to the devotees and revealing himself as a pre-eminent sannyāsi preacher. I always adore that Śrīdhara-deva Swāmī.

metadata.title: Praṇati-Pañchakam
metadata.author: Srila B.S. Govinda Maharaj
metadata.summary: Śrīdhara-deva Swāmī is a revered sannyāsi preacher who preaches the glories of Śrī Govardhan and spreads the love of Śrī Krishna.

text: (4) He is a death-sentence to arrogant, haughty demons; he is the saviour of everyone in all the three worlds for he distributes the teachings of Śrī Krishna; he is pre-eminent amongst the learned, the most supreme merciful shelter, I adore that Śrīdhara-deva until my death.

metadata.title: Praṇati-Pañchakam
metadata.author: Srila B.S. Govinda Maharaj
metadata.summary: The speaker praises Śrīdhara-deva as a merciful shelter and a distributor of Śrī Krishna's teachings.

text:
--------------------------
Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa Māhātmya
atha govardhane ramye surabhi gauḥ samudrajā
snāpayā māsa gopeśaṁ dugdha dhārābhi rātnanaḥ
surabhe dugdha dhārābhi govinda snānato nṛpa
jāto govinda kuṇḍohadrau mahāpāpaharaḥ paraḥ
kadā chittasmin dugdhasya svādutvaṁ prati padyate
tatra snātvā naraḥ sākṣād govinda padamāpnuyāt
govinda kuṇḍe viśade yaḥ snāti kṛṣṇa-mānasaḥ
prāpnoti kṛṣṇa-sārūpyaṁ maithilendra na saṁśayaḥ
samudra-sambhavā gābhī surabhī āpana
dugdhe abhiṣeka koilo vrajendra-nandana

(3) Surabhī, the divine cow who appeared from churning the milk ocean, lovingly bathed Vrajendra Nandan Krishna with her own milk.

metadata.title: Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa Māhātmya
metadata.author: Srila B.S. Govinda Maharaj
metadata.summary: Surabhī, a divine cow, bathes Krishna with her own milk.

text:
sei dugdhe pūrṇa kuṇḍa ‘śrī govinda’ nāma
ramya giri govardhane śobhe abhirāma

(4) The pond filled with that milk, “Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa,” graces beautiful Govardhan with exquisite beauty.

metadata.title: Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa Māhātmya
metadata.author: Srila B.S. Govinda Maharaj
metadata.summary: The pond Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa is located in Govardhan and is known for its beauty.

text:
kuṇḍavāri mahāpāpahārī se chinmoya
snāne pāne bhavabhaya tritāpa nāśaya

(5) The transcendental water of this Kuṇḍa can banish even the greatest sins. The threefold miseries—ādhyātmic, ādhidaivic and ādhibhautic—and all fears of this material world are destroyed by bathing in or drinking this water.

metadata.title: Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa Māhātmya
metadata.author: Srila B.S. Govinda Maharaj
metadata.summary: The transcendental water of Kuṇḍa can banish even the greatest sins and destroy all fears of this material world.

text:
bahu-bhāgye keho sei dugdhāsvāda pāya
chidānanda-deho labhi kṛṣṇa-loke jāya

(6) Sometimes, by great fortune, someone will get to taste the water of Govinda Kuṇḍa as that milk, attain a transcendental form, and go to Krishna-loka.

metadata.title: Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa Māhātmya
metadata.author: Srila B.S. Govinda Maharaj
metadata.summary: Sometimes, by great fortune, someone will get to taste the water of Govinda Kuṇḍa and attain a transcendental form, going to Krishna-loka.

text:
śrī kṛṣṇa-mānase jebā kore hethā snāna
gupta-govardhane rādhā-kṛṣṇa-sevā pāna

(7) Anyone who bathes in Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa, desiring to serve Krishna, attains divine service of Śrī Śrī Rādhā-Krishna in Gupta Govardhan (hidden Govardhan).

metadata.title: Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa Māhātmya
metadata.author: Srila B.S. Govinda Maharaj
metadata.scripture_source: Nectar of Devotion (Śrī Nectar of Devotion)
metadata.summary: Bathing in Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa allows one to attain divine service of Śrī Śrī Rādhā-Krishna in Gupta Govardhan.

text:
----------------------------------
Gaṅgadhara Sadāśiva Praṇām-Mantram
devādidevam-ahibhūṣaṇam-indukāśaṁ
panchānanaṁ paśupatiṁ varadaṁ prasannam
gaṅgādharaṁ praṇatapālakamāśutoṣaṁ
vande sadāśiva-haripriya-chandramaulim

(1) The chief of the Demigods, whose body is decorated by snakes, whose body shines like the moon, who has five heads, who carries his weapon known as Paśupat, who gives boons, who is of satisfied nature, who holds the Gaṅgā on his head, who maintains those who give obeisance to him, who is easily pleased — I offer my obeisances to Sadā-śiva who is dear to Hari, and whose crown is the moon.

metadata.title: Gaṅgadhara Sadāśiva Praṇām-Mantram
metadata.author: Srila B.S. Govinda Maharaj
metadata.summary: A prayer to Sadāśiva, a form of Śiva, describing his attributes and offering obeisances.

text:
--------------
Māyā Duratyayā
mahā-bhaya śaṅkula    e bhava taraṅginī
janama-maraṇa mālā-dale
niśi-diśi gatāgati    kara ta̐hi jīva-kula
mohita mahāmāyā bale

(1) Filled with tremendous trepidation (mahā-bhaya), the jīva-souls are carried away by the waves of the ocean of material existence along the chain of birth and death, perpetually coming and going in all directions throughout the darkness of the confines of the illusory environment, captivated by the power of Mahāmāyā.

metadata.title: Māyā Duratyayā
metadata.author: Srila B.S. Govinda Maharaj
metadata.summary: The jīva-souls are trapped in the cycle of birth and death, carried away by the material existence.

text:
karabi ki mana abhāgiyā—
bhuvana-mohana-māyā    kemane re utarabi
labhibi kemane kānāiyā?

(2) O Mind! What can you do about my great misfortune? Mahāmāyā bewilders the whole universe, how will you ever overcome her? How will you attain Kānāi-lāl — the youthful Krishna of Goloka Vṛndāvan?

metadata.title: Māyā Duratyayā
metadata.author: Srila B.S. Govinda Maharaj
metadata.summary: The speaker laments their inability to overcome the illusory power of Mahāmāyā and attain Kānāi-lāl, the youthful Krishna of Goloka Vṛndāvan.

text:
nija-rūpevitāri’    tri-guṇa-jāle phā̐da rachi’
ta̐hi māhe gaṇikā pratiṣṭhā—
kanaka varāṅganā    dāniyā āmiṣa sama
sa̐pitechhe kāla-kare dhṛṣṭā

(3) In your own form you are trying to cross over the net of the three modes of material nature but in doing so they have bound you in a noose. You have treated Māyā like a prostitute. She has been feeding you kanak, kāminī, and pratiṣṭha just like meat and you have become immersed in the darkness of arrogance.

metadata.title: Māyā Duratyayā
metadata.author: Srila B.S. Govinda Maharaj
metadata.summary: The devotee is trying to cross over the material world but is being bound by the three modes of nature due to his arrogance.

text:
mana majhu vāta avadhāna
soi dayālu prabhu    charaṇa saroje mana
dhana-tanu, sabahu̐ dāna

(4) O my mind, your attention is like the wind. Your real wealth will be found at the lotus feet of the all-merciful Lord, so give yourself completely there.

metadata.title: Māyā Duratyayā
metadata.author: Srila B.S. Govinda Maharaj
metadata.summary: The text advises giving oneself completely to the all-merciful Lord.

text:
yā̐kara māyā    tachhu pade paraṇami
leha śaraṇa hoi dīna
svapaneha nā bhāviha    tā̐ka charaṇa vinu
dharama yukati samīchīna

(5) Offer yourself to the lotus feet of the Lord who is the owner and controller of Māyā, taking shelter there in all humility. Do not even dream that without His lotus feet you can properly adjust with the environment or practice spiritual life (dhārma).

metadata.title: Māyā Duratyayā
metadata.author: Srila B.S. Govinda Maharaj
metadata.summary: The devotee offers themselves to the Lord's lotus feet, seeking shelter and humility.

text:
-------------------------
Śrī Tulasī-parikramā-gīti
namo namaḥ tulasī mahārāṇī,
vṛnde mahārāṇī namo namaḥ

(1) O Tulasī Mahārāṇī, O Vṛnda Devī, I offer my obeisances unto you again and again.

metadata.title: Śrī Tulasī-parikramā-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song offering obeisances to Tulasī Mahārāṇī and Vṛnda Devī.

text:
namo re namo re māiyā namo nārāyaṇi

(2) O Nārāyaṇi I offer you my obeisances again and again.

metadata.title: Śrī Tulasī-parikramā-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee offers obeisances to Nārāyaṇi.

text:
jāko daraśe, paraśe agha-nāśa-hoi
mahimā veda-purāṇe bākhāni

(3) By seeing or touching you all sins are destroyed. Your glories are sung in the Vedas and Purāṇas.

metadata.title: Śrī Tulasī-parikramā-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The glories of Kṛṣṇa are sung in the Vedas and Purāṇas.

text:
jāko patra, mañjarī komala
śrī-pati-charaṇa-kamale lapaṭāni
dhanya tulasi, pūraṇa tapa kiye,
śrī-śālagrāma-mahā-pāṭarāṇī

(4) Your leaves and soft mañjarīs are entwined at the lotus feet of Lord Nārāyaṇa. O Tulasī by your performance of austerity you have become the worshipful consort of Śrī Śālagrām Śila.

metadata.title: Śrī Tulasī-parikramā-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song praising Tulasī and her connection to Lord Nārāyaṇa and Śrī Śālagrām Śila.

text:
dhūpa, dīpa, naivedya, āroti,
phulanā kiye varakhā varakhāni
chāppānna bhoga, chatriśa vyañjana,
vinā tulasī prabhu eka nāhi māni

(5) You shower your mercy upon anyone who offers you incense, lamp, foodstuffs, worship and flowers. The Lord does not accept even one of fifty-six food offerings or thirty-six curries offered without Tulasī leaves.

metadata.title: Śrī Tulasī-parikramā-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The Lord does not accept offerings without Tulasī leaves.

text:
śiva-śuka-nārada, āur brahmādiko,
ḍhuḍata phirata mahā-muni jñānī
chandraśekhara māiyā, terā jaśa gāoye
bhakati-dāna dījiye mahārāṇi

(6) Lord Shiva, Śukadeva Goswāmī, Nārada Muni, all the demigods headed by Lord Brahmā, the mystics and great munis are all circumambulating you. O Tulasī Mahārāṇī, thus Chandraśekhara sings of your glories. Please bestow upon him the gift of devotion.

metadata.title: Śrī Tulasī-parikramā-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Chandraśekhara sings of Tulasī Mahārāṇī's glories and requests her to bestow upon him the gift of devotion.

text:
---------------------------------
Śrī Śrī Prabhupāda-padma
sujanārvuda-rādhita-pāda-yugaṁ
yuga-dharma-dhurandhara-pātra-varam
varadābhaya-dāyaka-pūjya-padaṁ
praṇamāmi sadā prabhupāda-padam

(1) His lotus feet are served in devotion by multitudes of high, virtuous souls; he is the establisher of the religion of the age as he is the presiding monarch of the Viśva-Vaiṣṇava-Rāja-Sabhā—the universal society of the pure devotees that are the true ‘kings’ or guides of all; and he is the fulfiller of the most cherished desires of those who dispel fear (for all souls). I make my obeisance unto the lotus feet of that illustrious great soul, worshipable by one and all — perpetually do I make my obeisance unto the radiance emanating from the toenails of the holy feet of my Lord.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Prabhupāda-padma Stavakaḥ
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee expresses their reverence and devotion to Śrī Śrī Prabhupāda.

text:
bhajanorjita sajjana-saṅgha-patiṁ
patitādhika-kāruṇikaika-gatim
gati-vañchita-vañchakāchintya-padaṁ
praṇamāmi sadā prabhupāda-padam

(2) He is the leader of the fortunate souls blessed with the treasure of internal pure devotion; he is greatly merciful upon the fallen souls, being their only shelter; and his inconceivable holy feet are the shelter for the deceivers, by deceiving them. I make my obeisance unto his lotus feet—perpetually do I make my obeisances unto the radiance emanating from the toenails of the holy feet of my Lord.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Prabhupāda-padma Stavakaḥ
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee offers obeisance to the holy feet of their Lord, describing His merciful nature and role as a shelter for the fallen souls.

text:
atikomala-kāñchana-dīrgha-tanuṁ
tanu-nindita-hema-mṛṇāla-madam
madanārvuda-vandita-chandra-padaṁ
praṇamāmi sadā prabhupāda-padam

(3) I make my obeisance unto his divine, charming yet commanding lofty form of golden hue. That beautiful figure shames the mad ecstasy of golden lotus stems. Venerated by tens of millions of Cupids, the moons of the toenails of my Worshipful Divine Master reveal the beauty of his lotus feet. Perpetually do I make my obeisance unto that effulgence emanating from the toenails of the holy feet of my Lord.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Prabhupāda-padma Stavakaḥ
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee offers obeisance to the divine form of Kṛṣṇa, comparing it to the beauty of the golden lotus and the moon.

text:
nija-sevaka-tāraka-rañji-vidhuṁ
vidhutāhita-huṅkṛta-siṁha-varam
varaṇāgata-bāliśa-śanda-padaṁ
praṇamāmi sadā prabhupāda-padam

(4) Like the moon that delights the stars, he is surrounded by his circle of personal servitors, making their hearts bloom in divine ecstasy. The malicious non-devotees are made to flee in panic by the sound of his thunderous roar, and the simple, inoffensive souls attain the ultimate fortune by accepting his lotus feet. I make my obeisance unto him; perpetually do I make my obeisance unto the brilliance emanating from the toenails of the holy lotus feet of my Lord.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Prabhupāda-padma Stavakaḥ
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotees are protected by the Lord's personal servitors, while non-devotees flee in panic.

text:
vipulīkṛta-vaibhava-gaura-bhuvaṁ
bhuvaneṣu vikīrtita-gaura-dayam
dayanīya-gaṇārpita-gaura-padaṁ
praṇamāmi sadā prabhupāda-padam

(5) He has revealed the vast, magnificent beauty of Śrī Gaura Dhām; he has broadcast the tidings of the supreme magnanimity of Śrī Gaurāṅga throughout the whole universe; and in the hearts of the fit recipients of his grace, he has firmly established the lotus feet of Śrī Gaura. I make my obeisance unto him; perpetually do I make my obeisance unto the effulgence emanating from the toenails of the holy feet of my Lord.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Prabhupāda-padma Stavakaḥ
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee offers obeisance to Śrī Gaurāṅga, praising his magnanimity and beauty.

text:
chira-gaura-janāśraya-viśva-guruṁ
guru-gaura-kiśoraka-dāsya-param
paramādṛta-bhaktivinoda-padaṁ
praṇamāmi sadā prabhupāda-padam

(6) He is the eternal shelter and the Universal Guru for the souls surrendered unto Śrī Gaurāṅga. Absorbed in the service of his Gurudev, Śrī Gaura Kiśora, he wholeheartedly adores Śrī Bhakti Vinod Ṭhākur. I make my obeisance unto him; perpetually do I make my obeisance unto the effulgence emanating from the toenails of the holy feet of my Lord.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Prabhupāda-padma Stavakaḥ
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee expresses his devotion to Śrī Prabhupāda and his predecessors.

text:
raghu-rūpa-sanātana-kīrti-dharaṁ
dharaṇī-tala-kīrtita-jīva-kavim
kavirāja-narottama-sakhya-padaṁ
praṇamāmi sadā prabhupāda-padam

(7) He is the illustrious personality to raise the flag that sings the glory of Śrī Rūpa, Śrī Sanātan, and Śrī Raghunāth. His glory is sung throughout the world as non-different from the powerful personality of brilliant erudition, Śrī Jīva. And he has won the renown of being one with the hearts of Śrīla Krishna Dās Kavirāj and Ṭhākur Narottam. I make my obeisance unto him; perpetually do I bow down to the brilliance emanating from the toenails of the holy feet of my Divine Master.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Prabhupāda-padma Stavakaḥ
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee offers his obeisance to Śrīla Prabhupāda, acknowledging his illustrious position as the flag-bearer of the glories of Śrī Rūpa, Śrī Sanātan, and Śrī Raghunāth.

text:
kṛpayā hari-kīrtana mūrti-dharaṁ
dharaṇī-bhara-hāraka-gaura-janam
janakādhika-vatsala-snigdha-padaṁ
praṇamāmi sadā prabhupāda-padam

(8) Bestowing his grace upon all souls, he is Hari-kīrtan incarnate. As the associate of Śrī Gaura, he relieves Mother Earth of the burden of offences committed upon her. And he is so gracious that his endearance of all beings excels that of even a father. I make my obeisance unto him—the mine of all these qualities; perpetually do I bow down to the effulgence emanating from the toenails of the holy feet of my Divine Master.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Prabhupāda-padma Stavakaḥ
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee offers his obeisance to Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu, who is the embodiment of Hari-kīrtana and the reliever of the burden of offences committed upon the earth.

text:
śaraṇāgata-kiṅkara-kalpa-taruṁ
taru-dhik-kṛta dhīra vadānya
varam varadendra-gaṇārchita-divya-padaṁ
praṇamāmi sadā prabhupāda-padam

(9) Like a wish-fulfilling tree for his surrendered servitors (he fulfills their heart’s aspirations), even a tree is shamed by his magnanimity and forbearance. And great personalities who are competent to confer boons—they, too, worship his lotus feet. I make my obeisance unto him; perpetually do I bow down to the radiance emanating from the toenails of the holy feet of my Divine Master.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Prabhupāda-padma Stavakaḥ
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee praises Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu as a wish-fulfilling tree for his surrendered servitors.

text:
parahaṁsa-varaṁ paramārtha-patiṁ
patitodharaṇe kṛta-veśa-yatim
yati-rāja-gaṇaiḥ parisevya-padaṁ
praṇamāmi sadā prabhupāda-padam

(10) The crown-jewel of the paramahaṁsas, the Prince of the treasure of the supreme perfection of life, Śrī Krishna-prema, he accepted the robes of a mendicant sannyāsī just to deliver the fallen souls. The topmost tridaṇḍī sannyāsīs attend his lotus feet. I make my obeisance unto him; perpetually do I bow down to the effulgence emanating from the toenails of the holy feet of my Divine Master.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Prabhupāda-padma Stavakaḥ
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee offers obeisance to Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu, the crown-jewel of paramahaṁsas, who accepted sannyāsī robes to deliver fallen souls.

text:
vṛṣabhānu-sutā-dayitānucharaṁ
charaṇāśrita-reṇu-dharas tam aham
mahad-adbhuta-pāvana-śakti-padaṁ
praṇamāmi sadā prabhupāda-padam

(11) He is the dearmost intimate follower of the Divine Daughter of Śrī Vṛṣabhānu, and I know myself as the most fortunate by taking the dust of his holy feet upon my head. I make my obeisance unto his invincible, wondrously purifying lotus feet—perpetually do I bow to the brilliance emanating from the toenails of the holy feet of my Divine Master.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Prabhupāda-padma Stavakaḥ
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee expresses his devotion to Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu, considering himself fortunate to have taken the dust of his holy feet.

text:
-------------------------------
Śrī Guru-vaiṣṇava
śrī guru charaṇa-padma, kevala-bhakati-sadma,
bando mui sāvadhāna mate
jā̐hāra prasāde bhāi, e bhava toriyā jāi,
kṛṣṇa-prāpti hoya jā̐hā hoite

(1) The lotus feet of the Spiritual Master are the abode of pure devotional service. I bow down to those lotus feet with great care and attention. My dear brother (my dear mind)! It is through the grace of the Spiritual Master that we cross over this material world.

metadata.title: Śrī Guru-vaiṣṇava Māhātmya-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The song describes the importance of the Spiritual Master in achieving devotion to Kṛṣṇa.

text:
guru-mukha-padma-vākya, chittete koriyā aikya,
āro nā koriha mane āśā
śrī guru-charaṇe rati,    sei se uttama-gati,
je prasāde pūre sarva āśā

(2) Make the teachings from the lotus mouth of the Spiritual Master one with your heart, and do not desire anything else. Attachment to the lotus feet of the Spiritual Master is the best means of spiritual advancement. By his mercy all desires for spiritual perfection are fulfilled.

metadata.title: Śrī Guru-vaiṣṇava Māhātmya-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The Śikṣāṣṭaka advises to make the teachings of the Spiritual Master one with one's heart and attain spiritual perfection by his mercy.

text:
chakṣu-dāna dilā jei, janme janme prabhu sei,
divya-jñāna hṛde prokāśito
prema-bhakti jāhā hoite,    avidyā vināśa jāte,
vede gāya jā̐hāra charito

(3) He who has given me the gift of transcendental vision is my lord, birth after birth. By his mercy divine knowledge is revealed within the heart, bestowing loving devotion and destroying ignorance. The Vedic Scriptures sing of his character.

metadata.title: Śrī Guru-vaiṣṇava Māhātmya-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The text describes the gift of transcendental vision and the revelation of divine knowledge within the heart.

text:
śrī-guru karuṇā-sindhu, adhama janāra bandhu,
lokanātha lokera jīvana
hā hā prabhu kara dayā, deho more pada-chāyā,
ebe jaśa ghuṣuk tribhuvana
(e adhama loilo śaraṇa)

(4) O Spiritual Master, ocean of mercy, and friend of the fallen souls, you are the teacher of everyone and the life of all people. O master! Be merciful unto me, and give me the shade of your lotus feet. May your glories now be proclaimed throughout the three worlds.

metadata.title: Śrī Guru-vaiṣṇava Māhātmya-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee prays to their spiritual master for mercy and the shade of their lotus feet.

text:
(tuyā pade loinu śaraṇa)
(āmi) (śaraṇilam)
(abhaya śrī pada padme śaraṇilam)
(āmay) (dayā kara he)
(patit-pāvan śrī gurudev dayā kara he)
(adhama patita jene dayā kara he)
(jay gurudev)

(5) I have surrendered, I have surrendered unto your fearless lotus feet. Please give your mercy. Oh Śrī Gurudeva, saviour of the fallen, please give me your mercy. You are the saviour of the lowly fallen souls. All glories to you Śrī Gurudeva.

metadata.title: Śrī Guru-vaiṣṇava Māhātmya-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee surrenders to their guru's lotus feet, seeking mercy and salvation.

text:
---------------------
Dainya Prārthanā Gīti
kobe śrī chaitanya more-koribena dayā
kobe āmi pāibo vaiṣṇava-pada-chāyā

(1) O when will Śrī Chaitanya bestow upon me his Grace? When will I get shelter in the shade of the holy feet of the Vaiṣṇavas?

metadata.title: Dainya Prārthanā Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song expressing longing for Śrī Chaitanya's grace and shelter in the holy feet of the Vaiṣṇavas.

text:
kobe āmi chāḍibo e viṣoyābhimān
kobe viṣṇu-jane āmi koribo sammān

(2) When will I give up the false ego of being an enjoyer and when will I offer all respects to the sincere devotees of Lord Viṣṇu?

metadata.title: Dainya Prārthanā Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker asks when they will give up their false ego and show respect to devotees of Lord Viṣṇu.

text:
galavastra kṛtāñjali vaiṣṇava-nikaṭe
dante tṛṇa kori dā̐ḍāibo niṣkapaṭe

(3) When will I submit myself by the feet of the Vaiṣṇava with the cloth of surrender around my neck and with straw between my teeth?

metadata.title: Dainya Prārthanā Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker expresses a desire to submit themselves to a Vaiṣṇava.

text:
kā̐diyā kā̐diyā jānāibo duḥkhagrām
saṁsāra-anala hoite māgibo viśrām

(4) Weeping and weeping when will I submit my sorrowful tale at the feet of the Vaiṣṇava and when will I seek relief from the fire of material suffering praying to that Vaiṣṇava for shelter and rest?

metadata.title: Dainya Prārthanā Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker is seeking relief from material suffering by praying to a Vaiṣṇava.

text:
śuniyā āmāra duḥkha vaiṣṇava ṭhākura
āmā’ lāgi’ kṛṣṇe āvedibena prachura

(5) Upon hearing the tale of my worldly sorrow that saintly Vaiṣṇava will petition Krishna on my behalf in prayer.

metadata.title: Dainya Prārthanā Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A Vaiṣṇava saint will pray to Krishna on behalf of the speaker.

text:
vaiṣṇavera āvedane kṛṣṇa dayāmoy
e heno pāmara prati hoben sadoy

(6) Then satisfied by that Vaiṣṇava’s prayer Krishna will be merciful upon this wicked and sinful wretch.

metadata.title: Dainya Prārthanā Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A Vaiṣṇava's prayer can make Kṛṣṇa merciful to a sinful person.

text:
vinodera nivedan vaiṣṇava-charaṇe
kṛpā kori saṅge loho ei akiñchane

(7) Bhakti Vinod Ṭhākur submits this prayer at the lotus feet of the Vaiṣṇavas. “Give me your Grace and accept this lowly soul in your association.”

metadata.title: Dainya Prārthanā Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Bhakti Vinod Thakur submits a prayer to the Vaiṣṇavas for their grace and association.

text:
------------------
Śrī Sāraswat-ārati
jayare jayare jaya gaura-sarasvatī
bhakativinoda nvaya karuṇā murati

(1) All glories, all glories, all glories to Śrīla Bhakti Siddhānta Saraswatī Ṭhākur, who is intimately connected with Śrīla Bhakti Vinod Ṭhākur and is an embodiment of Śrī Gaurāṅga’s mercy.

metadata.title: Śrī Sāraswat-ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song glorifying Śrīla Bhakti Siddhānta Saraswatī Ṭhākur and his connection with Śrīla Bhakti Vinod Ṭhākur.

text:
prakāśile gaura-sevā bhūvana maṅgala
bhakatisiddhānta śuddha prajñāna ujjvala

(2) You  manifested  devotional  service  to  Lord Gaurāṅga, which is beneficial to the whole universe. Your pure devotional conclusions are effulgent with Absolute Knowledge.

metadata.title: Śrī Sāraswat-ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker praises the devotee's manifestation of devotional service to Lord Gaurāṅga.

text:
rādhā-śyāma ekatanu dakṣe gorā rāya
bāme rādha madhye svayaṁ śyāma-gopa jaya

(3) All glories to Śrī Rādhā and Śyāma (Krishna) who are combined in the one body of Śrī Gaurāṅga, who is on the right side; glories to Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī, who is on the left side; and glories to Him, who is in the middle and who is none other than the Supreme Cowherd Boy, Śrī Śyāmasundar.

metadata.title: Śrī Sāraswat-ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song glorifying Śrī Rādhā and Śyāma, who are combined in the body of Śrī Gaurāṅga.

text:
vraja rasa nava bhāve nabadvīpe rāje
udāre madhura rāga abhinava sāje

(4) The mellow of Vraja (Vṛndāvan) is present in Nabadwīp in a new mood; when this sweet loving sentiment is mixed with magnanimity, then it shows itself as uniquely beautiful.

metadata.title: Śrī Sāraswat-ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The mellow of Vraja is present in Nabadwīp in a new mood.

text:
mādhurya kaivalya rāga vrajera nirjāsa
prāpti parākāṣṭhā tāhe gaurāṅga vilāsa

(5) Mādhurya-rasa (conjugal love) is the essence of Vraja Dhām, and the Pastimes of Mahāprabhu take it to its highest perfection.

metadata.title: Śrī Sāraswat-ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Mādhurya-rasa is the essence of Vraja Dhām and is perfected by Mahāprabhu's pastimes.

text:
rādhā bhāva-kānti aṅgikari’ bhālo mate
dakṣiṇe āsana rasa garimā dekhāte

(6) Earnestly accepting Śrī Rādhā’s mood and beauty, He has taken His place on the right to show His glorious position.

metadata.title: Śrī Sāraswat-ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Kṛṣṇa takes His place on the right to show His glorious position, accepting Śrī Rādhā's mood and beauty.

text:
rādhā-rasa-troyo-svāda rahasya proyāsa
nirakhi praphulla rādhā mukhe manda hāsa

(7) Seeing Krishna’s mischievous desire to understand the glory of Her love, Krishna’s wonderful sweetness that only She can relish through Her transcendental qualities, and the happiness She feels from Krishna’s sweet love for Her, Rādhārāṇī is very pleased and there is a subdued smile on Her face.

metadata.title: Śrī Sāraswat-ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Rādhārāṇī is pleased with Krishna's mischievous desire to understand her love.

text:
madhye rahi vaṁśīrave ghoṣe vaṁśīdhara
rādhāra sampade āmī gaurāṅga-sundara

(8) In the middle, Vaṁśīdhara (the Flute Player) is playing His flute, thinking that, “Only by the wealth of Rādhārāṇī do I become Gaurāṅga Sundar.”

metadata.title: Śrī Sāraswat-ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Vaṁśīdhara plays his flute thinking he becomes beautiful due to Rādhārāṇī's wealth.

text:
madabhīṣṭha rūpa rādhāra hṛdoya mandire
gaurāṅga bhajile suṣṭhu sphūrti pāya tāre

(9) “My most cherished form is revealed in the temple of Rādhārāṇī’s heart, and that highest manifestation of Myself can be attained only by worshipping Gaurāṅga.”

metadata.title: Śrī Sāraswat-ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Gaurāṅga reveals His most cherished form in the temple of Rādhārāṇī's heart and can be attained by worshipping Him.

text:
nadīyā prakāśe mahāprabhu gaura-nidhi
patita pāvana deve milāila vidhi

(10) By the Lord’s divine arrangement, the Supreme Savior of the fallen souls appeared in Nadīyā as the most beloved Śrī Gaurāṅga Mahāprabhu.

metadata.title: Śrī Sāraswat-ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The appearance of Gaurāṅga Mahāprabhu in Nadīyā.

text:
e-rūpa ārati brahmā śambhu agochara
gaura bhakta kṛpā pātra mātra siddhi sāra

(11) This type of divine worship of Mahāprabhu is beyond the vision of even Lord Brahmā or Lord Shiva. Only by receiving the mercy of a devotee of Lord Gaurāṅga can one attain such perfection.

metadata.title: Śrī Sāraswat-ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: This verse explains that only by receiving the mercy of a devotee of Lord Gaurāṅga can one attain perfection in divine worship of Mahāprabhu.

text:
śrī svarūpa, rāmānanda, rūpa, sanātana
śrī raghu, jīvādi kṛpāya dekhe bhakta-jana

(12) Only by the mercy of Śrī Swarūp Dāmodar, Śrī Rāmananda Rāya, Śrī Rūpa, Śrī Sanātan, Śrī Raghunāth, Śrī Jīva and their associates do the devotees attain that vision.

metadata.title: Śrī Sāraswat-ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotees attain the vision of the Lord by the mercy of Śrī Swarūp Dāmodar and other associates.

text:
jaya guru-gaura-rādhā-govinda-sundara
jaya dāo bhakta vṛnda nitya nirantara

(13) All glories to Śrī Guru, Gaurāṅga, Rādhā-Govindasundar. O devotees, always sing Their eternal glories.

metadata.title: Śrī Sāraswat-ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song glorifying Śrī Guru, Gaurāṅga, and Rādhā-Govindasundar.

text:
------------------------
Śrī Vaiṣṇava-mahimā-gīti
(ohe) vaiṣṇava ṭhākura,    dayāra sāgara,
e dāse karuṇā kori
diyā pada-chāyā,    śodho he āmāre,
tomāra charaṇa dhori

(1) Oh my Lord, Oh Vaiṣṇava, Ocean of grace, Kindly be gracious to this servitor; Bestow the shade of your holy feet, purify me, I clasp your holy lotus feet.

metadata.title: Śrī Vaiṣṇava-mahimā-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song by Śrī Vaiṣṇava-mahimā-gīti, requesting the grace of Lord Vaiṣṇava.

text:
choya bega domi’,    choya doṣa śodhi’,
choya guṇa deho’ dāse
choya sat-saṅga,    deho’ he āmāre,
bosechi saṅgera āśe

(2) Subjugate the six urges, rectify the six defects, bestow the six good qualities upon this servitor; Please grant me the six kinds of saintly association; I sit at your feet aspiring for that association. *

metadata.title: Śrī Vaiṣṇava-mahimā-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee requests Kṛṣṇa to bestow good qualities and saintly association.

text:
ekākī āmāra,    nāhi pāya bala,
hari-nāma-saṅkīrtane
tumi kṛpā kori,    śraddhā-bindu diyā,
deho’ kṛṣṇa-nāma-dhane

(3) On my own I have no strength to chant the Holy Name in congregation; Kindly be pleased to bestow a drop of faith in my heart, giving me the treasure of Lord Krishna’s Name.

metadata.title: Śrī Vaiṣṇava-mahimā-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee requests Kṛṣṇa to bestow faith in order to chant His Name in congregation.

text:
kṛṣṇa se tomāra,    kṛṣṇa dite pāro,
tomāra śakati āche
āmi to kāṅgāla,    ‘kṛṣṇa kṛṣṇa’ boli,
dhāi tava pāche pāche

(āmi) (dhāi tava pāche pāche)
(kṛṣṇa dhana pābarāse dhāi tava pāche pāche)
(tumi dileou dite pāro)
(kṛṣṇa tomār hṛdoyer dhan tumi dileou dite pāro)
(kṛṣṇa devār śakti dhara tumi dileou dite pāro)

(4) Krishna is yours, you can give Him, you have the power to do so; I who am bereft, Calling ‘Krishna, Krishna,’ am running desperately behind you.
Footnote to verse 2:
The six urges are those of speech, the mind, anger, the tongue, the belly, and the genitals.
The six faults are overeating or collecting more monetary funds than required, overendeavouring for material objectives, unnecessary talking about mundane affairs, being too attached to or too neglectful of Scriptural rules and regulations, associating with worldly-minded persons, and lusting after mundane achievements.
The six good qualities are enthusiasm, patience, confidence, the determination to perform activities favourable to devotional service, the resolution to abandon the association of non-devotees, and the discipline required to always follow in the footsteps of the predecessor āchāryas*.
The six kinds of saintly association are offering gifts in charity, accepting charitable gifts, revealing one’s mind in confidence, inquiring confidentially, accepting prasādam and offering prasādam.

metadata.title: Śrī Vaiṣṇava-mahimā-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee expresses their longing to receive Kṛṣṇa and acknowledges their own inability to attain Him.

text:

śrī kṛṣṇa chaitanya prabhu dayā kara more
tomā vinā ke dayālu jagata mājhāre

(1) Lord Śrī Krishna Chaitanya Mahāprabhu, kindly give Your Grace to me; In the whole creation, there’s none as merciful as You.

metadata.title: Sāvaraṇa-Śrī-Gaura-pāda-padme Prārthanā
metadata.author: Unknown

text:
patita-pāvana-hetu tava avatāra

(2) You descended just to save the fallen souls; Oh Lord, a soul as fallen as me is nowhere to be found.

metadata.title: Sāvaraṇa-Śrī-Gaura-pāda-padme Prārthanā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee is humbly acknowledging the Lord's descent to save fallen souls like himself.

text:
hā hā prabhu nityānanda premānanda sukhī
kṛpā-bolokana kara āmi boḍo duḥkhī

metadata.title: Sāvaraṇa-Śrī-Gaura-pāda-padme Prārthanā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee requests Nityānanda's mercy and a glance of joy.

dayā kara sītā-pati advaita gosāi
tava kṛpā-bole pāi chaitanya-nitāi

metadata.title: Sāvaraṇa-Śrī-Gaura-pāda-padme Prārthanā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A prayer to Śrī Advaita Goswāmī for the mercy to serve Śrī Śrī Nitāi-Chaitanya.

text:
gaura premamoya tanu paṇḍit gadādhara
śrīnivāsa haridāsa dayāra sāgara

(5) The embodiment of Śrī Gaura’s love Paṇḍit Gadādhara; Śrīvās Paṇḍit, Haridās Ṭhākur, you are the ocean of grace personified.

metadata.title: Sāvaraṇa-Śrī-Gaura-pāda-padme Prārthanā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song praising the love of Śrī Gaura and his associates.

text:
hā hā svarūpa sanātana rūpa raghunātha
bhaṭṭa-juga śrī jīva hā prabhu lokanātha

(6) Oh my Lords, Śrī Swarūp Dāmodar, Śrī Sanātan, Śrī Rūpa and Śrī Raghunāth; Śrī Raghunāth Bhaṭṭa and Śrī Gopāl Bhaṭṭa; Oh my Lord Śrī Lokanāth Goswāmī.

metadata.title: Sāvaraṇa-Śrī-Gaura-pāda-padme Prārthanā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A prayer to the Gaudiya Vaishnava acharyas and goswamis.

dayā kara śrī-āchārya prabhu śrīnivāsa
rāmachandra-saṅga māge narottama dāsa

metadata.title: Sāvaraṇa-Śrī-Gaura-pāda-padme Prārthanā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Narottam Dāsa prays for the blessings of Śrī Śrīnivās Āchārya for the company of Śrī Rāmachandra Chakravartī.

(8) Kindly give Your Grace, Śrīla Prabhupād Saraswatī Ṭhākur, manifestation of Śrī Gaura. This fallen servant begs the mercy of your associates.

metadata.title: Sāvaraṇa-Śrī-Gaura-pāda-padme Prārthanā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee prays to Śrīla Prabhupād Saraswatī Ṭhākur for mercy and the mercy of his associates.

text:
---------------

(kiba) jaya jaya gaurāchā̐der ārotiko śobhā
jāhṇavī-taṭa-vane jagamana-lobhā

metadata.title: Śrī Gaura-ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A description of the divine pastimes of Lord Gaurachandra and His associates.

bosiyāchen gaurāchāṅd ratna-siṁhāsane)

metadata.title: Śrī Gaura-ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Lord Chaitanya is seated upon a jewelled throne while the demigods headed by Lord Brahmā perform the ārati ceremony.

text:
(kiba) narahari-ādi kori chāmara ḍhulāya
sañjaya-mukunda-vāsu-ghoṣa-ādi gāya

(4) Narahari Sarakār and other associates of Lord Chaitanya fan Him with whisks and the devotees headed by Sañjaya Paṇḍit, Mukunda Datta, and Vāsu Ghoṣa sing sweet kīrtan along with the other devotees.

metadata.title: Śrī Gaura-ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Narahari Sarakār and other devotees fan Lord Chaitanya with whisks while Sañjaya Paṇḍit, Mukunda Datta, and Vāsu Ghoṣa sing kīrtan.

text:
(kiba) śaṅkha bāje ghaṇṭā bāje bāje karatāla
madhura mṛdaṅga bāje parama rasāla
(madhur madhur madhur bāje)
(gaurāṅger āroti kāle madhur madhur madhur bāje)
(śaṅkha bāje ghaṇṭā bāje madhur madhur madhur bāje)
(madhura mṛdanga bāje madhur madhur madhur bāje)
(nitāi gaura haribol)

(5) Conchshells, bells, and karatālas resound, and the mṛdaṅgas play very sweetly. This kīrtan music is supremely sweet and relishable to hear.

metadata.title: Śrī Gaura-ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A description of the sweet kīrtan music played during the pastimes of Gaurāṅger and Nityānanda.

text:
(kiba) bahu-koṭi chandra jini vadana ujjvala
gala-deśe bona-mālā kore jhalamala
(jhalmol jhalmol jhalmol kore)
(gaura gole bona phuler mālā jhalmol jhalmol jhalmol kore)
(nitāi gaura haribol)

(6) The brilliance of Lord Chaitanya’s face conquers millions upon millions of moons, and the garland of forest flowers around His neck shines.

metadata.title: Śrī Gaura-ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The brilliance of Lord Chaitanya’s face is described as conquering millions of moons.

text:
(kiba) śiva-śuka-nārada preme gada-gada
bhakativinoda dekhe gorāra sampada

(7) Lord Shiva, Śukadeva Goswāmī and Nārada Muni are all present and their voices are choked with the ecstasy of transcendental love. Thus Bhakti Vinod envisions the glorious worship of Lord Gaurachandra.

metadata.title: Śrī Gaura-ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Bhakti Vinod envisions the glorious worship of Lord Gaurachandra in the presence of Lord Shiva, Śukadeva Goswāmī, and Nārada Muni.

text:
(ei bār āmāy dayā kara)
(ṭhākura śrī bhaktivinoda ei bār āmāy dayā kara)
(ṭhākura śrī sarasvatī ei bār āmāy dayā kara)
(patit-pāvan śrī gurudev ei bār āmāy dayā kara)
(sapārṣada gaurahari ei bār āmāy dayā kara)
(nitāi gaura haribol)

(8) This time please give me your grace. Oh Śrī Bhakti Vinod, Śrī Saraswatī Ṭhākur, Oh Gurudeva, saviour of the fallen, Oh Lord Gaurahari along with Your associates, this time please give me Your grace.

metadata.title: Śrī Gaura-ārati
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee requests the mercy of various Vaishnava personalities.

text:
----------
Sva-Niṣṭha
dhana mora nityānanda    pati mora gaurachandra
prāṇa mora jugala-kiśora
advaita āchārya bala    gadādhara mora kula
narahari vilasai mora

(1) Lord Nityānanda is my wealth. Lord Gaurachandra is my master. The youthful Divine Couple is my life. Advaita Āchārya is my strength. Gadādhara is my family. Narahari Sarakara is my glory.

metadata.title: Sva-Niṣṭha
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song describing the devotees' relationship with Lord Nityānanda and other associates.

text:
vaiṣṇavera pada-dhūli    tāhe mora snāna-keli
tarpaṇa mora vaiṣṇavera nāma
vichāra koriyā mane    bhakti-rasa āsvādane
madhyastha śrī-bhāgavata purāṇa

(2) The dust of the devotees’ lotus feet is my bathing water. The chanting of the devotees’ names is my satisfaction. Considering the merits of all Vedic literatures in the light of devotional service, I have concluded that the Śrīmad Bhāgavatam is the best of all scriptures.

metadata.title: Sva-Niṣṭha
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker considers the Śrīmad Bhāgavatam the best of all scriptures.

text:
vaiṣṇavera uchiṣṭa    tāhe mora mano-niṣṭha
vaiṣṇavera nāmete ullāsa
vṛndāvane chaturā    tāhe mora mano-gherā
kohe dīne narottama dāsa

(3) My mind is firmly convinced of the spiritual benefit obtained by eating the remnants of foodstuff left by the devotees. The names of the devotees are my happiness. The land of Vṛndāvan is the enclosure within which I keep my mind. Poor-hearted Narottam Dās speaks in this way.

metadata.title: Sva-Niṣṭha
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker's mind is convinced of the spiritual benefit of eating food left by devotees and is happy to think of their names.

text:
-----------
Manaḥ-Śikṣā
nitāi-pada-kamala,    koṭī-chandra-suśītala,
je chāyāya jagata juḍāy
heno nitāi bine bhāi,    rādhā-kṛṣṇa pāite nāi,
dṛḍha kori dharo nitāira pāya

(1) The holy lotus feet of Nitāi,
cooling like ten million moons —
In the shade of which
the world gains soothing relief;
Without that Nitāi, O brother,
No one can reach Rādhā and Krishna —
Clasp His lotus feet with full conviction.

metadata.title: Manaḥ-Śikṣā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The song describes the importance of Nitāi's lotus feet in reaching Rādhā and Krishna.

text:
se sambandha nāhi jāra,    vṛthā janma gelo tāra,
sei paśu boḍo durāchāra
nitāi nā bolilo mukhe,    majilo saṁsāra-sukhe,
vidyā-kule ki koribe tāra

(2) One who never got His connection,
passed his life in vain —
Such an animal is so very wicked;
He whose mouth never uttered ‘Nitāi,’
merged in mundane pleasures —
How can his aristocratic lineage save him?

metadata.title: Manaḥ-Śikṣā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The song describes the consequences of not having a connection with Nitāi.

text:
ahaṅkāre matta hoiyā, nitāi-pada pāsariyā,
asatyere satya kori māni
nitāiyer karuṇā habe, vraje rādhā-kṛṣṇa pābe,
dharo nitāiyer charaṇ du’ khāni

(3) Maddened with pride,
forgetting the lotus feet of Nitāi —
I embrace untruth as truth;
But when Nitāi gives His Grace
you’ll reach Rādhā and Krishna in Vraja —
O embrace the lotus feet of Nitāi!

metadata.title: Manaḥ-Śikṣā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The song describes the importance of embracing the lotus feet of Nitāi to attain love for Rādhā and Krishna in Vraja.

text:
nitāiyer charaṇa satya, tā̐hāra sevaka nitya,
nitāi-pada sadā kara āśa
narottama boḍo duḥkhī, nitāi more kara sukhī
rākho rāṅgā-charaṇera pāśa

(4) The lotus feet of Nitāi are truth,
His servitors are eternal —
Ever aspire for the shelter of His feet;
Narottam is very sad — O Nitāi make me happy —
Please keep me at Your lovely lotus feet!

metadata.title: Manaḥ-Śikṣā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee prays to Nitāi to make him happy and keep him at his lotus feet.

text:
-------------------
Akrodha paramānanda
akrodha paramānanda nityānanda rāy
abhimāna-śūnya nitāi nagare beḍāy

(1) The great personality, Lord Nityānanda Prabhu, is free from anger and full of transcendental ecstasy. He wanders throughout the towns, free from false pride and arrogance.

metadata.title: Akrodha paramānanda
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The song describes Lord Nityānanda Prabhu as a great personality free from anger and full of transcendental ecstasy.

text:
adhama patita jīver dvāre dvāre giyā
harināma mahāmantra dena bilāiyā

(2) He travels from door to door to the homes of the fallen souls, freely distributing the Hare Krishna mahāmantra.

metadata.title: Akrodha paramānanda
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The Hare Krishna mahāmantra is freely distributed to the fallen souls.

text:
jāre dekhe tāre kohe dante tṛṇa kori
āmāre kiniyā loho bhaja gaurahari

(3) With straw between His teeth, He begs all who cross his path, “Worship Lord Gaurahari and you will purchase me.”

metadata.title: Akrodha paramānanda
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee of Lord Gaurahari begs passersby to worship him.

text:
eta boli’ nityānanda bhūme goḍi jāy
sonāra parvata jena dhūlāte loṭāy

(4) Saying this Nityānanda falls to the ground, appearing like a golden mountain rolling in the dust.

metadata.title: Akrodha paramānanda
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Nityānanda falls to the ground, rolling in the dust like a golden mountain.

text:
heno avatāre jāra rati nā janmilo
lochan bole sei pāpī elo āra gelo

(5) Where attachment for such an incarnation has not arisen, Lochan Dās says that such a sinful person comes and goes in the cycle of repeated birth and death.

metadata.title: Akrodha paramānanda
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Attachment for an incarnation of Kṛṣṇa is necessary for spiritual progress.

text:
------------------------------
Śrī Śrī Gaura-Nityānander Dayā
parama karuṇa,    pahu̐ dūi jana,
nitāi gaurachandra
saba avatāra-    sāra śiromaṇi,
kevala ānanda-kanda

(1) Lord Nitāi and Lord Gaurachandra, are the two most merciful lords. They are the crest-jewels of all incarnations and the only source of transcendental ecstatic joy.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Gaura-Nityānander Dayā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Śrī Gaura-Nityānander Dayā describes the merciful nature of Lord Nitāi and Lord Gaurachandra.

text:
bhaja bhaja bhāi,    chaitanya nitāi,
sudṛḍha biśvāsa kori’
viṣoya chāḍiyā,    se rase majiyā
mukhe bolo hari hari

(2) O brother! I implore you to worship Śrī Chaitanya-Nitāi with firm faith. Give up your attachment to sense gratification and merge into this nectar by chanting the Names of Hari.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Gaura-Nityānander Dayā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song urging worship of Śrī Chaitanya-Nitāi with firm faith and chanting Hari's Names.

text:
dekho ore bhāi,    tri-bhuvane nāi
emona dayāla dātā
paśu pākhī jhure,    pāṣāṇa vidore,
śuni jāra guṇa-gāthā

(3) Look, O brother! There are no benefactors in the three worlds who are as merciful as Them. Even birds and animals are fulfilled and stones melt, by hearing the glories of Their qualities.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Gaura-Nityānander Dayā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The glories of the merciful qualities of the Supreme Lord are so powerful that even animals and stones are fulfilled by hearing them.

text:
saṁsāre majiyā,    rohili poḍiyā,
se pade nahilo āśa
āpana karama,    bhuñjāye śamana,
kohoye lochana-dāsa

(4) Absorbed in the cycle of birth and death, having fallen by the wayside without any hope for achieving Their company, the lord of death will come and make you suffer the results of your activities—so sings Lochan Dās.

metadata.title: Śrī Śrī Gaura-Nityānander Dayā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The song describes the suffering one will face in the cycle of birth and death without hope of achieving the Lord's company.

text:
--------------------
Nitāi guṇamaṇi āmāra
nitāi guṇamaṇi āmāra nitāi guṇamaṇi
āniyā premera vanyā bhāsāla abanī

(1) O my Lord Nityānanda, the jewel of all good qualities; O Nitāi, the jewel of all good qualities has brought a flood of ecstatic love of Godhead that has drowned the whole world.

metadata.title: Nitāi guṇamaṇi āmāra
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A song describing Nityānanda's power to bring ecstatic love of Godhead.

text:
premavanyā loye nitāi āila gāuḍa deśe
ḍubilo bhakata-gaṇa dīnahīna bhāse

(2) Lord Nityānanda has brought this overwhelming deluge of love of Godhead to the land of Bengal on Lord Chaitanya’s order. The devotees have been inundated by this deluge but the unfortunate non-devotees have remained floating on that ecstatic ocean.

metadata.title: Nitāi guṇamaṇi āmāra
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Lord Nityānanda brought love of Godhead to Bengal on Lord Chaitanya’s order.

text:
dīnahīna patita pāmara nāhi bāche
brahmāra durlabha prema sabākāre jāce

(3) Lord Nityananda freely offered this rare gift of love of Godhead, which is difficult for even Lord Brahmā to attain, to the fallen and wretched souls who were not desirous of receiving it.

metadata.title: Nitāi guṇamaṇi āmāra
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Lord Nityananda freely offered the rare gift of love of Godhead to the fallen and wretched souls.

text:
ābaddha karuṇā-sindhu kāṭiyā muhāna
ghore ghore bule prema-amiyāra bāna

(4) The ocean of mercy had formerly been tightly sealed, but Lord Nitāi cut a channel in its boundary to allow the great flooding waves of ecstatic love to wash down from house to house.

metadata.title: Nitāi guṇamaṇi āmāra
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Lord Nitāi cuts a channel in the ocean of mercy to allow the flooding waves of ecstatic love to spread.

text:
lochan bole heno nitāi jebā nā bhajilo
jāniyā śuniyā sei ātmaghātī hoilo

(5) Lochan Dās says, “Whoever has not worshipped this Lord Nitāi, or accepted the great gift offered by Him, that person knowingly commits suicide.”

metadata.title: Nitāi guṇamaṇi āmāra
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Lochan Dās warns that not worshipping Lord Nitāi is equivalent to committing suicide.

text:
----------
Ājñā-Ṭahal
nadīyā-godrume nityānanda mahājana
pātiyāche nāma-haṭṭa jivera kāraṇa

(1) In the land of Nadīyā, on the island of Godruma, the magnanimous Lord Nityānanda has opened up the Marketplace of the Holy Name, meant for the deliverance of all fallen souls.

metadata.title: Ājñā-Ṭahal
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Nityānanda has opened up the Marketplace of the Holy Name in Nadīyā for the deliverance of all fallen souls.

text:
(śraddhāvān jon he, śraddhāvān jon he)
prabhura ājñāya, bhāi, māgi ei bhikṣā
bolo ‘kṛṣṇa,’ bhajo kṛṣṇa, kara kṛṣṇa-śikṣā

(2) O people of faith! O people of faith! By the order of Lord Gaurāṅga, O brothers, I beg these three requests of you: Chant “Krishna!”, worship Krishna, and teach others about Krishna.

metadata.title: Ājñā-Ṭahal
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A song requesting people to chant and worship Kṛṣṇa and teach others about Him.

text:
aparādha-śūnya ho’ye loha kṛṣṇa-nāma
kṛṣṇa mātā, kṛṣṇa pita, kṛṣṇa dhana-prāṇa

(3) Being careful to remain free of offenses, just take the holy name of Lord Krishna. Krishna is your mother, Krishna is your father, and Krishna is the treasure of your life.

metadata.title: Ājñā-Ṭahal
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song emphasizing the importance of taking the holy name of Lord Krishna.

text:
kṛṣṇera saṁsāra kara chāḍi’ anāchāra
jīve dayā, kṛṣṇa-nāma – sarva-dharma-sāra

(4) Giving up all sinful activities, carry on your worldly duties only in relation to Lord Krishna. The showing of compassion to other souls by loudly chanting the holy name of Krishna is the essence of all forms of religion.

metadata.title: Ājñā-Ṭahal
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The essence of all forms of religion is to show compassion to other souls by chanting the holy name of Krishna.

text:
---------------------
Dayāl Nitāi Chaitanya
‘dayāl nitāi chaitanya’ bo’le nāch re āmār man
nāch re āmār man, nāch re āmār man

(1) Oh my mind, just dance! Oh my mind, just dance! Oh my mind, please dance, chanting, “Dayāl Nitāi Chaitanya!”

metadata.title: Dayāl Nitāi Chaitanya
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song encouraging the mind to dance while chanting the name Dayāl Nitāi Chaitanya.

text:
(emon dayāl to nāi he, mār kheye prema dey)
(tabe) aparādha dūre jābe, pābe prema-dhan
(aparādhera-vichāra to nāi he)
takhon kṛṣṇa-nāme ruchi habe, ghuchibe bandhan

(2) Such a merciful personality as Nityānanda Prabhu is not to be found anywhere. He suffers a beating from Jagāi and Mādhāi and still gives them love of God.
When you become offenceless, you will obtain love of God; but in these Names of Chaitanya and Nitāi there is no consideration of offences. Once you have a taste for the Holy Name of Krishna, bondage to this world will come to an end.

metadata.title: Dayāl Nitāi Chaitanya
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Nityānanda Prabhu gives love of God to Jagāi and Mādhāi despite suffering a beating from them.

text:
(anurāg to habe he)
tokhon anāyāse saphal habe jīvera jīvan
(kṛṣṇa-rati vinā jīvan to miche he)
śeṣe vṛndāvane rādhā-śyāmer pābe daraśan
(gaura-kṛpā hole he)

(3) When there is attachment to the Holy Name of Krishna, then, very easily, the life of a living being becomes successful. Without attachment to Krishna, life is simply false. If the mercy of Lord Gaura is there, then at the end of life you will obtain the beautiful vision of Rādhā and Śyāma in Vṛndāvan.

metadata.title: Dayāl Nitāi Chaitanya
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Attachment to the Holy Name of Krishna leads to a successful life and ultimately a vision of Rādhā and Śyāma in Vṛndāvan.

text:
-------------------
Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam

(1) The fourth verse of the Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam is as follows:

metadata.title: 4. Prabhu tava pada
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The fourth verse of the Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam is described.

text:
na dhanaṁ na janaṁ na sundarīṁ
kavitāṁ vā jagad-īśa kāmaye
mama janmani janmanīśvare
bhavatād bhaktir ahaitukī tvayi

(2) “Oh Lord, I have no desires to accumulate wealth, followers, beautiful women, or salvation. My only prayer is for Your causeless devotional service, birth after birth.”

metadata.title: 4. Prabhu tava pada
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee prays for the Lord's causeless devotional service, birth after birth.

text:
prabhu tava pada-juge mora nivedana
nāhi māgi deho-sukha, vidyā dhana, jana

(3) O Lord! This is my humble submission at Your lotus feet. I do not ask from You sensual pleasure, learning, wealth or followers.

metadata.title: 4. Prabhu tava pada
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee humbly submits to Kṛṣṇa, renouncing worldly desires and seeking only His association.

text:
nāhi māgi svarga, āro mokṣa nāhi māgi
nā kori prārthanā kono vibhūtira lāgi

(4) I do not beg for residence on the celestial planets, nor do I wish liberation from this mundane existence. Nor do I pray for the attainment of any mystic powers.

metadata.title: 4. Prabhu tava pada
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker does not desire material benefits, liberation, or spiritual powers.

text:
nija-karma-guṇa-doṣe je je janma pāi
janme janme jeno tava nāma-guṇa gāi

(5) Whatever birth I may obtain due to the results of my previous worldly activities, I pray that I may sing the glories of Your Holy Name birth after birth.

metadata.title: 4. Prabhu tava pada
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee prays to sing the glories of Kṛṣṇa's Holy Name in every birth.

text:
ei mātra āśā mama tomāra charaṇe
ahaitukī bhakti hṛde jāge anukṣaṇe

(6) This alone is my cherished hope, my aspiration, my prayer at Your lotus feet: Let causeless and uninterrupted devotion awaken within my heart and flow towards You.

metadata.title: 4. Prabhu tava pada
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee expresses their desire for causeless devotion to flow towards Kṛṣṇa.

text:
biṣoye je prīti ebe āchoye āmāra
sei-mata prīti hauk charaṇe tomāra

(7) Let me love Your lotus feet as much as I now love sense gratification; transfer my affection from the objects of the senses to Your lotus feet.

metadata.title: 4. Prabhu tava pada
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee asks Kṛṣṇa to accept their love and redirect their affection from sense gratification to His lotus feet.

text:
vipade sampade tāhā thākuka samabhāve
dine dine bṛddhi hauk nāmera prabhāve

(8) In danger or success, good fortune or disaster, let me remain equipoised. And let my affection for You increase day by day by the influence of the Holy Name.

metadata.title: 4. Prabhu tava pada
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee prays to remain equipoised in all situations and to increase their love for Kṛṣṇa through the Holy Name.

text:
paśu-pakṣī hoye thāki svarge bā niroye
tava bhakti rahu bhaktivinoda-hṛdoye

(9) Whether I live as bird or beast, in heaven or in hell, let the humble Bhakti Vinod always cherish devotion to You in his heart of hearts.

metadata.title: 4. Prabhu tava pada
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee expresses his desire to always cherish devotion to the Lord in his heart.

text:
----------------------
Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam

(1) The eighth verse of the Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam is as follows:

metadata.title: 8a. Bondhu-goṇ! śunoho
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The eighth verse of the Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam scripture.

text:
āśliṣya vā pāda-ratāṁ pinaṣṭu mām
adarśanān marma-hatāṁ karotu vā
yathā tathā vā vidadhātu lampaṭo
mat-prāṇa-nāthas tu sa eva nāparaḥ

(2) “Krishna may embrace me in love or trample me under His feet. He may break my heart by hiding Himself from me. Let that debauchee do whatever He likes, but He will always be the only Lord of my life.”

metadata.title: 8a. Bondhu-goṇ! śunoho
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee expresses their surrender to Krishna, allowing Him to do as He pleases.

text:
bondhu-goṇ!    śunoho vachana mora
bhāvete bibhora, thākiye jokhon,
dekhā deya chitta-chora

(3) Oh my friends! Listen to my words. I am filled to overflowing with devotional ecstasy when I have a divine vision of that thief who has stolen my heart.

metadata.title: 8a. Bondhu-goṇ! śunoho
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker expresses their love for Kṛṣṇa, calling him a thief who has stolen their heart.

text:
bichakṣaṇa kori’    dekhite chāhile,
hoya ā̐khi-agochara
punaḥ nāhi dekhi’,    kā̐daye parāṇa,
duḥkhera nā thāke ora

(4) And when I want to see Him more clearly, He disappears from sight and becomes invisible. Again, not seeing Him, my soul weeps and my grief knows no bounds.

metadata.title: 8a. Bondhu-goṇ! śunoho
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker expresses their longing to see Kṛṣṇa more clearly, but He disappears from sight, causing the speaker great grief.

text:
jagatera bandhu sei kobhu more loya sātha
yathā tathā rākhu more āmāra se prāṇanātha

(5) Sometimes Krishna, the friend of the universe, takes me as one of His own, and sometimes He ignores me, but however He keeps me, He is the only Lord of my life.

metadata.title: 8a. Bondhu-goṇ! śunoho
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee describes their relationship with Krishna, who is the friend of the universe and the Lord of their life.

text:
darśan-ānanda-dāne,    sukha dey mora prāṇe,
bole more praṇoya-vachan
punaḥ adarśan diyā,    dagdha kore mora hiyā,
prāṇe more māre prāṇa-dhan

(6) When He gives His blissful audience to me, He gives happiness to my soul. He gives me great ecstasy by allowing me to see Him and by speaking affectionately to me. Again He goes away, removing Himself from my sight. And by not letting me see Him, He burns my heart with the fire of separation.

metadata.title: 8a. Bondhu-goṇ! śunoho
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker describes the joy and pain of experiencing Kṛṣṇa's darśana (audience).

text:
jāhe tā’ra sukha hoy, sei sukha mama
nija sukhe-duḥkhe mora sarvadāi sama

(7) But even though He pains my soul in this way, He is still the Lord of my life. Whatever is His happiness is also my happiness. And so, for me, my own happiness and distress is all the same.

metadata.title: 8a. Bondhu-goṇ! śunoho
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker's happiness and distress are tied to the happiness and distress of Kṛṣṇa.

text:
bhakativinoda,    saṁjoge bijoge,
tāhe jāne prāṇeśvara
tā’ra sukhe sukhī,    sei prāṇa-nātha,
se kobhu nā hoya paro

(8) In this way, Bhakti Vinod, in both union and separation, knows that Krishna is the only Lord of his soul. Krishna’s happiness is my happiness. He is the Lord of my life; there is no other Lord for me than Him.

metadata.title: 8a. Bondhu-goṇ! śunoho
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Bhakti Vinod understands that Krishna is the only Lord of his soul and that His happiness is his own.

text:
--------------------
Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam

(1) The second verse of the Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam is as follows:

metadata.title: 2. Tuhu̐ dayā-sāgara
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The second verse of the Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam is described.

text:
nāmnām akāri bahudhā nija-sarva-śaktis
tatrārpitā niyamitaḥ smaraṇe na kālaḥ
etādṛśī tava kṛpā bhagavan mamāpi
durdaivam īdṛśam ihājani nānurāgaḥ

(2) “Oh my Lord, Your Holy Name bestows auspiciousness upon all. And You have unlimited Names such as Krishna and Govinda by which You reveal Yourself. In Your many Holy Names You have kindly invested all Your transcendental potency. And in chanting these Names, there are no strict rules concerning time or place. Out of Your causless mercy, You have descended in the form of divine sound, but my great misfortune is that I have no love for Your Holy Name.”

metadata.title: 2. Tuhu̐ dayā-sāgara
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee expresses his longing for love of the Lord's Holy Name.

text:
tuhu̐ dayā-sāgara tārayite prāṇī
nāma aneka tuyā śikhāoli āni

(3) O Lord! You are an ocean of mercy, and so you have brought the teachings of the glories of your unlimited Holy Names to deliver all souls.

metadata.title: 2. Tuhu̐ dayā-sāgara
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee prays to the Lord for deliverance through His Holy Names.

text:
sakala śakati dei nāme tohārā
grahaṇe rākholi nāhi kāla-vichārā

(4) You have conferred all Your power upon Your Name. And there are no rules governing the appropriate time or place for chanting the Holy Name.

metadata.title: 2. Tuhu̐ dayā-sāgara
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The Holy Name has all the power of Kṛṣṇa and can be chanted at any time.

text:
śrī-nāma-chintāmaṇi tohāri samānā
biśve bilāoli karuṇā-nidānā

(5) The Holy Name is a chintāmaṇi gem, a divine touchstone, and is nondifferent from You. Out of Your kindness for all souls, You have distributed Your Holy Name throughout the universe.

metadata.title: 2. Tuhu̐ dayā-sāgara
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The Holy Name is a divine touchstone and is nondifferent from Kṛṣṇa.

text:
tuyā dayā aichana parama udārā
atiśoya manda nātha! bhāga hāmārā

(6) This is Your mercy, O Lord. You are supremely kind. But, O Lord, I am most wicked and unfortunate.

metadata.title: 2. Tuhu̐ dayā-sāgara
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee expresses his sense of unworthiness in the face of the Lord's mercy.

text:
nāhi janamalo nāme anurāga mora
bhaktivinoda-chitta duḥkhe bibhora

(7) I have never known any attraction for the Holy Names. And so, the heart of Bhakti Vinod is filled with sadness.

metadata.title: 2. Tuhu̐ dayā-sāgara
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Bhaktivinoda feels sadness due to lack of attraction for the Holy Names.

text:
-------------------------
Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam

(1) The third verse of the Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam is as follows:

metadata.title: 3. Śrī-Kṛṣṇa-kīrtane jodi
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The third verse of the Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam is described.

text:
tṛṇād api sunīchena
taror iva sahiṣṇunā
amāninā mānadena
kīrtanīyaḥ sadā hariḥ

(2) One who is humbler than a blade of grass, more forbearing than a tree who gives due honour to others without desiring it for himself is qualified to always chant the Holy Name of Krishna.

metadata.title: 3. Śrī-Kṛṣṇa-kīrtane jodi
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A person with humility and forbearance is qualified to chant the Holy Name of Krishna.

text:
śrī-kṛṣṇa-kīrtane jodi mānasa tohāra
parama jatane tā̐hi lobho adhikāra

(3) If your mind is always carefully absorbed in the chanting of the Holy Name, then you will become qualified for chanting the Holy Name of Krishna.

metadata.title: 3. Śrī-Kṛṣṇa-kīrtane jodi
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Chanting the Holy Name can qualify one to chant the Holy Name of Krishna.

text:
ṭṛṇādhika hīna, dīna, akiñchana chāra
āpane mānobi sadā chāḍi’ ahaṅkāra

(4) Humbler than a blade of grass considering yourself low, poor, and meek, give up your false ego.

metadata.title: 3. Śrī-Kṛṣṇa-kīrtane jodi
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee should consider themselves lowly and give up their false ego.

text:
vṛkṣa-sama kṣamā-guṇa karabi sādhana
pratihiṁsā tyaji anye karabi pālana

(5) Tolerant as a tree, you should forgive and forbear, giving up violence. Practice nurturing and protecting others.

metadata.title: 3. Śrī-Kṛṣṇa-kīrtane jodi
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The verse advises to be tolerant like a tree, forgive and forbear, and practice nurturing and protecting others.

text:
jīvana-nirvāhe āne udvega nā dibe
para-upakāre nija-sukha pāsaribe

(6) Live without causing anxiety to others; do good unto others without considering your own happiness.

metadata.title: 3. Śrī-Kṛṣṇa-kīrtane jodi
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.scripture_source: Bhagavad-gita (not explicitly mentioned, but a common source of this sloka)
metadata.summary: The sloka advises living without causing anxiety to others and doing good deeds without considering personal happiness.

text:
hoile-o sarva-guṇe guṇī mahāśoya
pratiṣṭhāśā chāḍi kara amānī hṛdoya

(7) A great soul who has all these qualities should not become proud of his saintly qualities, but, giving up position and prestige he should always remain prideless within his heart.

metadata.title: 3. Śrī-Kṛṣṇa-kīrtane jodi
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A great soul should not become proud of his saintly qualities and should remain humble within his heart.

text:
kṛṣṇa-adhiṣṭhān sarva-jīve jāni sadā
karabi sammāna sobe ādare sarvadā

(8) Always knowing that Krishna dwells within the hearts of all living beings, you should always properly respect and honour others.

metadata.title: 3. Śrī-Kṛṣṇa-kīrtane jodi
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The importance of respecting and honouring others, knowing that Krishna dwells within their hearts.

text:
doinya, dayā, anye mān, pratiṣṭhā-varjan
chāri guṇe guṇī hoi karaho kīrtan

(9) Humility, mercy, consideration of others, and giving up position are the four qualities needed to perform kīrtan.

metadata.title: 3. Śrī-Kṛṣṇa-kīrtane jodi
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Humility, mercy, consideration of others, and giving up position are the four qualities needed to perform kīrtan.

text:
bhakativinoda kā̐di bole prabhu-pāya
heno adhikāra kobe dibe he āmāya

(10) Bhakti Vinod, crying at the Lord’s holy feet says, “O my Lord, when will You bestow upon me the qualifications for Krishna-kīrtan?”

metadata.title: 3. Śrī-Kṛṣṇa-kīrtane jodi
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Bhakti Vinod asks the Lord when he will be qualified for Krishna-kirtan.

text:
-------------------------
Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam
yoga-pīṭhopari-sthita,    aṣṭa-sakhī-subeṣṭita,
vṛndāraṇye kadamba-kānane
rādhā-saha vaṁśī-dhārī, biśva-jana-chitta-hārī,
prāṇa mora tā̐hāra charaṇe

(1) At the yoga-pīṭha, surrounded by the aṣṭa-sakhīs, in Vṛndāvan Forest, in a grove of kadamba trees, by the side of Śrī Rādhā, holding His flute, Śrī Krishna enchants all souls within the universe. I fall at His feet and surrender my life to Him.

metadata.title: 8b. Yoga-pīṭhopari-sthita
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam is a song describing Śrī Krishna's enchanting pastimes in Vṛndāvan Forest.

text:
sakhī-ājñāmata kori do̐hāra sevana
pālya-dāsī sadā bhāvi do̐hāra charaṇa

(2) Following the orders of a sakhī, I engage in service to the holy pair, Śrī Rādhā and Krishna, always considering myself a dependent maidservant at Their lotus feet.

metadata.title: 8b. Yoga-pīṭhopari-sthita
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker considers themselves a dependent maidservant of Śrī Rādhā and Krishna, following the orders of a sakhī.

text:
kobhu kṛpā kori,    mama hasta dhori’,
madhura vachana bole
tāmbula loiyā,    khāya dui jone,
mālā loya kutūhole

(3) Sometimes being kind, They take me by the hand and speak sweet words to me out of affection. Taking the betel nuts I have prepared, the two of Them eat and accept a garland from me with great delight.

metadata.title: 8b. Yoga-pīṭhopari-sthita
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Caitanya Mahāprabhu and Nityānanda Prabhu engage in affectionate pastimes with the speaker.

text:
adarśana hoya kokhona ki chole
nā dekhiyā do̐he hiyā mora jvole

(4) Again, They disappear from my vision by some trick. Not seeing Rādhā and Krishna, my heart burns in agony.

metadata.title: 8b. Yoga-pīṭhopari-sthita
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker's heart burns with longing for Rādhā and Krishna.

text:
jekhāne sekhāne,    thākuka du’ jane,
āmi to charaṇa-dāsī
milane ānanda,    virahe jātanā,
sakala sammāna vāsi

(5) Here or there, wherever They stay, I am the maidservant of Their lotus feet. Through the happiness of union and the agony of separation, I am Their maidservant.

metadata.title: 8b. Yoga-pīṭhopari-sthita
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker is a maidservant of Kṛṣṇa's lotus feet, experiencing union and separation.

text:
rādhā-kṛṣṇa prāṇa mor jīvane maraṇe
more rākhi’ māri’ sukhe thākuka du’ jone

(6) Rādhā and Krishna are my life and soul in life and in death; whether They protect me or take my life—may they always be happy.

metadata.title: 8b. Yoga-pīṭhopari-sthita
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee expresses their devotion to Rādhā and Krishna, considering them essential in life and death.

text:
bhakativinoda,    āna nāhi jāne,
poḍi’ nija-sakhī-pāy
rādhikāra goṇe    thākiyā satata,
jugala-charaṇa chāy

(7) Bhakti Vinod knows nothing else. Falling at the feet of the sakhī, Bhakti Vinod stays among the intimate confidants of Śrī Rādhā. The lotus feet of Śrī Rādhā and Krishna is Bhakti Vinod’s eternal desire.
Footnote to Song 8b: Śrīla Śrīdhar Mahārāja advised not to sing this song because it’s “too high.”

metadata.title: 8b. Yoga-pīṭhopari-sthita
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Bhakti Vinod's eternal desire is to stay among the intimate confidants of Śrī Rādhā and have the lotus feet of Śrī Rādhā and Krishna as his constant companions.

text:
-------------------
Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam
sakhi go kemote dhoribo parāṇ
nimeṣa hoilo jugera samān

(1) Oh my dear girlfriend! How will I  maintain my life? The passing of a mere moment has become like a vast age of time.

metadata.title: 7c. Sakhī go kemote
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam is a song by Rūpa Goswami describing the divine pastimes of Kṛṣṇa and Radha.

text:
śrāvaṇera dhārā,    ā̐khi-bariṣoy,
śūnya bhelo dharā-tala
govinda-virahe,    prāṇa nāhi rohe,
kemone bā̐chibo bolo

(2) Tears flow from my eyes like torrents of rain in the month of Śrāvaṇa, and the face of the earth has become totally void. In separation from Govinda my life cannot go on... please, tell how I will be able to live.

metadata.title: 7c. Sakhī go kemote
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker is overcome with grief due to separation from Govinda and asks how they will be able to live.

text:
bhakativinoda,    asthira hoiyā,
punaḥ nāmāśroya kori’
ḍāke rādhānātha,    diyā daraśana,
prāṇa rākho, nahe mori

(3) Bhakti Vinod has become very restless and again takes shelter of the holy name, calling out, “Oh Lord of Rādhā! By bestowing Your audience, please save my life! By Your mercy alone I shall not perish!”
Footnote to verse 1: Śrīla Śrīdhar Mahārāja advised not to sing ‘sakhi go’ but ‘bandhu he’ instead.

metadata.title: 7c. Sakhī go kemote
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Bhakti Vinod takes shelter of the holy name and prays to Rādhānātha for salvation.

text:
-------------------
Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam

(1) The first verse of the Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam is as follows:

metadata.title: 1. Pita-varaṇa kali
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam is a scripture.

text:
cheto-darpaṇa-mārjanaṁ
bhava-mahā-dāvāgni-nirvāpaṇaṁ
śreyaḥ-kairava-chandrikā-
vitaraṇaṁ vidyā-vadhu-jīvanaṁ
ānandāmbudhi-vardhanaṁ
prati-padaṁ pūrṇāmṛtāsvādanaṁ
sarvātma-snapanaṁ paraṁ
vijayate śrī-kṛṣṇa-saṅkīrtanam

(2) The Holy Name of Krishna cleanses the mirror of the heart and extinguishes the fire of misery in the forest of birth and death. As the evening lotus blooms in the moon’s cooling rays, the heart begins to blossom in the nectar of the Name.
And at last the soul awakens to its real inner treasure — a life of love with Krishna. Again and again tasting nectar, the soul dives and surfaces in the ever-increasing ocean of ecstatic joy.
All phases of the self of which we may conceive are fully satisfied and purified, and at last conquered by the all-auspicious influence of the Holy Name of Krishna.

metadata.title: 1. Pita-varaṇa kali
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The Holy Name of Krishna cleanses the heart and extinguishes the fire of misery, leading to a life of love and ecstatic joy.

text:
pīta-varaṇa kali-pāvana gorā
gāoyāi aichana bhāva-bibhorā

(3) Lord Gaurāṅga, whose complexion is golden and who is the deliverer of the fallen souls of Kali-yuga, sings as follows, overwhelmed with spiritual ecstasy.

metadata.title: 1. Pita-varaṇa kali
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Lord Gaurāṅga sings with spiritual ecstasy.

text:
chitta-darpaṇa-parimārjana-kārī
kṛṣṇa-kīrtana jaya chitta-bihārī

(4) “All glories to the chanting of the Holy Name of Krishna! It thoroughly cleanses the mirror of the heart and is the delight of the soul.”

metadata.title: 1. Pita-varaṇa kali
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song praising the cleansing power of Krishna's Holy Name.

text:
helā-bhava-dāva-nirvāpaṇa-vṛtti
kṛṣṇa-kīrtana jaya kleśa-nivṛtti

(5) “All glories to the chanting of the Holy Name of Krishna! It extinguishes the forest fire of material existence and removes all material tribulations.”

metadata.title: 1. Pita-varaṇa kali
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song praising the chanting of Krishna's Holy Name.

text:
śreyaḥ-kumuda-bidhu-jyotsnā-prakāśa
kṛṣṇa-kīrtana jaya bhakti-vilāsa

(6) “All glories to the chanting of the Holy Name of Krishna! It appears like the moon in the heart and distributes its cooling moonlight, making the white lotus of the soul’s good fortune blossom and bloom. Krishna-kīrtan is the bhakti-vilāsa, the beautiful pastime of devotion.”

metadata.title: 1. Pita-varaṇa kali
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The chanting of the Holy Name of Krishna is a beautiful pastime of devotion that brings spiritual growth and blossoms the soul's good fortune.

text:
viśuddha-vidyā-vadhu jīvana-rūpa
kṛṣṇa-kīrtana jaya siddha-svarūpa

(7) “All glories to the chanting of the Holy Name of Krishna! It reveals one’s pure identity in relationship with the Lord even up to divine consorthood. This chanting is the real perfection of life.”

metadata.title: 1. Pita-varaṇa kali
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The chanting of the Holy Name of Krishna reveals one's pure identity in relationship with the Lord.

text:
ānanda-payo-nidhi-vardhana-kīrti
kṛṣṇa-kīrtana jaya plābana-mūrti

(8) “All glories to the chanting of the Holy Name of Krishna! Krishna-kīrtan causes the ocean of ecstatic joy to overflow. It is an inundation of divine love.”

metadata.title: 1. Pita-varaṇa kali
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The text praises the chanting of Krishna's Holy Name, describing it as causing an overflow of ecstatic joy and divine love.

text:
pade pade pījuṣa-svāda-pradātā
kṛṣṇa-kīrtana jaya prema-bidhātā

(9) “All glories to the chanting of the Holy Name of Krishna! Krishna-kīrtan gives one a taste of fully satisfying nectar at every step; ultimately it bestows ecstatic love of Godhead.”

metadata.title: 1. Pita-varaṇa kali
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Krishna-kīrtan gives one a taste of fully satisfying nectar at every step and bestows ecstatic love of Godhead.

text:
bhakativinoda-svātma-snapana-vidhān
kṛṣṇa-kīrtana jaya prema-nidān

(10) “All glories to the chanting of the Holy Name of Krishna! It bathes the soul of Bhakti Vinod. This chanting is a storehouse of love of Godhead.”

metadata.title: 1. Pita-varaṇa kali
metadata.author: Unknown
