metadata.summary: A song praising the chanting of Krishna's Holy Name and its effect on Bhakti Vinod.

text:
---------------------
Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam

(1) The fifth verse of the Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam is as follows:

metadata.title: 5. Anādi karama phole
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The fifth verse of the Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam is described.

text:
ayi nanda-tanuja kiṅkaraṁ
patitaṁ māṁ viṣame bhavāmbudhau
kṛpayā tava pāda-paṅkaja-
sthita-dhūli-sadṛśaṁ vichintaya

(2) “Oh son of Nanda Mahārāj, I am Your eternal servant, yet because of my own karma, I have fallen into this terrible ocean of birth and death. Please accept this fallen soul and consider me a particle of dust at Your holy lotus feet.”

metadata.title: 5. Anādi karama phole
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee prays to Kṛṣṇa for mercy, acknowledging his fallen state and seeking shelter at the Lord's lotus feet.

text:
anādi karama-phole,    poḍi bhavārṇava-jole,
toribāre nā dekhi upāy,
e-viṣoya-holāhole,    divā-niśi hiyā jvole,
mon kobhu sukha nāhi pāy

(3) As a result of my selfish fruitive activities, which are without beginning, I have fallen into the ocean of material existence. And now I can see no means of deliverance. Day and night my heart burns from the vicious poison of these worldly affairs, and due to this my mind never finds any true happiness.

metadata.title: 5. Anādi karama phole
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker describes their suffering in the material world due to their selfish activities.

text:
āśā-pāśa-śata-śata    kleśa deya abirata,
pravṛti-ūrmira tāhe khelā
kāma-krodha-ādi choy,    bāṭapāḍe dey bhoy,
abasāna hoilo āsi belā

(4) I am bound by hundreds and hundreds of desires that give unending distress and these desires play in the waves of ever-increasing materialistic tendency. Lust, anger, greed, pride, illusion and envy are like six highway robbers making me greatly fearful, and in this way my life is coming to an end.

metadata.title: 5. Anādi karama phole
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker is bound by numerous desires that bring distress and are fueled by materialistic tendencies, leading to fear and a sense of impending doom.

text:
jñāna-karma—ṭhāga dui,    more pratāriyā loi,
avaśeṣe phele sindhu-jole
e heno somoye, bandhu,    tumi kṛṣṇa kṛpā-sindhu
kṛpā kori’ tolo more bole

(5) The two highway robbers named intellectual knowledge and fruitive activity have cheated and misled me, and finally they have thrown me into the ocean of misery. At such a time as this, dear Krishna, You are my only friend. You are an ocean of mercy. Please be kind upon me and uplift me from this condition of suffering by Your divine power.

metadata.title: 5. Anādi karama phole
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee prays to Kṛṣṇa for mercy and deliverance from the ocean of misery.

text:
patita-kiṅkore dhori’,    pāda-padma-dhūli kori’,
deho bhaktivinode āśroy
āmi tava nitya-dās    bhuliyā māyāra pāś,
baddha ho’ye āchi dayāmoy

(6) I am Your eternal servant, Oh merciful Lord. But, having forgotten this since time immemorial, I have become bound up in this network of illusion. Take this fallen servant of Yours, give him a place in the dust of Your lotus feet; give your shelter to this humble Bhakti Vinod.

metadata.title: 5. Anādi karama phole
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Bhaktivinode Thakur expresses his devotion to Kṛṣṇa and asks for his shelter.

text:
----------------------
Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam

(1) The sixth verse of the Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam is as follows:

metadata.title: 6. Aparādha-phole mama
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The sixth verse of the Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam is described.

text:
nayanaṁ galad-aśru-dhārayā
vadanaṁ gadgada-ruddhayā girā
pulakair nichitaṁ vapuḥ kadā
tava nāma-grahaṇe bhaviṣyati

(2) “Oh Lord, when will tears flow from my eyes like waves, And my voice tremble in ecstasy? When will the hairs of my body stand on end while chanting Your Holy Name?”

metadata.title: 6. Aparādha-phole mama
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee expresses longing to experience spiritual ecstasy while chanting the Lord's name.

text:
aparādha-phole mama    chitta bhela vajra sama
tuyā nāme nā lobhe bikāra
hatāś hoiya hari    tava nāma ucha kori
boḍo duḥkhe ḍāki bāro bāro

(3) Oh Lord Hari, asa result of my offences incurred in previous lifetimes, my heart has become as hard as a thunderbolt, and feels no change upon chanting Your Holy Name. Disappointed, hopeless, and in great distress, I loudly call Your Name again and again.

metadata.title: 6. Aparādha-phole mama
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee laments their hardened heart due to past offenses and calls out to Lord Hari for relief.

text:
dīna dayāmoy karuṇā-nidān
bhāva-bindu dei rākhoho parāṇ

(4) Oh Lord, you are compassionate towards the fallen souls and the origin of mercy. Please give me a drop of divine ecstasy and thereby save my life!

metadata.title: 6. Aparādha-phole mama
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee requests the Lord for divine ecstasy to save his life.

text:
kobe tuyā nāma-uchāraṇe mor
nayane jharabo daro daro lor

(5) When will an incessant stream of tears flow from my eyes as I chant Your Name in divine ecstasy?

metadata.title: 6. Aparādha-phole mama
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee expresses longing to chant Kṛṣṇa's name in ecstasy.

text:
gada-gada-svara kaṇṭhe upajabo
mukhe bolo ādha ādha bāhirābo

(6) When will my voice be choked with divine emotion, and when will words garbled due to ecstasy come from my mouth?

metadata.title: 6. Aparādha-phole mama
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker longs for a state of divine emotion and ecstasy.

text:
pulake bharabo śorīra hāmāra
sveda-kampa-stambha hobe bāro bāro

(7) When will the hairs of my body stand up in ecstasy? When will I become stunned with ecstasy, shiver and perspire out of the ecstasy of divine love? When will these symptoms of ecstasy overwhelm me again and again?

metadata.title: 6. Aparādha-phole mama
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee longs for the experience of divine love and its symptoms of ecstasy.

text:
bibarṇa-śorīre hārāobu̐ jñāna
nāma-samāśraye dharobu parāṇa

(8) When will my body turn colours and become pale out of ecstasy? When will I lose consciousness? And when will my very life be under the shelter of the Holy Name?

metadata.title: 6. Aparādha-phole mama
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker longs for spiritual ecstasy and the shelter of the Holy Name.

text:
milabo hāmār kiye aiche dina
roye bhakativinoda mati hīna

(9) Bhakti Vinod, who is devoid of good intelligence cries, “When will I meet with such a day?”

metadata.title: 6. Aparādha-phole mama
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Bhakti Vinod expresses his longing to meet a special day.

text:
--------------------
Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam

(1) The seventh verse of the Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam is as follows:

metadata.title: 7a. Gāite gāite nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The seventh verse of the Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam scripture.

text:
yugāyitaṁ nimeṣeṇa
chakṣuṣā prāvṛṣāyitaṁ
śūnyāyitaṁ jagat sarvaṁ
govinda-viraheṇa me

(2) “Oh Govinda! Without You, the world is empty. Tears are flooding my eyes like rain, and a moment seems like forever.”

metadata.title: 7a. Gāite gāite nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee expresses longing for Govinda, feeling the world is empty without Him.

text:
gāite gāite nāma ki dośā hoilo
‘kṛṣṇa-nitya-dāsa mui’ hṛdoye sphurilo

(3) Chanting the Name again and again, what was my condition? Within my heart I realised, “I am an eternal servant of Krishna.”

metadata.title: 7a. Gāite gāite nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker realises their eternal servitude to Krishna through chanting the Name.

text:
jānilām māyā-pāśe e jaḍa-jagate
govinda-virahe duḥkha pāi nānā-mate

(4) I realised that I was bound by Māyā’s ropes, in this dull mundane universe, and I simply experience misery in various ways due to separation from Lord Govinda.

metadata.title: 7a. Gāite gāite nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker feels miserable due to separation from Lord Govinda.

text:
āro je saṁsāra mora nāhi lāge bhālo
kā̐hā jāi kṛṣṇa heri e chintā biśālo

(5) And I don’t much like this world of birth and death. Where shall I go to see Krishna? This was my biggest worry.

metadata.title: 7a. Gāite gāite nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker expresses a desire to see Kṛṣṇa and is worried about their current situation in the world.

text:
kā̐dite kā̐dite mora ā̐khi-boriṣoya
barṣā-dhārā heno chakṣe hoilo udoya

(6) I began weeping and weeping; my tears fell. Torrents of rain poured from my eyes just like the rains of the monsoon season.

metadata.title: 7a. Gāite gāite nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker is overcome with emotion, comparing their tears to the monsoon rains.

text:
nimeṣa hoilo mora śata-juga-sam
govinda-viraha āra sohite akṣam

(7) Now, a moment for me is like a hundred ages. I cannot bear this separation from Lord Govinda.

metadata.title: 7a. Gāite gāite nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker is overcome with longing for Lord Govinda.

text:
śūnya dharā-tala,    chaudike dekhiye,
parāṇa udāsa hoya
ki kori, ki kori,    sthira nāhi hoya,
jīvana nāhiko roya

(8) The world is empty; as I survey the four directions, the entire surface of the world is void. My life is empty, my mind is listless; I am indifferent and apathetic towards everything. Depressed, melancholy and forlorn, my life has no meaning now. What do I do now? I cannot remain steady. I can no longer maintain my life.

metadata.title: 7a. Gāite gāite nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker feels empty and listless, with no meaning in life.

text:
vraja-vāsi-gaṇa    mora prāṇa rākho
dekhāo śrī-rādhā-nāthe
bhakativinoda-    minati māniyā,
laohe tāhāre sāthe

(9) Oh residents of Vṛndāvan; save my life and show me Rādhānāth, the Lord of Śrī Rādhā. Considering this humble prayer of Bhakti Vinod, please give him Your association and take him with You.

metadata.title: 7a. Gāite gāite nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Bhakti Vinod prays to Śrī Rādhānāth to grant him association.

text:
śrī kṛṣṇa-viraha āro sohite nā pāri
parāṇa chāḍite āro din dui chāri

(10) I am unable to further tolerate this separation from my Lord Krishna and am ready to give up my life in two days or four.

metadata.title: 7a. Gāite gāite nāma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee expresses their intense longing for Kṛṣṇa and willingness to give up their life in separation from Him.

text:
-----------------------
Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam
gāite ‘govinda’-nām,    upajilo bhāva-grām,
dekhilām yamunāra kūle
vṛṣabhānu-sutā-saṅge,    śyāma-naṭa-boro-raṅge,
bā̐śarī bājāya nīpo-mūle

(1) And while I sang the name of Govinda a host of ecstasies arose within me. I saw Sundar-śyāma the best of dancers, on Yamunā’s shores, with Śrī Rādhā, Vṛṣabhānu’s daughter, sporting in Pastimes of love playing His flute beside the water while a kadamba tree above cast shade upon the divine couple.

metadata.title: 7b. Gāite ‘govinda’–nām
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The text describes a scene from the divine pastimes of Kṛṣṇa with Śrī Rādhā on Yamunā’s shores.

text:
dekhiyā jugala-dhana,    asthira hoilo mana,
jñāna hārā hoilu̐ tokhon
koto-kṣane nāhi jāni,    jñāna-labha hoilo māni,
āro nāhi bhelo daraśan

(2) On seeing this, my mind was stunned. I lost my senses. Unaware of time, I fainted. When I awoke after immeasurable time, the treasured couple had gone. My vision of Vraja had broken.

metadata.title: 7b. Gāite ‘govinda’–nām
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker's mind was stunned after seeing the divine couple, and they lost consciousness, only to wake up and find that the couple had left.

text:
-------------------
Śrī Bhog Ārati Gīti
bhaja bhakata-vatsala śrī-gaurahari
śrī-gaurahari sohi goṣṭha-bihārī,
nanda-jaśomatī-chitta-hārī

(1) Just  worship  Śrī  Gaurahari,  who  is  always affectionate toward His devotees. He is the same Supreme Godhead, Krishna, who sported in the cowherd pastures of Vraja and stole the hearts of Nanda and Yaśodā.

metadata.title: Śrī Bhog Ārati Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song encouraging worship of Śrī Gaurahari, the Supreme Godhead who sported in Vraja.

text:
belā ho’lo, dāmodara, āisa ekhano
bhoga-mandire bosi’ koraho bhojana

(2) Mother Yaśodā calls to Krishna, “My dear Dāmodar, it is very late. Please come right now, sit down in the dining hall, and take your lunch.”

metadata.title: Śrī Bhog Ārati Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Mother Yaśodā calls Krishna to take his lunch in the dining hall.

text:
nandera nirdeśe baise giri-vara-dhārī
baladeva-saha sakhā baise sāri sāri

(3) On the direction of Nanda Mahārāj, Krishna, the holder of Govardhan Hill, sits down, and then all the cowherd boys, along with Krishna’s elder brother, Śrī Baladeva, sit down in rows to take their lunch.

metadata.title: Śrī Bhog Ārati Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Krishna and the cowherd boys sit down to take their lunch under the direction of Nanda Mahārāj.

text:
śuktā-śākādi bhāji nālitā kuṣmāṇḍa
ḍāli ḍālnā dugdha-tumbī dadhi mochā-ghaṇṭa

(4) They are then served a feast of śuktā and various kinds of green leafy vegetables, then nice fried things, and a salad made of the green leaves of the jute plant. They are also served pumpkin, baskets of fruit, small square cakes made of lentils and cooked down milk, then thick yogurt, squash cooked in milk, and vegetable preparations made from the flower of the banana tree.

metadata.title: Śrī Bhog Ārati Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A description of a feast served to Kṛṣṇa and His associates.

text:
mudga-boḍā māṣa-boḍā roṭikā ghṛtānna
śaṣkulī piṣṭaka kṣīr puli pāyasānna

(5) Then they receive fried squares of mung dal patties, and urad dal patties, chapātīs, and rice with ghee. Next, sweets made with milk, sugar, and sesamum; rice flour cakes; thick cooked-down milk; cakes floating in milk; and sweet rice.

metadata.title: Śrī Bhog Ārati Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Kṛṣṇa is served various dishes by his mother Yasodā in the prison cell.

text:
karpūra amṛta–kelī rambhā kṣīra-sāra
amṛta rasālā, amla dvādaśa prakāra

(6) There is also sweet rice that tastes just like nectar due to its being mixed with camphor. There are bananas, and cheese which is nectarean and delicious. They are also served twelve kinds of sour preparations made with tamarinds, limes, lemons, oranges, and pomegranates.

metadata.title: Śrī Bhog Ārati Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A description of various sweet and sour preparations served in a feast.

text:
luchi chini sarapurī lāḍḍu rasāvalī
bhojana korena kṛṣṇa ho’ye kutūhalī

(7) There are purīs made with white flour and sugar; purīs filled with cream; laḍḍus; and dal patties boiled in sugared rice. Krishna eagerly eats all of the food.

metadata.title: Śrī Bhog Ārati Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Krishna eagerly eats a variety of sweets and dishes.

text:
rādhikāra pakka anna vividha vyañjana
parama ānande kṛṣṇa korena bhojana

(8) In great ecstasy and joy Krishna eats the rice, curried  vegetables,  sweets,  and  pastries  cooked  by Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī.

metadata.title: Śrī Bhog Ārati Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Kṛṣṇa eats a meal prepared by Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī in great ecstasy and joy.

text:
chole-bole lāḍḍu khāy śrī-madhumaṅgala
bagala bājāy āra deya hari-bolo

(9) Krishna’s funny brāhmaṇ friend Madhumaṅgal, who is very fond of laḍḍus, gets them by hook or by crook. Eating the laḍḍus he shouts, “Haribol! Haribol!” and makes a funny sound by slapping his sides under his armpits with his hands.

metadata.title: Śrī Bhog Ārati Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Krishna's friend Madhumaṅgal gets laḍḍus and shouts 'Haribol!' while making a funny sound.

text:
rādhikādi gaṇe heri’ nayanera koṇe
tṛpta ho’ye khāy kṛṣṇa yaśodā-bhavane

(10) Beholding Rādhārāṇī and Her gopī friends out of the corners of His eyes, Krishna eats at the house of Mother Yaśodā with great satisfaction.

metadata.title: Śrī Bhog Ārati Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Kṛṣṇa eats at the house of Mother Yaśodā while glancing at Rādhārāṇī and Her friends.

text:
bhojanānte piye kṛṣṇa suvāsita vāri
sabe mukha prakṣāloy ho’ye sāri sāri

(11) After lunch, Krishna drinks rose-scented water. Then all of the boys, standing in lines, wash their mouths.

metadata.title: Śrī Bhog Ārati Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: After lunch, Krishna drinks rose-scented water and the boys wash their mouths.

text:
hasta-mukha prakṣāliyā jata sakhā-gaṇe
ānande viśrāma kore baladeva-sane

(12) After all the cowherd boys wash their hands and mouths, in great bliss they take rest with Lord Balarām.

metadata.title: Śrī Bhog Ārati Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The cowherd boys take rest with Lord Balarām after washing their hands and mouths.

text:
jāmbula rasāla āne tāmbūla-maśālā
tāhā kheye kṛṣṇa-chandra sukhe nidrā gelā

(13) The two cowherd boys Jāmbula and Rasāla then bring Krishna pān made with betel nuts, fancy spices, and catechu. After eating that pān, Śrī Krishnachandra then happily goes to sleep.

metadata.title: Śrī Bhog Ārati Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Krishna is given pān by Jāmbula and Rasāla and then goes to sleep.

text:
viśālākṣa śikhi-pucha-chāmara ḍhulāya
apūrva śayāya kṛṣṇa sukhe nidrā jāya

(14) While  Krishna  happily  takes  His  rest  on  an excellent bedstead, His servant Viśālākṣa cools Him with a fan of peacock feathers.

metadata.title: Śrī Bhog Ārati Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Viśālākṣa cools Kṛṣṇa with a fan of peacock feathers as He rests on an excellent bedstead.

text:
jaśomatī-ājñā peye dhaniṣṭhā-ānito
śrī-kṛṣṇa-prasāda rādhā bhuñje hoye prīto

(15) At Mother Yaśodā’s request the gopī Dhaniṣṭhā brings remnants of food left on Krishna’s plate to Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī, who eats them with great delight.

metadata.title: Śrī Bhog Ārati Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Dhaniṣṭhā brings Krishna's food remnants to Rādhārāṇī at Yaśodā's request.

text:
lalitādi sakhī-gaṇa avaśeṣa pāya
mane mane sukhe rādhā-kṛṣṇa-guṇa gāya

(16) Lalitā-devī and the other gopīs then receive the remnants, and within their hearts they sing the glories of Rādhārāṇī and Krishna with great joy.

metadata.title: Śrī Bhog Ārati Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Lalitā-devī and the other gopīs sing the glories of Rādhārāṇī and Krishna with great joy.

text:
hari-līlā ek-mātra jāhāra pramoda
bhogārati gāy ṭhākur bhakativinoda

(17) Ṭhākur Bhakti Vinod, whose one and only joy is the Pastimes of Lord Hari, sings this Bhog Ārati song.

metadata.title: Śrī Bhog Ārati Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Ṭhākur Bhakti Vinod sings the Bhog Ārati song, which is about the Pastimes of Lord Hari.

text:
-----------------------
Śrī Prasāda-sevāya Gīti
bhāi-re!
śorīra avidyā-jāl,    joḍendriya tāhe kāl,
jīve phele viṣaya-sāgore
tā’ra madhye jihvā ati,    lobhamoy sudurmati,
tā’ke jetā koṭhina saṁsāre

(1) Oh brothers! This material body is a network of ignorance, and the senses are one’s deadly enemies, for they throw the soul into the ocean of material sense enjoyment. Among the senses, the tongue is the most voracious and verily wicked; it is very difficult to conquer the tongue in this world.

metadata.title: Śrī Prasāda-sevāya Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The song describes the material body as a network of ignorance and the senses as deadly enemies, with the tongue being the most voracious and wicked sense.

text:
kṛṣṇa boḍo dayāmoy,    koribāre jihvā jay,
sva-prasād-anna dilo bhāi
sei annāmṛta pāo,    rādhā-kṛṣṇa-guṇa gāo,
preme ḍāko chaitanya-nitāi

(2) Oh brothers! Lord Krishna is very merciful—just to control the tongue He has given us the remnants of His own food! Now please eat these nectarean grains while singing the glories of Their Lordships Śrī Śrī RādhāKrishna, and in love call out Chaitanya! Nitāi!

metadata.title: Śrī Prasāda-sevāya Gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotional song encouraging devotees to eat prasadam and sing the glories of Rādhā-Kṛṣṇa.

text:
-----------
Mahāprasāda
mahāprasāde govinde nāma brahmaṇi vaiṣṇave
svalpa pūṇya vatāṁ rājan viśvāso naiva jāyate

(1) For those who have not amassed sufficient pious credits they will never be able to honour Mahāprasāda, Lord Govinda, the Holy Name, the brāhmaṇs and the Vaiṣṇavas.

metadata.title: Mahāprasāda
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Those who have not amassed sufficient pious credits will never be able to honour Mahāprasāda and other sacred entities.

text:
---------------------
Ṭhākura-vaiṣṇava-pada
ṭhākura-vaiṣṇava-pada,    avanīra susampada,
śuno bhāi! hoiya eka mana
āśroya loiyā bhaje,    tāre kṛṣṇa nāhi tyaje
āro saba more akāraṇa

(1) O brother, hear my words with rapt attention: The lotus feet of the Vaiṣṇavas are the most valuable treasure in the world. Take shelter of those Vaiṣṇavas, and worship them. Krishna cannot abandon one who worships Him in this way. All others meet a meaningless death.

metadata.title: Ṭhākura-vaiṣṇava-pada
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The song emphasizes the importance of taking shelter of and worshiping Vaiṣṇavas, as Krishna will not abandon one who does so.

text:
vaiṣṇava-charaṇa-jol,    prema-bhakti dite bol,
āro keho nahe balavanta
vaiṣṇava-charaṇa-renu,    mastake bhūṣaṇa vinu
āra nāhi bhūṣaṇera anta

(2) The water which has washed the lotus feet of the Vaiṣṇavas bestows devotional service in pure love of Godhead. There is nothing as effective in attaining this divine love. I place the dust from the lotus feet of the Vaiṣṇavas upon my head. I wear no other ornament.

metadata.title: Ṭhākura-vaiṣṇava-pada
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The text describes the importance of devotional service in pure love of Godhead and the value of the dust from the lotus feet of the Vaiṣṇavas.

text:
tīrthajol-pavitra-guṇe,    likhiyāche purāṇe,
se saba bhaktira pravañchana
vaiṣṇavera pādadoka,    sama nahe ei saba,
jāte hoya vāñchito pūraṇa

(3) The purifying power of the waters of the various places of pilgrimage is described in the Purāṇas, although this is something of a deceptive trick. Actually there is nothing which is as purifying as the water which has washed the lotus feet of the Vaiṣṇavas. This water fulfills all desires.

metadata.title: Ṭhākura-vaiṣṇava-pada
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The purifying power of the waters of pilgrimage is described in the Purāṇas, but nothing is as purifying as the water that has washed the Vaiṣṇavas' feet.

text:
vaiṣṇava-saṅgete mana, ānandita anukṣaṇa,
sadā hoy kṛṣṇa-parasaṅga
dīna narottama kā̐de, hiyā dhairja nāhi bāndhe,
mora dośā keno hoilo bhaṅga

(4) Moment by moment my mind finds constant pleasure in the association of the Vaiṣṇavas. I always seek the company of the devotees of Lord Krishna. Poor-hearted Narottam Dās cries, “I cannot maintain my composure any longer. Why have I fallen into such a low condition of life that I cannot get the association of the Vaiṣṇavas?”

metadata.title: Ṭhākura-vaiṣṇava-pada
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Narottama Dās expresses his longing for the association of Vaiṣṇavas and the company of Lord Krishna.

text:
----------------
Mānasa Deho Geho
mānasa, deho, geho, jo kichū mora
arpilu̐ tuyā pade, nanda-kiśora!

(1) Mind, body, and family, whatever may be mine, I have surrendered at Your lotus feet, O youthful son of Nanda!

metadata.title: Mānasa Deho Geho
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee surrenders their mind, body, and family to Kṛṣṇa.

text:
sampade vipade, jīvane-maraṇe
dāy mama gelā, tuyā o-pada varaṇe

(2) In good fortune or in bad, in life or at death, all my difficulties have disappeared by choosing those feet of Yours as my only shelter.

metadata.title: Mānasa Deho Geho
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee takes shelter in Kṛṣṇa's feet in all circumstances.

text:
mārobi rākhobi—jo ichā tohārā
nitya-dāsa prati tuyā adhikārā

(3) Slay me or protect me as You wish, for You are the master of Your eternal servant.

metadata.title: Mānasa Deho Geho
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Nitya-dāsa expresses devotion to Kṛṣṇa, surrendering to His will.

text:
janmāobi moye ichā jadi tora
bhakta-gṛhe jani janma hau mora

(4) If it is Your will that I be born again, then may it be in the home of Your devotee.

metadata.title: Mānasa Deho Geho
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee prays to be reborn in the home of a devotee if it is Kṛṣṇa's will.

text:
kīṭa-janma hau yathā tuyā dāsa
bahir-mukha brahma-janme nāhi āśa

(5) May I be born again even as a worm, as long as I may remain Your devotee. I have no desire to be born as a Brahmā averse to You.

metadata.title: Mānasa Deho Geho
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker expresses a desire to remain a devotee of Kṛṣṇa even in future births.

text:
bhukti-mukti-spṛhā bihīna je bhakta
labhaite tā̐ka saṅga anurakta

(6) I yearn for the company of the devotee completely devoid of all desire for worldly enjoyment or liberation.

metadata.title: Mānasa Deho Geho
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker yearns for the company of a devotee who has no desire for worldly enjoyment or liberation.

text:
janaka, jananī, doyita, tanoy
prabhu, guru, pati—tuhu̐ sarva-moy

(7) Father, mother, lover, son, Lord, preceptor, and husband — You are everything to me.

metadata.title: Mānasa Deho Geho
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee addresses Kṛṣṇa as the embodiment of various relationships.

text:
bhakativinoda kohe, śuno kāna!
rādhā-nātha! tuhu̐ hāmāra parāṇa

(8) Bhakti Vinod says, “O Krishna, please hear me! Oh Lord of Rādhā, You are my life and soul!”

metadata.title: Mānasa Deho Geho
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Bhakti Vinod addresses Krishna as the Lord of Rādhā and his life and soul.

text:
--------------------
Tumi sarveśvareśvara
tumi sarveśvareśvara, vrajendra-kumāra!
tomāra ichāya viśve sṛjana saṁhāra

(1) O youthful son of the King of Vraja, You are the Lord of all lords. According to Your will, creation and destruction take place in the universe.

metadata.title: Tumi sarveśvareśvara
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A song describing Kṛṣṇa as the Lord of all lords and the creator and destroyer of the universe.

text:
tava ichā-mato brahmā korena sṛjana
tava ichā-mato viṣṇu korena pālana

(2) According to Your desire Lord Brahmā creates and according to Your desire Lord Viṣṇu maintains.

metadata.title: Tumi sarveśvareśvara
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: According to the Bhagavad-gita, Lord Brahmā creates and Lord Viṣṇu maintains the universe according to God's desire.

text:
tava ichā-mate śiva korena saṁhāra
tava ichā-mate māyā sṛje kārāgāra

(3) According to Your will Lord Śiva destroys, according to Your will Māyā constructs the prison house of this world.

metadata.title: Tumi sarveśvareśvara
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śiva and Māyā act according to Kṛṣṇa's will.

text:
tava ichā-mate jīver janama-maraṇa
samṛddhi-nipāta duḥkha sukha-saṅghaṭana

(4) According to Your will the living beings take birth and die, and according to Your will they meet with prosperity and ruin, happiness and sorrow.

metadata.title: Tumi sarveśvareśvara
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The living beings take birth and die according to Kṛṣṇa's will, and experience prosperity, ruin, happiness, and sorrow.

text:
miche māyā-baddha jīva āśā-pāśe phire
tava ichā vinā kichu korite nā pāre

(5) The tiny soul bound up by Māyā vainly struggles in the fetters of worldly desire. Without Your sanction the soul is unable to do anything.

metadata.title: Tumi sarveśvareśvara
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The soul is unable to act without the sanction of the Supreme Lord.

text:
tumi to’ rakṣaka āro pālaka āmāra
tomāra charaṇa vinā āśā nāhi āra

(6) You are my only protector and maintainer. Except for Your lotus feet there is no other hope for me.

metadata.title: Tumi sarveśvareśvara
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee expresses their hope and dependence on Kṛṣṇa's protection.

text:
nija-bala-cheṣṭa-prati bharasā chāḍiyā
tomāra ichāya āchi nirbhara koriyā

(7) No longer confident of my own strength and endeavour, I have become solely dependent on Your will.

metadata.title: Tumi sarveśvareśvara
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker has become dependent on Kṛṣṇa's will.

text:
bhakativinoda ati dīna akiñchana
tomāra ichāya tā’ra jīvana maraṇa

(8) Bhakti Vinod is most poor, and his pride has been leveled. Now in accordance with Your will he lives and dies.

metadata.title: Tumi sarveśvareśvara
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Bhakti Vinod's life and death are subject to Kṛṣṇa's will.

text:
-----------
Viraha-gīti
je ānilo prema-dhana karuṇā prachura
heno prabhu kothā gelā āchārya-ṭhākura

(1) That personality who delivered the treasure of prema-bhakti, who was so intense with compassion — where is such a personality to be found as Śrī Āchārya Ṭhākur (Śrīnivās Āchārya)?

metadata.title: Viraha-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A song inquiring about the whereabouts of Śrī Āchārya Ṭhākur, a personality known for delivering the treasure of prema-bhakti.

text:
kā̐hā mora svarūp rūpa kā̐hā sanātana
kā̐hā dāsa raghunātha patita-pāvana

(2) Where are the saviours of the fallen souls? Where is my Svarūp Dāmodar, and where are Rūpa Goswāmī and Sanātan Goswāmī? Where is Raghunāth Dās to be found?

metadata.title: Viraha-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee inquires about the whereabouts of several important figures in the Gaudiya Vaishnava tradition.

text:
kā̐hā mora bhaṭṭa-juga kā̐hā kavirāja
eka-kāle kothā gelā gaurā naṭa-rāja

(3) Where are my Raghunāth Bhaṭṭa and Gopāl Bhaṭṭa Goswāmīs? Where am I to find Śrī Krishnadās Kavirāj now? All at once they have gone to join Lord Gaurāṅga, the great dancer.

metadata.title: Viraha-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker laments the departure of his friends and associates to join Lord Gaurāṅga.

text:
pāṣāṇe kuṭibo māthā anale paśibo
gaurāṅga guṇera nidhi kothā gele pābo

(4) To reach such a perfect personality as Lord Chaitanya, I can only break my head against the stone in the anguish of separation.

metadata.title: Viraha-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker is longing to reach Lord Chaitanya and is willing to endure great separation to do so.

text:
se-saba saṅgīra saṅge je koilo vilāsa
se-saṅga nā pāyā kānde narottama dāsa

(5) They have all gone off together in their own Pastimes. Narottam Dās Ṭhākur says: “Unable to obtain their association, I must simply weep.”

metadata.title: Viraha-gīti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Narottam Dās Ṭhākur expresses his longing for the association of the Lord and His devotees.

text:
---------------------
Durlabha mānava-janma
durlabha mānava-janma labhiyā saṁsāre
kṛṣṇa nā bhajinu duḥka kohibo kāhāre?

(1) The human form of life is the rarest opportunity for attaining spiritual perfection. But now I am lamenting, because I’ve somehow or other been born with such an opportunity, and I wasted it by never worshiping Lord Krishna. Oh, to whom shall I tell the tale of this misery?

metadata.title: Durlabha mānava-janma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker laments wasting their human form by not worshiping Lord Krishna.

text:
‘saṁsār’ ‘saṁsār’, kori miche gelo kāl
lābha nā koilo kichu, ghaṭilo jañjāl

(2) Having married and entered into the entanglements of materialistic family life, I passed my time in vain. I never got any tangible gain or permanent benefit, only trouble and botheration.

metadata.title: Durlabha mānava-janma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker reflects on the futility of materialistic family life.

text:
kisera saṁsār ei chāyābāji prāy
ihāte mamatā kori vṛthā dina jāy

(3) What kind of world is this anyway? It seems to be just like a magic lantern show that I saw at a carnival, wherein so many shadows and optical illusions dance magically before my eyes. I feel great attachment and identification with such a world, and thus day after day passes by fruitlessly, without any purpose whatsoever.

metadata.title: Durlabha mānava-janma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker compares the world to a magic lantern show, highlighting its illusory nature and the futility of attachment to it.

text:
e deho patana ho’le ki robe āmār?
keho sukha nāhi dibe putra paribār

(4) When this body drops dead on the ground then what will remain mine? At that moment, all of my sons and dearest loved ones will not be able to give me any happiness.

metadata.title: Durlabha mānava-janma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker reflects on the impermanence of life and the transience of human relationships.

text:
gardabher mata āmi kori pariśram
kāra lāgi’ eto kori, nā ghuchilo bhram

(5) I work hard just like an ass every day, and now I am wondering for whom am I working so hard? I am still surrounded by so many illusions.

metadata.title: Durlabha mānava-janma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker feels they are working hard but still surrounded by illusions.

text:
dina jāy michā kāje, niśā nidrā-vaśe
nāhi bhāvi maraṇa nikaṭe āche bose

(6) I waste every day in useless, insignificant work, and I waste every night controlled by sleep. And in every twenty-four hours I never for one second consider that death is sitting very close by my side.

metadata.title: Durlabha mānava-janma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker reflects on how they waste their time and are unaware of death's proximity.

text:
bhālo manda khāi, heri, pari, chintā-hīna
nāhi bhāvi, e deho chāḍibo kon dina

(7) I live a very carefree life-style, eating, going out, wearing nice clothes as I please, but I never consider that one day I will have to give up this body.

metadata.title: Durlabha mānava-janma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker describes their carefree lifestyle, but neglects the fact that they will eventually have to give up their body.

text:
deho-geho-kalatrādi-chintā abirata
jāgiche hṛdoye mor buddhi kori hoto

(8) My poor heart is plagued by constant anxieties about the maintenance and daily turmoils created by my body, my house, my wife, my family members and my social obligations. All these anxieties are pinching me and destroying all my intelligence.

metadata.title: Durlabha mānava-janma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker's heart is troubled by worries about daily life and its responsibilities.

text:
hāy, hāy! nāhi bhāvi—anitya e saba
jīvana bigote kothā rohibe vaibhava?

(9) Alas, alas! What a remorseful situation has arisen! I am absorbed in all this trouble, but I never consider that all these things are temporary and subject to perish very soon. After I’m dead and gone, where will all of my material opulences remain?

metadata.title: Durlabha mānava-janma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker reflects on the impermanence of material possessions and the futility of accumulating wealth.

text:
śmaśāne śorīra mama poḍiyā rohibe
bihaṅga-pataṅga tāy bihāra koribe

(10) When my body will be thrown in the pit at the cremation grounds, it will simply lie there motionlessly. Then many crows, vultures, ants, and worms will come and playfully sport there.

metadata.title: Durlabha mānava-janma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Kṛṣṇa describes the scene of his own cremation after death.

text:
kukkur sṛgāl sob ānandita ho’ye
mahotsava koribe āmār deho lo’ye

(11) All the stray dogs and jackals will then become very much delighted, and in great ecstasy they will make a festival ground out of my body and will have a huge celebration and feast.

metadata.title: Durlabha mānava-janma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Kṛṣṇa describes how his devotees will celebrate after his body is offered to them.

text:
je deher ei gati, tāra anugata
saṁsār-vaibhava āro bondhu-jon jata

(12) Just see, this is the ultimate destination of this material body. And the most amazing thing is that all of my material opulences, house, family and friends have exactly the same destination.

metadata.title: Durlabha mānava-janma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The material body and its opulences ultimately share the same destination.

text:
ataeva māyā-moha chāḍi buddhimān
nitya-tattva kṛṣṇa-bhakti koruna sandhān

(13) Therefore I ask of anyone who has any sharp intelligence: please give up all of these temporary illusions presented by Māyā, and kindly search after the means to get pure devotion to Lord Krishna, for this is the only really tangible eternal truth.

metadata.title: Durlabha mānava-janma
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The text advises to give up temporary illusions and search for pure devotion to Lord Krishna.

text:
--------------
Ātma-samarpaṇe
ātma-samarpaṇe gelā abhimāna
nāhi karabu̐ nija rakṣā-vidhān

(1) Surrendering my soul unto You has lifted from me the burden of false pride. No longer will I try to provide for my own safety.

metadata.title: Ātma-samarpaṇe
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker renounces their ego and reliance on personal safety by surrendering to Kṛṣṇa.

text:
tuyā dhana jāni’ tuhu̐ rākhobi, nāth!
pālya godhana jāni kori’ tuyā sāth

(2) I know that You will give protection to Your treasured possessions, Oh Lord. I now understand the mentality of Your treasured cows safely maintained by Your side.

metadata.title: Ātma-samarpaṇe
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker understands the Lord's protection of His treasured possessions and the mentality of His treasured cows.

text:
charāobi mādhava! yamunā-tīre
baṁśī bājāoto ḍākobi dhīre

(3) When You lead Your herds to pasture, Oh Mādhava, on the banks of the Yamunā river, You will call to them by softly playing on Your flute.

metadata.title: Ātma-samarpaṇe
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A description of Kṛṣṇa's pastime of playing the flute to call his cows to pasture.

text:
agha-baka mārato rakṣā-vidhāna
karabi sadā tuhu̐ gokula-kāna!

(4) By slaying great demons such as Aghāsura and Bakāsura You will always provide full protection, Oh Kān of Gokul!

metadata.title: Ātma-samarpaṇe
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A prayer to Kān of Gokul for protection from demons.

text:
rakṣā karabi tuhu̐ niśchoy jāni
pāna karabu̐ hām jāmuna-pāni

(5) Fearless and confident of Your protection, I will drink the waters of the Yamunā.

metadata.title: Ātma-samarpaṇe
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee expresses confidence in Kṛṣṇa's protection and decides to drink the waters of the Yamunā.

text:
kālīya-dokha karabi vināśā
śodhobi nadī-jala, bāḍāobi āśā

(6) The Kālīya serpent’s venom poisoned the Yamunā’s waters, yet that poison will be vanquished. You will purify the Yamunā, and by such heroic deeds enhance our faith.

metadata.title: Ātma-samarpaṇe
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The Kālīya serpent’s venom will be vanquished by the Yamunā’s purification.

text:
piyato dāvānala rākhobi moy
‘gopāla’, ‘govinda’ nāma tava hoy

(7) You will surely protect me by swallowing the forest fire. Thus You are called Gopāl (protector of the cows) and Govinda (pleaser of the cows).

metadata.title: Ātma-samarpaṇe
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee addresses Kṛṣṇa as Gopāla and Govinda, referencing His protective and pleasing nature.

text:
sura-pati-durmati-nāśa vichāri’
rākhobe varṣaṇe, giri-vara-dhāri!

(8) In order to curb the malice of Indra, king of the demigods, You will protect me from his torrents of rain, Oh lifter of the mighty Govardhan Hill!

metadata.title: Ātma-samarpaṇe
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Kṛṣṇa is requested to protect the speaker from Indra's rain.

text:
chatur-ānana korabo jabo chori
rakṣā karabi meye, gokula-hari!

(9) When the four-headed Brahmā abducts me along with Your cowherd boyfriends and calves, then also You will surely protect me, Oh Gokul Hari!

metadata.title: Ātma-samarpaṇe
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee prays to Kṛṣṇa to protect him from Brahmā's abduction.

text:
bhakativinoda—tuyā gokula-dhan
rākhobi keśava! korato jatan

(10) Bhakti Vinod is now the property of Gokul, Your holy abode. Oh Keśava! Kindly protect him with gentle loving care.

metadata.title: Ātma-samarpaṇe
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Bhakti Vinod is being protected by Keśava with gentle loving care.

text:
------------
Vaiṣṇava Ke?
duṣṭa mana!    tumi kisera vaiṣṇava?
pratiṣṭhāra tore,    nirjanera ghore,
tava ‘harināma’ kevala ‘kaitava’

(1) Oh wicked mind! What kind of Vaiṣṇava do you think you are? Your pretentious show of chanting Lord Hari’s Holy Name in a solitary place is only for the sake of attaining the false prestige of a worldly reputation — it is nothing but pure hypocrisy.

metadata.title: Vaiṣṇava Ke?
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee criticizes a pretentious Vaiṣṇava for chanting the Lord's name for worldly reputation.

text:
jaḍera pratiṣṭhā,    śūkarer biṣṭhā,
jāno nā ki tāhā māyār vaibhava
kanaka kāminī,    divasa-jāminī,
bhāviyā ki kāja, anitya se saba

(2) Such materialistic prestige is as disgusting as the stool of a hog. Do you not know that it is only a mere illusion cast by the potency of Māyā? What is the value of contemplating day and night your plans for enjoying wealth and women? All these things are only temporary.

metadata.title: Vaiṣṇava Ke?
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Materialistic prestige is an illusion and contemplating wealth and women is temporary.

text:
tomāra kanaka,    bhogera janaka,
kanakera dvāre sevaho mādhava
kāminīr kāma,    nahe tava dhāma,
tāhār—mālika kevala jādava

(3) When you claim wealth as your own, it creates in you ever-increasing desires for material enjoyment. Your riches should be used for serving Mādhava, the Lord of all wealth. Neither is it your proper place to indulge in lust for women, whose only true proprietor is Lord Jādava.

metadata.title: Vaiṣṇava Ke?
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The text advises to use wealth for serving the Lord, not for indulging in material desires or lust.

text:
pratiṣṭhāśā-taru,    jaḍa-māyā-maru,
nā pela rāvaṇa jujhiyā rāghava
vaiṣṇavī pratiṣṭhā,    tāte kara niṣṭhā,
tāhā nā bhajile labhibe raurava

(4) The demon Rāvaṇa (lust-incarnate) fought with Lord Rāmachandra (love-incarnate) in order to gain the tree of worldly reputation — but that oasis turned out to be but a mirage cast in the desert wasteland of the Lord’s illusory material potency. Please cultivate fixed determination to attain only the steady and solid platform whereupon a Vaiṣṇava ever stands. If you neglect worshiping the Lord from this position, then you will ultimately attain a hellish existence.

metadata.title: Vaiṣṇava Ke?
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The text warns against the fleeting nature of worldly reputation and encourages the cultivation of a fixed determination to attain a steady and solid spiritual platform.

text:
harijana-dveṣa,    pratisthāśā-kleśa,
kara keno tobe tāhāra gaurava
vaiṣṇaver pāche,    pratisthāśā āche,
tā’te kabhu nahe anitya-vaibhava

(5) Why do you needlessly suffer the torment of blaspheming the devotees of Lord Hari, attempting to achieve their eminence, thereby only proving your own fruitless foolishness? The desire for spiritual eminence is easily fulfilled when one becomes a devotee of the Lord, for eternal fame automatically follows the heels of a Vaiṣṇava. And that fame is never to be considered a temporary worldly opulence.

metadata.title: Vaiṣṇava Ke?
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Blaspheming devotees of Lord Hari leads to fruitless foolishness, while becoming a devotee of the Lord brings eternal fame.

text:
se hari-sambandha,    śūnya-māyā-gandha,
tāhā kobhu noy jaḍer kaitava
pratiṣṭhā-chaṇḍālī,    nirjanatā-jāli,
ubhaye jāniho māyika raurava

(6) The relationship between a devotee and Lord Hari is devoid of even a trace of worldly illusion; it has nothing to do with the materialistic cheating propensity. The prestige of so-called popularity in the material realm is compared to a treacherous dog-eating witch, and the attempt to live in solitude to supposedly engage in unalloyed bhajan is compared to an entangling network of distraction. Please know that anyone striving in either of these ways verily lives in the hell of Māyā’s illusion.

metadata.title: Vaiṣṇava Ke?
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The relationship between a devotee and Lord Hari is devoid of worldly illusion and materialistic cheating propensity.

text:
kīrtana chāḍibo,    pratiṣṭhā māgibo,
ki kāja ḍhuḍiyā tādṛśa gaurava
mādhavendra purī,    bhāva-ghore churi,
nā korilo kobhu sadāi jānabo

(7) “I shall give up chanting the Lord’s Name publicly in kīrtan and retire to solitude, thus smearing myself with worldly honour.” Dear mind, what is the good of seeking such so-called glory? I will always remind you that the great soul Mādhavendra Purī never deceived himself in that regard by committing theft in his own storehouse of perception the way you do.

metadata.title: Vaiṣṇava Ke?
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker reflects on the futility of seeking worldly honour and compares it to Mādhavendra Purī's self-control.

text:
tomāra pratiṣṭhā,—    śūkarera biṣṭhā,
tār-saha sama kabhu nā mānava
matsaratā-vaśe,    tumi jaḍa-rase,
ma’jecho chāḍiyā kīrtana-sauṣṭava

(8) Your cheap reputation is equal to the stool of a hog. An ordinary ambitious man like you can never be equated with a devotee of Mādhavendra Purī’s eminence. Under the sway of envy, you have drowned yourself in the filthy waters of material enjoyment after having abandoned the excellent perfection of congregational kīrtan.

metadata.title: Vaiṣṇava Ke?
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Nityānanda Prabhu criticizes a devotee for abandoning kīrtan for material enjoyment.

text:
tāi duṣṭa mana,    nirjana bhajan,
prachāricho chole kuyogī-vaibhava
prabhu sanātane,    parama jatane,
śikṣā dilo jāhā, chinto sei saba

(9) Truly, Oh wicked mind, the glories of so-called solitary worship are propagated only by false yogīs using unscrupulous means to deceive others. To save yourself from these pitfalls, please contemplate the instructions that the Supreme Lord Śrī Chaitanya Mahāprabhu kindly gave us while addressing Śrīla Sanātan Goswāmī with the utmost care.

metadata.title: Vaiṣṇava Ke?
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Chaitanya Mahāprabhu gave instructions to Śrīla Sanātan Goswāmī to save oneself from the pitfalls of solitary worship.

text:
sei duṭi kathā,    bhulo’ nā sarvathā,
uchaiḥ-svare kara hari-nāma-rava
phalgu āro jukta,    baddha āro mukta,
kabhu nā bhāviho, ‘ekākār’ saba

(10) Do not forget for a moment the two most valuable concepts that He taught: 1) the principle of dry, apparent renunciation as opposed to real, appropriate renunciation; and 2) the principle of a soul being trapped in the bondage of matter as opposed to a soul who is liberated. Don’t ever make the mistake of thinking that these conflicting concepts are on the same level. Please remember this while engaging yourself in chanting the Lord ’s Holy Names as loud as you possibly can.

metadata.title: Vaiṣṇava Ke?
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The importance of understanding the difference between dry and real renunciation, and being trapped in matter versus being liberated.

text:
kanaka-kāminī,    pratiṣṭhā-bāghinī,
chāḍiyāche jāre, sei to’ vaiṣṇava
sei anāsakta,    sei śuddha-bhakta,
saṁsāra tathā pāy parābhava

(11) One is truly a Vaiṣṇava who has given up the habit of falling victim to the ferocious tigress of wealth, beauty, and fame. Such a soul is factually detached from material life, and is known as a pure devotee. Someone with this consciousness of detachment has thereby become victorious over the mundane world of birth and death.

metadata.title: Vaiṣṇava Ke?
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A Vaiṣṇava is one who has given up attachment to material wealth, beauty, and fame.

text:
yathā-jogya bhoga,    nāhi tathā roga,
anāsakta sei, ki āro kahabo
āsakti-rohita,    sambandha-sohito,
viṣoya-samūha sakali mādhava

(12) One is indeed detached who moderately partakes of worldly things that are deemed necessary for living in devotional service; a devotee acting in that manner does not fall prey to the disease of material infatuation. Thus devoid of selfish attachment, and endowed with the ability to see things in relation to the Lord, all sense objects are then directly perceived as being Lord Mādhava Himself.

metadata.title: Vaiṣṇava Ke?
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee who moderately partakes of worldly things necessary for living in devotional service is detached from material infatuation.

text:
se jukta-vairāgya,    tāhā to’ saubhāgya,
tāhāi jaḍete harir vaibhava
kīrtane jāhār,    pratiṣṭhā-sambhār,
tāhār sampatti kevala kaitava

(13) This is the standard of befitting renunciation, and one who realizes this is most fortunate indeed. Everything involved in such a devotee’s life represents Lord Hari’s personal spiritual opulence as manifest in the world of matter. On the other hand, one who engages in chanting the Lord’s Name with hopes of enhancing his own material reputation finds that all his activities and paraphernalia represent only the riches of hypocrisy.

metadata.title: Vaiṣṇava Ke?
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee who practices befitting renunciation is most fortunate, while one who chants for material gain is hypocritical.

text:
viṣoya-mumukṣu,    bhoger bubhukṣu,
du’ye tyajo mana, dui avaiṣṇava
kṛṣṇer sambandha,    aprākṛta-skandha,
kobhu nāhe tāhā jaḍer sambhava

(14) Oh mind, please reject the company of two types of persons — those desiring impersonal liberation from the material world, and those who desire to enjoy the pleasure of material sense objects. Both of these are equally non-devotees. The things that are used in relation to Lord Krishna are objects belonging directly to the transcendental realm, and thus having nothing to do with matter they cannot be either owned or forsaken by persons interested in mundane enjoyment or renunciation.

metadata.title: Vaiṣṇava Ke?
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The mind should reject the company of those who desire impersonal liberation or material sense pleasure, as they are non-devotees.

text:
māyāvādī jana,    kṛṣṇetara mana,
mukta abhimāne se ninde vaiṣṇava
vaiṣṇavera dāsa,    tava bhakti-āśa,
keno vā ḍākicho nirjana-āhava

(15) An impersonal philospher is opposed to thinking of Krishna as an object of devotion, and thus being puffed up with the false pride of imaginary liberation he dares to criticize the true devotees of the Lord. Oh mind, you are the servant of the Vaiṣṇavas, and you should always hope for attaining devotion. Why then do you make such a loud commotion by calling to me and trying to prove the supposed supremacy of your practice of solitary worship?

metadata.title: Vaiṣṇava Ke?
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Impersonal philosophers criticize devotees of Krishna, but true devotion comes from serving the Vaiṣṇavas.

text:
je phalgu-vairāgī,    kohe nije tyāgī,
se nā pāre kobhu hoite vaiṣṇava
hari-pada chāḍi’,    nirjanatā bāḍi,
labhiyā ki phol, phalgu se vaibhava

(16) One who falsely gives up things that could actually be used in the Lord’s service proudly calls himself a ‘renunciate,’ but unfortunately he can never become a Vaiṣṇava by such an attitude. Abandoning his servitorship to the lotus feet of Lord Hari, and resigning himself to his solitary home — whatever is gained by that exercise can only be the worthless treasure of deception.

metadata.title: Vaiṣṇava Ke?
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.scripture_source: Nectar of Devotion (Śrī Nectar of Devotion)
metadata.summary: A false renunciate can never become a true Vaiṣṇava by abandoning service to Lord Hari.

text:
rādhā-dāsye rohi,    chāḍi bhoga-ahi,
pratiṣṭhāśā nahe kīrtana-gaurava
rādhā-nitya-jana,    tāhā chāḍi mana,
keno vā nirjana-bhajana-kaitava

(17) Ever engage yourself in the service of Śrī Rādhā, and keep aloof from the vicious snake of materialistic sense gratification. The glory of participating in the Lord’s kīrtan is not meant to bolster anyone’s ambitions for personal recognition. Oh mind, why then have you abandoned the identity of being Rādhā’s eternal servant in favour of retiring to a solitary place to practice the cheating process of so-called bhajan?

metadata.title: Vaiṣṇava Ke?
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The text advises to engage in the service of Śrī Rādhā and avoid materialistic sense gratification.

text:
vraja-vāsī-gaṇa,    prachāraka-dhana,
pratiṣṭhā-bhikṣuka tārā nahe śava
prāṇa āche tāra,    se-hetu prachāra,
pratiṣṭhāśā-hīna-‘kṛṣṇa-gāthā’ saba

(18) The most valuable treasures amongst the Lord’s preachers are the eternal personalities residing in Vraja-dhām. They never occupy themselves with begging for worthless material reputation, which is cherished only by the living dead. The Vraja-vāsīs are truly infused with life, and therefore they preach in order to give life to the walking corpses of the mundane world. All the songs that the Vraja-vāsīs sing about the glories of Lord Krishna are devoid of any tinge of desire for fame.

metadata.title: Vaiṣṇava Ke?
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The Vraja-vāsīs, the Lord’s preachers, are eternal personalities who preach to give life to the mundane world, singing songs about Lord Krishna’s glories without desire for fame.

text:
śrī-dayita-dāsa,    kīrtanete āśa,
kara uchaiḥ-svare harināma rava
kīrtana-prabhāve,    smaraṇa svabhāve,
se kāle bhajana-nirjana sambhava

(19) This humble servant of Rādhā and Her beloved Krishna always hopes for kīrtan, and he begs all to loudly sing the Names of Lord Hari. The transcendental power of congregational chanting automatically awakens remembrance of the Lord and His divine Pastimes in relation to one’s own eternal spiritual form. Only at that time does it become possible to go off to a solitary place and engage in the confidential worship of Their Lordships.

metadata.title: Vaiṣṇava Ke?
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The transcendental power of congregational chanting awakens remembrance of the Lord and His divine Pastimes.

text:
---------------
Kobe ho’be bolo
kobe ho’be bolo se-dina āmār
(āmār) aparādha ghuchi’,    śuddha nāme ruchi,
kṛpā-bole ho’be hṛdoye sañchār

(1) Please tell me, when will that day be mine—when my offences will end and a taste for the pure Holy Name will be infused within my heart by the power of divine grace?

metadata.title: Kobe ho’be bolo
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee prays for the day when their offenses will end and they will develop a taste for the pure Holy Name.

text:
tṛṇādhika hīna,    kobe nije māni,
sahiṣṇutā-guṇa hṛdoyete āni’
sakale mānada,    āpani amānī,
hoye āsvādibo nāma-rasa-sār

(2) Considering myself lower than a blade of grass, bringing the quality of forbearance into my heart, showing respect to all, myself being freed from all false pride — when will I taste the essence of the liquid nectar of the Holy Name?

metadata.title: Kobe ho’be bolo
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee expresses a desire to taste the essence of the Holy Name, considering himself humble and free from pride.

text:
dhona jon āra,    kobitā-sundarī,
bolibo nā chāhi deho-sukha-karī
janme-janme dāo,    ohe gaurahari!
ahaitukī bhakti charaṇe tomār

(3) Wealth, following, beautiful women, as described in worldly poetry—I do not want any such bodily pleasures. O Lord Gaurahari, please give me unmotivated devotion to Your lotus feet, birth after birth.

metadata.title: Kobe ho’be bolo
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker renounces worldly pleasures and asks for devotion to Lord Gaurahari's lotus feet.

text:
(kobe) korite śrī-kṛṣṇa-    nāma uchāraṇa,
pulakita deho gadgada vachana
baibarṇya-bepathu    hobe saṅghaṭana,
nirantara netre bo’be aśru-dhār

(4) When, while articulating the divine Name of Śrī Krishna, will my body be thrilled in ecstatic rapture and my words choked with emotion? When will pallor and ecstatic trembling occur, and when will streams of tears flow constantly from my eyes?

metadata.title: Kobe ho’be bolo
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker expresses a desire to experience ecstatic love for Śrī Krishna through chanting His name.

text:
kobe navadvīpe,    suradhunī-taṭe,
‘gaura-nityānanda’ boli’ niṣkapaṭe
nāchiyā gāiyā,    beḍāibo chuṭe,
bātulera prāya chāḍiyā vichār

(5) When, in the land of Nabadwīp, on the banks of the Ganges, will I run about, guilelessly calling, “O Gaura! O Nityānanda!” dancing and singing like a madman, giving up all considerations?

metadata.title: Kobe ho’be bolo
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee's longing to dance and sing in the land of Nabadwīp, calling out to Gaura and Nityānanda.

text:
kobe nityānanda,    more kori’ dayā,
chāḍāibe mora viṣoyera māyā
diyā more nija-    charaṇera chāyā,
nāmera hāṭete dibe adhikār

(6) When will Lord Nityānanda be merciful to me and release me from the illusion of worldliness? Giving me the shade of His lotus feet, when will He allow me to enter the marketplace of the Holy Name?

metadata.title: Kobe ho’be bolo
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee prays for Lord Nityānanda's mercy to free him from worldly illusion and allow him to engage in the Holy Name.

text:
kinibo, luṭibo,    hari-nāma-rasa,
nāma-rase māti’ hoibo vivaśa
rasera rasika-    charaṇa paraśa,
koriyā mojibo rase anibār

(7) I shall buy and plunder the mellow of the Name Hari, and becoming thoroughly intoxicated by those liquid mellows of the Holy Name, I shall become stunned. By touching the feet of those great souls who are able to relish those mellows, I will be constantly immersed in the sweet nectar of the Holy Name.

metadata.title: Kobe ho’be bolo
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker expresses their desire to be immersed in the sweet nectar of the Holy Name Hari.

text:
kobe jīve dayā,    hoibe udoya,
nija-sukha bhuli’ sudīna-hṛdoya
bhakativinoda,    koriyā binoya,
śrī-ājñā-ṭoholo koribe prachār

(8) When will there be an awakening of compassion for all fallen souls, and when will this Bhakti Vinod, forgetting his own happines, with a meek heart set out to propagate by humble entreaty the sacred order of Śrī Chaitanya Mahāprabhu?

metadata.title: Kobe ho’be bolo
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A prayer for the awakening of compassion for fallen souls and the propagation of Śrī Chaitanya Mahāprabhu's teachings.

text:

Dainyātmikā
(prabhu he!)
emona durmati,    saṁsāra bhitore,
poḍiyā āchinu āmi
tava nija-jana,    kono mahājane,
pāṭhāiyā dile tumi

(1) A wicked mind brought me into this world, O Lord, but one of Your pure and elevated devotees has come to bring me out.

metadata.title: Dainyātmikā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee is sent by Kṛṣṇa to rescue a person from the material world.

text:
dayā kori more,    patita dekhiyā,
kohilo āmāre giyā
ohe dīna-jon,    śuno bhālo kathā
ullasita ho’be hiyā

(2) He saw me so fallen and wretched, took pity, and came to me saying, “O humbled soul, please listen to this good tiding, for it will gladden your heart.”

metadata.title: Dainyātmikā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Caitanya Mahāprabhu takes pity on a fallen soul and offers them good news.

text:
tomāre tārite,    śrī-kṛṣṇa-chaitanya,
nabadvīpe avatār
tomā heno koto,    dīna hīna jone,
korilena bhava-pār

(3) “Śrī Krishna Chaitanya has appeared in the land of Nabadwīp to deliver you. He has safely conducted many miserable souls such as you across the sea of worldly existence.”

metadata.title: Dainyātmikā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Krishna Chaitanya has appeared in Nabadwīp to deliver souls from worldly existence.

text:
vedera pratijñā,    rākhibāra tore,
rukma-varṇa vipra-suta
mahāprabhu nāme,    nadīyā mātāya,
soṅge bhāi avadhūta

(4) “To fulfil the promise of the Vedas, the son of a brāhmaṇ, bearing the Name Mahāprabhu of golden complexion, has descended with His brother, the avadhūt Nityānanda. Together They have overwhelmed all of Nadia with divine ecstasy.

metadata.title: Dainyātmikā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The text describes the descent of Mahāprabhu and Nityānanda to Nadia.

text:
nanda suta jini,    chaitanya gosāi,
nija-nāma kori’ dāna
tārilo jagat,    tumi-o jāiyā,
loho nija-paritrāṇa

(5) “Śrī Chaitanya, who is Krishna Himself, the son of Nanda, has saved the world by freely distributing His own Holy Name. Go also and receive your deliverance.”

metadata.title: Dainyātmikā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Śrī Chaitanya, the son of Nanda, has saved the world by distributing His own Holy Name.

text:
se kathā śuniyā,    āsiyāchi, nātha!
tomāra charaṇa-tole
bhakativinoda,    kā̐diyā kā̐diyā,
āpana-kāhinī bole

(6) O Lord, hearing those words, Bhakti Vinod has come weeping to the soles of Your lotus feet and tells the story of his life.

metadata.title: Dainyātmikā
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Bhakti Vinod comes to the Lord's feet and shares his life story.

text:
-----------------
Dainya O Prapatti
hari he dayāla mora jaya rādhā-nātha
bāro bāro ei-bāro loho nija sātha

(1) O Hari! O my merciful Lord! All glories to You, the Lord of Rādhā! Many times I have avoided You, but this time please take me as Your own.

metadata.title: Dainya O Prapatti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee requests Lord Hari to accept him as His own.

text:
bahu joni bhrami nātha! loinu śaraṇa
nija-guṇe kṛpā kara adhama tāraṇa

(2) O Lord, after wandering through many wombs, I have taken refuge in You. Be merciful and deliver this wretched soul by Your divine power.

metadata.title: Dainya O Prapatti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee seeks refuge in Lord Kṛṣṇa and asks for deliverance.

text:
jagata-kāraṇa tumi jagata-jīvana
tomā chāḍā kāro na’hi he rādhā-ramaṇa

(3) O lover of Rādhā, You are the cause of the universe and the life of the universe. Without You no-one has anything.

metadata.title: Dainya O Prapatti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee addresses Kṛṣṇa as the cause and life of the universe, emphasizing his importance.

text:
bhuvana-maṅgala tumi bhuvanera pati
tumi upekṣile nātha, ki hoibe gati

(4) You bring about auspiciousness for the world, and You are the master of all the worlds as well. O Lord, what will be my refuge if You neglect me?

metadata.title: Dainya O Prapatti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee expresses his dependence on the Lord and asks for refuge.

text:
bhāviyā dekhinu ei jagata-mājhāre
tomā vinā keho nāhi e dāse uddhāre

(5) I have considered that in this world there is no one except You who can deliver this fallen servant.

metadata.title: Dainya O Prapatti
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee expresses their dependence on Kṛṣṇa for deliverance.

text:

Ātma-nivedana
ātma-nivedana,    tuyā pade kori,
hoinu parama sukhī
duḥkha dūre gelo,    chintā nā rohilo,
chaudike ānanda dekhi

(1) I have become supremely joyful by surrendering myself at Your holy feet. Unhappiness has gone away, and there are no more anxieties. I see joy in all directions.

metadata.title: Ātma-nivedana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee experiences supreme joy and relief from unhappiness and anxiety after surrendering to Kṛṣṇa.

text:
aśoka-abhaya,    amṛta-ādhāra,
tomāra charaṇa-dvaya
tāhāte ekhona,    viśrāma lobhiyā
chāḍinu bhavera bhaya

(2) Your two lotus feet are reservoirs of immortal nectar where one may live free from sorrow and fear. I have found peace there now and have given up the fear of worldly existence.

metadata.title: Ātma-nivedana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The devotee has found peace in the lotus feet of the Lord and has given up worldly fear.

text:
tomāra saṁsāre,    koribo sevana,
nahibo phalera bhāgī
tava sukha jāhe,    koribo jatana,
ho’ye pade anurāgī

(3) I shall render service in Your household and not endeavour to enjoy the fruits of that service, but rather I shall strive for whatever pleases You, fully devoted to Your lotus feet.

metadata.title: Ātma-nivedana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: A devotee's vow to serve Kṛṣṇa selflessly, without attachment to rewards.

text:
tomāra sevāya,    duḥkha hoya jato,
seo to’ parama sukha
sevā-sukha-duḥkha,    parama sampada
nāśoye avidyā-duḥkha

(4) Troubles encountered in Your service shall be the cause of great happiness, for in Your devotional service joy and sorrow are equally great riches. Both destroy the misery of ignorance.

metadata.title: Ātma-nivedana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Devotional service to Kṛṣṇa brings happiness and destroys the misery of ignorance.

text:
pūrva itihāsa,    bhulinu sakala,
sevā-sukha pe’ye mane
āmi to’ tomāra,    tumi to’ āmāra,
ki kāja apara dhane

(5) I have completely forgotten all past history by feeling great joy in my mind. I am most certainly Yours, and You are indeed mine. What need is there of any other treasure?

metadata.title: Ātma-nivedana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: The speaker feels great joy and devotion, considering themselves and Kṛṣṇa to be each other's property.

text:
bhakativinoda,    ānande ḍubiyā,
tomāra sevāra tore
saba cheṣṭā kore,    tava ichā-mata,
thākiyā tomāra ghore

(6) Bhakti Vinod, diving into the ocean of bliss, devotes all his efforts for Your service and dwells in Your house according to Your wishes.

metadata.title: Ātma-nivedana
metadata.author: Unknown
metadata.summary: Bhakti Vinod devotes himself to Kṛṣṇa's service and lives in His house according to His wishes.
